She is married and has five children, with three below the ages of fifteen years. The entire family lives in a three-room apartment house at Bayelle, Bamenda, Northwest region of Cameroon.

She has gone through enormous difficulties in her life like inadequate capital to start up a business, and general poverty within the family, so much that she is unable to take care of her children’s education and health needs. The sudden death of her sister also was heartbreaking and one of her children being sick for two years. 

This loan will be used to buy beans, rice, fuel wood, and palm oil in greater quantities and more of other provision items.

This activity will succeed because she is well located; the increase in the demand for her business’ products within her community, and longevity. Thus she has many customers. 

It is helpful to the community because they will buy their little provision items from within, thus saving the cost of transportation. The profits will help improve the healthcare of the family, provide better education to her children, and a general increase in their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, fuel wood, and palm oil in greater quantities.

loans.name: Gilda

texts.es:
Gilda, de 48 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora, alegre y carismática.
Está casada  con Lucio quien es docente, fruto de esa unión tienen 3 hijos; Leyder, Patricia y Elar de 26, 23 y 21 años de edad respectivamente, habitando una casa que es de su propiedad la cual lograron comprar a base de mucho esfuerzo. La actividad que realiza Gilda  es la venta de comidas, como menús y platos extras, contando con un pequeño local que logró ambientar en su propia casa, en donde puso sus mesas y sillas necesarias para atender cómodamente a sus clientes, con sus deliciosos platillos, con la buena sazón de casa que aprendió de su madre,  logrando ganarse la preferencia de sus clientes. También realiza la costura de ropas interiores por las tardes, logrando ganarse muchos  clientes por su buena atención.
Se inició  hace más de 6 años, tiempo que viene funcionando su negocio y viene atendiendo con el apoyo de una ayudante que le ayuda  y a la que paga por mes.
Le gusta su actividad por  tener un ingreso económico con el cual apoya en los gastos del hogar a su pareja, ya que muchas veces con los ingresos de empleado en una entidad privada de su pareja no les alcanzaba, entonces decidió iniciar su negocio. Por  otro lado,  no le gusta su actividad pues resulta ser agotador al termino de cada día de trabajo, pero eso no la desanima y sigue trabajando deseosa de progresar. Por eso tiene planes de hacer crecer su negocio, mejorar sus ambientes y variar sus platillos, además de poner una venta de verduras en el frontis de su casa. Este es el préstamo número 13 con la institución MFP, se siente contenta y agradecida por la oportunidad de contar con una línea de crédito para poder avanzar con su negocio, por eso se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en créditos anteriores. Además se siente cómoda con el grupo comunal que conforma, ya que considera a sus miembros ser personas responsable y comprometidas con sus obligaciones. Con el monto solicitado de 2600 nuevo soles. Los invertirá en la compra de ingredientes para la preparación de comidas, como arroz, aceites, menestras y demás, buscando menores precios para obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Gilda is 48 years old. She is a hard working and enterprising woman, happy and charismatic. She is married to Lucio who is a teacher, and they have 3 children, Leyder, Patricia and Elar of 26, 23, and 21 years of age respectively, living in their own house which they managed to buy through their many efforts.

Gilda sells food, from a menu with extra dishes, in a small facility that she adapted in her own home, where she put the tables and chairs needed to accommodate her customers, with delicious dishes, with good homemade flavors that she learned from her mother, earning the appreciation of her clients. She also sews undergarments in the evenings, winning many clients through her good service. She started her business more than six years ago, and has an assistant helping whom she pays monthly. 

She likes her work because she has an income that helps her husband with the household expenses, because many times the earnings of her husband as an employee of a private entity was not enough, so she decided to start her business. On the other hand she does not like it because she is exhausted at the end of each working day. But that does not discourage her and she continues working wanting to get ahead. This is why she has plans to grow her business, improving the atmosphere and varying the dishes, and also she wants to sell vegetables in front of her house.

This is her 13th loan through MFP. She feels happy and grateful for the opportunity to have a line of credit so that she can get ahead in her business, and thus she agrees to complete payment of the loans as she has with previous ones. Furthermore, she feels comfortable with the communal group that she is a member of as she considers them to be responsible and committed people with their obligations. With the requested amount of 2600 soles she will invest in the purchase of ingredients for the preparation of food, such as rice, oil, beans and other items searching for low prices in order to have higher profits.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, and beans for the delicious homemade food she prepares in her home-based business

loans.name: Sat's Group

texts.en:
Sat, 47, lives in Dambae, a rural area in Kampong Cham District, Cambodia. She is married and has four children.

For the past twenty years Sat has farmed rice in a one-hectare paddy and grown cassava on a 2.5-hectare field. She is able to earn about 30,000 KHR a day and manages to save around 10,000 KHR a day.

Sat previously received a loan through Kiva’s partner VisionFund, which helped her to ease her family’s life and improve her farm. Sat is now the leader of a group of two (she and Boeurn, shown here) applying for a loan with VisionFund. She plans to use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and pay for laborers to work her land.

Sat hopes to increase her crops’ yield so as to make more money and fulfill her dream of building a decent house for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for laborers to work her land.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.es:
Erlinda, de 61 años, es una mujer amable, buena y trabajadora.  Está casada con Silvio quien es comerciante, ella es madre de 3 hijos quienes ya son mayores e independientes, ahora solo trabaja para ella y su nieta de 13 años a quien educa y cría pues desea hacerla un elemento bueno para la sociedad. Durante los días de la semana, Erlinda se dedica a la confección de sabanas de diversos diseños, además de algunas fundas para almohadas, muebles y juegos completos de dormitorio, tiene su pequeño taller que acondicionó en  su casa donde realiza todo su trabajo. 
Lleva con éste negocio más de 12 años, en algunas ocasiones recibe la ayuda de sus hijas o de su nieta, pues ella sale a ofrecer sus productos los fines de semana a amigos, vecinos y familiares o a cualquier cliente que desee tener una juego de dormitorio de buena calidad y a muy buen precio.
Considera rentable su negocio por las buenas ganancias que le deja.
Le gusta su trabajo pues le permite tener tiempo para ver a sus animalitos y a sus plantas ya que uno de sus pasatiempos favoritos es sembrar flores en su jardín. Tiene muchos planes a futuro ya que desea seguir creciendo y haciendo prosperar su negocio. Por tanto desea continuar con su negocio. Este será el crédito número 12 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un respaldo financiero ya que le dará la garantía de seguir trabajando tranquila, ella por su parte está comprometida en seguir siendo una socia puntual en sus cuotas así como fue en anteriores créditos que tuvo.  Además está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos sus integrantes son muy responsables y solidarios. Con el monto solicitado 4000 soles, comprará materiales para seguir haciendo su trabajo como telas para sabanas, hilos, elásticos, entre otros, y lograr aumentar su producción, buscando precios bajos por sus compras en volumen.
texts.en: Erlinda is a kind, friendly, hard-working 61 year old woman. She is married to Silvio, who is a shopkeeper, and is the mother of 3 grown children. Now, she works only for herself and her 13 year old granddaughter, whom she is educating and raising to make a positive contribution to society. On weekdays, Erlinda works making sheets of various designs, as well as covers for pillows and furniture, and complete bedroom sets. She has a small workshop in her home where she completes all of her work. She has worked in this business for more than 12 years, sometimes receiving help from her children and granddaughter. On the weekends, Erlinda goes to sell her products to friends, neighbors, acquaintances, or any customers who would like to have a set of good quality bedding at a very good price. Her business is profitable thanks to her good sales and earnings. Erlinda likes her job because it allows her time to take care of her animals and plants, and one of her favorite hobbies is to plant flowers in her garden. She has many plans for the future and would like to continue growing her business and making it prosper. Above all, she wants to continue her business. This will be her 12th loan with MFP, and she is very happy to know that she has financial backing that will allow her to work with peace of mind. For her part, Erlinda is committed to making her payments on time and continuing to be a member in good standing, as she has been for the other loans she has had. She is also very happy to belong to the community bank, because all of the other members are very responsible and caring. With the 4000 soles she is asking for, Erlinda will buy materials to continue doing her work, such as fabrics for sheets, thread, and elastic, among other items. She will increase her production and be able to look for low prices for buying materials in bulk.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics to make bedding, thread, and elastic

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria, a 38-year-old married mother of six, has a small plantation upon which she has been growing cabbages, green beans, tomatoes, black pepper, carrots, and round cabbages to earn a living for the past year.

A member of SPBD since 2011, she has requested a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizers, weed spray, a hose, shovels, and a rake. With her profits, Maria hopes to improve the business to help her children's education and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy weed spray, fertilizers, shovels, a hose, and bush knives.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a married man. He has five children. He describes himself to be a committed man. He operates a retail store, where he sells items such as maize flour, sugar, margarine, salt, bread, soda, etc. He has been involved in this business for 13 years. His business is located at a strategic business area, and his primary customers are local residents. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use the 14,070 Kenyan shillings loan to buy a water pump and water connection pipes. His business goal is to improve his farming business within five years. He hopes, that in the future, he will expand his business to be able to educate his children. In addition, Patrick also does farming. The water pump and water connection pipes will help his seven family members access the clean water from their tank. This is his sixth loan from SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy water pipes to access clean water.

loans.name: Raed

texts.en:
Shown here next to his rig, Raed is 37, single and lives with his mother and his elder sister. He is responsible for all of their living costs.

For the past eighteen years Raed has been a trucker, hauling goods from one place to another. It’s been a profitable business.

Raed is applying for a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of maintenance on his rig, such as replacing the engine and buying new tires and mirrors. This will increase his ability to work extra hours and take on additional long-haul jobs. All this will improve Raed's income.

loans.use: to cover the cost of maintenance on his rig.

loans.name: Tserendorj

texts.en:
Tserendorj, who is 54 years old, lives with his wife and son in an apartment, in Gobisumber province. His wife works as a salesperson in a trading center, and his son goes to college. 

Tserendorj studied as an electrical engineer in Mongolian Science Technology University in 2000.  He worked as an engineer in his half-nephew`s company until 2010. Since 2011, he started the eco-business to import and repair solar electric generators. 

Last year, because he was a winner of state tendering, he won the right to supply the solar electric system to all residents of his province. Now he sells 10 solar generators a month. He plans to import TV's, antennas, and refrigerators powered by solar energy for herders. Therefore, he is asking a MNT 3,500,000 loan for that purpose.

loans.use: To import TV's, antennas, and refrigerators powered by solar energy for herders.

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en:
Commercial management and harbor cruise is the selected study program of Marlon. Currently, he is a student at the Academy of Maritime Nusantara. He wants to work in a shipping company or at the major ports in Indonesia. 

Marlon's parents are very supportive and eager to help Marlon to complete his education. Marlon's father is just a motorcycle taxi driver whose income is uncertain. Sometimes, to meet daily needs, he has to borrow from the neighbors or relatives of the parents. At the same time, three of Marlon's brothers also need money for school. Marlon hopes to get a student loan from Kiva, which can ease the burden on his parents. Marlon thanks the lenders throughout the world, although he does not personally know them.

loans.use: To pay education fees for three years

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen, de 54 años, es una mujer alegre y trabajadora.  Está casada con su esposo Pablo desde hace muchos años.  Viven en su casa propia junto a su cuñado. Tuvo 4 hijos hijos que ya son mayores e independientes, pero la visitan constantemente. Carmen durante su trabajo, realiza muchas actividades, pero la principal es la venta de abarrotes, tiene un pequeña bodega acondicionada en su casa en donde espera a sus clientes que van en busca de cualquier tipo de producto que están seguros de encontrar ahí. Lleva haciendo éste trabajo más de 9  años, y cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo.
Considera su negocio rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja.
 Le gusta su trabajo pues  es independiente, tiene tiempo disponible para realizar otras actividades, además de poder asistir de manera puntual y tranquila a su empleo como docente de una institución educativa de la ciudad. En su negocio siempre tiene clientes, además como mantuvo un buen record de compras de una distribuidoras de gaseosas, le pusieron una exhibidoras para sus productos, ella tiene grandes planes con su negocio, como hacerlo crecer, ella cree que más adelante podrá ampliar ya que uno de sus proyectos primordiales es el de agrandar su tienda de abarrotes. Este es el crédito número 19 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un poyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio, por su parte ella se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo.  Además está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos son muy responsables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, comprará más mercaderías para ofrecer ya que los abarrotes están experimentando un cambio de precio y ella desea tener en mayor cantidad para poder vender a precio bajo y seguir teniendo a sus clientes contentos.
texts.en:
Carmen, 54 years old, is a happy and hard-working woman.  She has been married to her husband Pablo for many years.  They live in their own house along with her brother-in-law.  She has four children who are independent adults, but who visit her frequently.  Carmen has worked doing many different things, but her main work has been a grocery store.  She has a small store set up in her home where she waits for customers who come in search of any type of product and are sure to find it there.  She has been doing this work for nine years and her husband helps her.  

She considers her business to be profitable because of the good income she earns.  She likes that her work is independent, which gives her time to do other activities, in addition to being able to being a calm and punctual teacher at a school in the city.  Her business always has customers, and in addition she has a good record of sales with beverage distributors who have given her display cases for their products.  She has big plans for her business and how it will grow.  In the future, she wants to expand since one of her main projects is to make her grocery store larger.  

This is her 19th loan with MFP and she is very happy to know that she has financial support since this makes her feel secure in moving forward with her business.  Carmen promises to make her payments on time, like she did with her past loans.  She is very happy to belong to her community bank since all the people are responsible and supportive.

With the requested loan of 1500 soles, she will purchase more merchandise since groceries are experiencing a price change and she wants to have a larger quantity to be able to sell at a low price and keep her customers happy.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Sinat's Group

texts.en:
Sinat, 36, is a married mother of two children from a district located in Kampong Cham province. For the past ten years she has sold groceries and grown cassava on her two hectares of farmland. She earns about 32,000 KHR a day and saves approximately 10,000 KHR daily after deducting expenses. The main challenge for her is the low price of cassava in the marketplace.

Sinat is the leader of a group of four. This will be her third loan with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. The past loans have helped her improve her cassava farm.

She is now leading a group of four who are applying for a loan through VisionFund. They all live in the same village in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. She will use her portion of the loan to buy more groceries to sell and fertilizer for her crops.

Sinat expects this loan will enable her to increase her income. Her ambition is to better her shop and fields and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell and fertilizer for her crops.

loans.name: Lumateh

texts.en:
She is a married woman and blessed with four children, of whom three are below the ages of fifteen years.  The entire family lives in a three-bedroom house at  Ntamulung, Bamenda, North West region of Cameroon.  She has faced many difficulties in her life, such as lack of business start-up capital, lack of finances to cater for basic needs, the death of her supportive father, ill health within her family and herself, disobedience by her children, and more. 

She intends to use this loan to purchase a new sewing machine, buttons, and cloth material.  She thinks her business will succeed because of her good business location, her experience as a seamstress, and the high demand for her services.  The activity will help the community in that it will provide tailoring services at short notice or distance and offer it services at a lower cost to community members. 

The profits will be use to better the standards of living of her entire family, that is, nutrition, healthcare, and education.  The rest of it will plough back into the business.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine, buttons, and cloth material

loans.name: Yvonne

texts.en:
Yvonne is 24 years old and single. For the past two years she has sold cosmetics and now earns 38,000 KES a month.

Yvonne has previously taken out and paid back a loan through KADET. She now wants to open a boutique. She is applying for a 60,000 KES loan to buy dresses and shoes to stock her shop.

Yvonne plans to plow all profits back into her boutique. Her dream is to see her shop grow.

loans.use: to buy dresses and shoes to stock her shop.

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.en:
Eulalia is a 50-year-old married woman and a mother of five children from Bohol, Philippines. She has been engaged in a fish-vending business for more than two years now. This is her source of income.

Eulalia works hard to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family. She plans on expanding her business; however, she lacks the money to do so. But with this loan, Eulalia will be able to make it happen and buy more fish to sell.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Assane

texts.fr:
Monsieur Assane est un commerçant depuis plus de 3 ans maintenant. Il fait du commerce de produits cosmétiques qu’il a confié à sa femme pour qu’elle s’occupe un peu et aider à la gestion de la dépense quotidienne du foyer.
Il vient solliciter un crédit de 150000F CFA pour acheter du lait pour le corps, du parfum, des crèmes éclaircissantes. Après le payement de sa dette, il envisage de renouveler le prêt  pour se concentrer dans la finition de sa maison comme cela il pourra réunir toute sa famille près de lui.
texts.en:
Assane has been working in retail business for more than three years now.  He is involved in cosmetic sales, an activity he has entrusted to his wife, so that she has something to do and can contribute to the household's day-to-day living expenses.

He is requesting a loan of 150,000 CFA francs to buy body lotions, perfumes and lightening creams.  Once his loan is repaid, he is planning to renew his loan and focus on finishing his house, so that he can have his whole family close to him.

loans.use: to buy and sell cosmetics products.

loans.name: Fredi

texts.es:
El socio es el señor Fredi, tiene 20 años de edad, y es soltero,  vive en el distrito Santiago de la ciudad del Cusco, Fredi trabaja en un restaurante, donde se dedica a hacer pizzas. Fredi trabaja hace 8 meses en este rubro y con lo que gana se paga sus estudios de industrias alimentarias en un instituto de educación superior de la ciudad.
Fredi solicita el préstamo para invertirlo en su educación y pagar sus estudios, por ello  está muy agradecido con KIVA por ayudarlo en su educación y procurarse un mejor futuro. Walter tiene un sueño a futuro, y es la de poner una  panadería, por ello trabaja y estudia y espera que su sacrificio le de resultados a mediano plazo. Fredi pertenece al banco comunal “Rumbo al Éxito-Santiago” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
Fredi is 20 years old and single.  He lives in the Santiago district of the city of Cusco.  Fredi works at a restaurant where he makes pizzas.  He has done this work for eight months and with his earnings, he is paying for his studies at a culinary school in the city.  

Fredi is asking for this loan to invest in his education and pay for his studies.  He is very thankful to KIVA for helping him with his education and giving himself a better future.  His dream in the future is to start a bakery and he is working and studying to make that happen.  He hopes that his sacrifices give him results in the medium term.  Fredi is a member of the Rumbo al Éxito-Santiago community bank in the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to pay for his studies.

loans.name: Rosaura

texts.es:
Rosaura es una mujer de 36 años, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial con sus 2 pequeños hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, lastimosamente por diversas razones se separó de su pareja, desde entonces ella dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta. 
Con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, desde hace 3 años Rosaura puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de refrescos, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, ella recorre los mercados de su ciudad vendiendo diversas bebidas, tales como: chicha, cebada, maracuyá y en épocas de invierno vende bebidas calientes, ella puede trabajar un aproximado de 10 horas diarias y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Rosaura se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la construcción de su vivienda, así también podrá comprar un cocina pequeña, vasos y embases para la venta de sus bebidas; de esta manera Rosaura contará con el material necesario para seguir trabajando y podrá tener un parte construida de su vivienda, para así vivir en ella con sus pequeños, asó ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño tener su propio restaurante y ver a sus hijos convertidos en buenos profesionales y en hombres de bien.
texts.en:
Rosaura is 36 years old. She lives in the city of Cañete, in the district of Imperial with her two small children, whom she loves and they are her reason for being. Unfortunately for various reasons she separated from her husband, and since then she dedicates all her efforts to raising her family. She is a very kind, hardworking, and enthusiastic person.

With a lot of effort and enthusiasm Rosaura began her small business three years ago selling beverages, every day beginning work in the early morning hours, she travels the city markets selling various drinks such as chicha (a common sweet drink made from purple corn), barley, and passion fruit and during winter she sells hot drinks. She can work approximately ten hours daily and she believes that things are going well because of her dedication and because of the friendly service she provides her customers.

Rosaura is a grateful Kiva borrower because thanks to the help she will be able to construct her home, and also she can buy a small stove, glasses, and containers for the sale of her beverages. In this way Rosaura will have what she needs to continue working and to have a part of her house built, as she lives in it with her children, as well as continuing to work and push herself in order to achieve her big dream of having her own restaurant and to see her children become good professionals and good men.

loans.use: to pay for construction costs for part of her home where she lives as the provider for her two small children and to buy a small stove, glasses and containers for the sale of her beverages

loans.name: Shohpari-Khonim

texts.ru: Шохпари-Хоним родилась 1994 году. Она не замужем и живет с родителями. В этом году она окончила среднюю школу и успешно поступила в филиал Московского Государственного Университета в городе Душанбе. Она очень способная девушка и хочет стать успешным специалистом. Зарплата ее родителей не хватает оплатить за учебу в университете. Она запрашивает кредит на сумму 1100 долларов США для оплаты годового учебного договора. Шохпари-Хоним ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Shohpari-Khonim was born in 1994.  She is not married and lives with her parents.  This year, she finished high school and successfully applied to the Moscow State University branch in Dushanbe.  She is a very capable young woman and wants to be a successful student.  Her parents' wages aren't enough to pay her tuition at the university.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of $1,100 (USD) for paying her yearly tuition.  Shohpari-Khonim looks forward to your kindness.

loans.use: to pay university tuition

loans.name: Mahinabony

texts.ru: Махинабону родилась 1993 года. Она очень способная девушка, окончила школу с отличием и поступила в Государственный Университет Таджикистана в юридический факультет. Махинабону хочет стать хорошим юристом. Зарплата ее родителей не хватает для оплаты учебы. Махинабону запрашивает кредит на сумму 1850 долларов США для оплаты учебы в университете. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Mahinabony was born in 1993.  She is a very capable young woman, having finished high schools with honors and entered the law school of the State University of Tajikistan.  Mahinabony wants to become a good lawyer.  

Her parents' salaries are not enough to pay her tuition.  Mahinabony is requesting a loan of $1,850 (USD) for paying her tuition.  She looks forward to your kindness.

loans.use: to pay university tuition

loans.name: Justa

texts.es:
Justa, de 47 años de edad, es una mujer muy trabajadora y alegre.  Está casada pero su esposo vive en el extranjero y ella vive sola en su casa propia en compañía de 3 hijos, ella trabaja mucho pues desea asegurar algunos ingresos para tener una vejez tranquila. Justa empieza su trabajo desde muy temprano, cuando se va a su puesto del mercado a abrir su stand donde acondiciono su salón de belleza, ahí ella empieza el día limpiando sus instrumentos de trabajo para después esperar a los clientes para hacerles buenos y bonitos cortes de pelo a caballeros y modernos cortes a mujeres, ella es dueña de dos stand en un de ellos está un trabajador que ella contrato y en el otro está ella.  
Lleva más de 21 años en éste trabajo. Considera rentable su negocio por las buenas ganancias que le deja.
En el mercado en donde trabaja la conocen muy bien, pues es una mujer carismática y siempre está en lucha por los derechos de sus compañeros de puestos quienes la quieren mucho y la conocen como una mujer luchadora.
Le gusta su trabajo al tener libertad de tiempo, siempre tiene clientes y por eso genera buenos ingresos, además ella tiene muchos proyectos en mente, le gustaría mas adelante poder mejorar su local y comprar cosas para aumentar la  variedad de productos que ofrecer a sus fieles clientes. Este es el crédito número 18 con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos, por su parte se compromete una vez mas de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos sus socios son personas responsables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará materiales de salón de belleza para hacer su trabajo como tintes, peines, maquinas de corte pelo, entre otros, pues le hace falta algunos cosméticos y productos diferentes con los que realiza su trabajo.
texts.en:
Justa, who is 47 years old, is a hard-working and happy woman. She is married, but her husband lives abroad, and she lives alone in her own house in the company of three children. She works a lot, since she want to be sure of some income to have a relaxed old age. Justa begins her work very early, when she goes to her stand at the market to open her stall where she has set up her beauty salon. There she begins the day cleaning her work instruments to then wait for customers to give good, attractive haircuts to men and modern cuts to women. She is the owner of two stands; in one of them there is a worker whom she hired, and she works in the other one.

She has been doing this work for 21 years. She considers her business profitable because of the good earnings that it gives her.

In the market where she works, she is very well known, since she is a charismatic woman and is always working for the rights of her fellow market vendors, who love her very much and know her as a hard-working woman.

She likes her work for having the freedom of time. She always has customers, and for that reason it generates a good income. In addition, she has many projects in mind. In the future, she would like to improve her working space and buy things to increase the variety of products to offer to her loyal customers.

This is her 18th loan from MFP, and so she hopes for your assistance so that she can continue with her goals. On her part, she promises once more to make her payments on time, as she did with previous loans. She is very happy to belong to her communal bank, since all its members are responsible and united people. With the 1000 PEN she has applied for, she will buy beauty salon supplies to do her work, such as dyes, combs, and machines for cutting hair, among other items, then she needs some cosmetics and different products that she uses in her work.

loans.use: to buy dyes, combs, and machines for cutting hair.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his degree granting course.

loans.name: Yulduz

texts.ru: Юлдузу 49 лет, она замужем и имеет двоих детей. Ее старший сын женатый. Юлдуз очень целеустремленная и мотивированная женщина. Ее муж получает маленькую зарплату. Это зарплата не хватает для обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами. Юлдуз решила помочь мужу для благо получения семьи. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес путем шитья женской одежды, так как имеет опыт в этом виде бизнеса. Ее невестка будет помогать ей в бизнесе.  Она запрашивает кредит на сумму 600 cомони  для покупки швейной машинки, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Yulduz is 49 years old, married, and has two children.  He eldest son is married. Yulduz is a very goal-oriented and motivated woman.  Her husband earns a small salary, which is not enough to provide the family with all the necessities.  Yulduz decided to help her husband for the sake of the family's well being.  With this goal, she received a certificate after taking a course called "Achieve Success," which was organized by the Association of Business Women.  

Now, she is entirely capable of starting her own business and to be successful in this area.  She wants to start a business in making women's clothing since she has experience in this field.  Her daughter-in-law will help her with the business.  Yulduz is requesting a loan of 600 somoni (TJS) to purchase a sewing machine to start her business.  She is looking forward to your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine to start a new business

loans.name: Pélagie Ernestine

texts.fr: Pélagie est une jeune femme de 32 ans mariée mère de 4 enfants dont l'age varie entre 3 et 14 ans tous vont à l'école. Elle est commerçante dans le domaine de la restauration depuis 4 ans. Grâce à son accueil chaleureux et à la bonne qualité des plats proposés,et surtout aux prix pratiqués, elle a acquis une clientèle considérable et de plus en plus exigente.La petitesse de son chiffre d' affaires ne lui permet plus de satisfaire les doléances variées de la clientele. en effet,ce crédit lui permettra d'acheter les casiers de boisson et les aliments(poulets cartons de poisson et les ingrédients)afin de  diversifier et augmenter les quantités de ses denrées alimentaires entrant dans la composition de ses plats, de satisfaire sa clientèle mais aussi d'augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire. elle réinvestira une partie de ce bénéfice dans son activité pour l'agrandir et le reste l'aidera à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Pélagie is a young woman, age 32, who is married and the mother of four children.  Her children's ages range between 3 and 14 years old, and they all attend school.

Pélagie has been working in the restaurant business for the past four years.  Thanks to her warm welcome, to the high quality of her dishes, and especially to her reasonable prices, she has managed to build a large customer base, which is becoming increasingly demanding.

Because her turnover is quite small, she can no longer respond to the various grievances of her customers.  This loan will help her to buy crates of drinks and fish, chicken and other ingredients.  This, in turn, will allow her to diversify and increase the quantities of the food products that she uses to prepare her meals, and therefore satisfy her customers' needs and increase her profit margin.

Pélagie will reinvest part of her profits in her business, with a view to expanding it.  The remaining part will be used to support her family.

loans.use: to buy crates of drinks and fish, chicken and other ingredients.

loans.name: Khaticha

texts.ru:
As a married parent of 5 children, Khaticha works hard to support her family. She has a clothes sales business in Tajikistan, she has had this business for 18 years and earns additional income from selling food items.

Khaticha has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from Imon International organization. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money. In the future, she hopes to improve her business in order to provide for the education of her children. She is asking for a loan of 1600 somoni buy new variety of children clothes. She awaits your support.
texts.en:
As a married parent of 5 children, Khaticha works hard to support her family. She has a clothing sales business in Tajikistan, which she has had for 18 years.  She also earns additional income from selling food items.

Khaticha has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from Imon International. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money. In the future, she hopes to improve her business in order to provide for the education of her children. She is asking for a loan of 1600 somoni buy new variety of children's clothes. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase new merchandise

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.fr: Jeannette est une femme âgée de 49 ans,mariée et mère de 04 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 11et 25 ans.trois vont à l'ecole.Elle est commerçante et vend des vivres frais dans un quartier de la capitale depuis 22 ans.Son ancienneté, sa sociabilité, la qualité de ses produits et les prix pratiqués lui ont valu une grande clientèle qu'elle a du mal à satisfaire.Elle sollicite un crédit pour augmenter les stocks de marchandises(achat des cageots de tomates)afin de satisfaire sa nombreuse clientèle et augmenter ses ventes.Les bénéfices générés lui permettront de reinvestir dans son activité et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Jeannette is a 49-year-old woman, married and the mother of four children, ages 11 to 25.  Three of her children attend school.

Jeannette is a retailer; for the past 22 years, she has been selling fresh produce in one of the neighborhoods of the capital city.  Thanks to her expertise, social skills, and to the high quality of her products and reasonable prices, she has managed to attract a large group of customers, whose needs she can no longer satisfy.

She is requesting a loan to boost her stocks of merchandise (particularly tomato crates).  This, in turn, will help her to meet the needs of her large customer base and to increase her sales.

She will use her profits to reinvest in her business and provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy crates of tomatoes.

loans.name: George

texts.en: George, who is married to Hannah, is forty three years old and a father of three children. He has a retail shop in Limuru and has been in business for twelve years now. He gets a monthly income of 56,000 KES. This will be George's seventh loan with KADET LTD, and he plans to buy things like rice, sugar, and wheat for resale. He wants to be a successful businessman in Limuru and also to fully provide for his family.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, and wheat for resale.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel has been in both the baking and farming business for a long time, and earns a good income. He has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy seeds and chemicals, and to pay for labor on his farm. He hopes to continue farming so as to raise his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy seeds and chemicals, and to pay for labor on his farm

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a business-oriented woman. She is 51 years old. She had two children who have their own families already. Aside from hog raising, she also sells cosmetic products, which is the business she wants to strengthen now. She usually gains about 5,000 Philippines pesos (P) in selling these items. She is borrowing a loan of P30,000 to invest in expanding her business. She will buy more perfumes, colognes, shampoo and cosmetics to sell to the people in her village.

Though her children have helped her in times of need, she still wants to earn income and make her business profitable to save funds for future use.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, colognes, shampoo and cosmetics to sell to the people in her village.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
This is Aida, 42, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is a mother of four children, and is married to Chuck, who is a referee. Together with her husband, Aida manages their household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Aida runs a parlor. She mainly offers hair cutting, coloring, straightening/relaxing, etc. She also offers manicures and face make-up. Her regular customers are her neighbors and members of the local community, usually women. She earns a minimum of PHP 250 in sales every day.

To help her to continue operating her business, Aida is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP. She will be using the loan to buy more equipment and beauty products for the parlor. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.  

Aida dreams of giving her family a good life through all her hard work. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more equipment and beauty products for her salon.

loans.name: Charles

texts.fr: Charles est un homme de 37 ans, marié et père de famille. Il a ouvert une mini-alimentation qu'il gère depuis 3 ans dans un quartier de la capitale. C'est grâce a elle qu'il subvient aux besoins de sa famille.Grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine et son accueil chaleureux et ses bons  rapports avec son voisinage,il a pu acquérir une très grande clientèle. L'augmentation croissante de sa clientèle rend son offre inférieure à la demande d'ou l'importance de ce crédit dans son activité.Grâce à lui il pourra acheter les produits de première nécessite(carton de savon, sac de riz, carton de sucre et cubes...)  ce qui lui permettra de satisfaire convenablement sa clientèle, d'augmenter ses ventes ainsi sa marge bénéficiaire. Il réinvestira une partie de ce bénéfice dans son activité pour l'agrandir parce qu'il rêve d'avoir une grande alimentation et le reste lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille dont il en a la charge.
texts.en:
Charles is a 37-year-old man, married, with a family.  For the past three years he has been managing a small grocery store which he opened in one of the neighborhoods of the capital city.  Thanks to this shop, he is able to provide for his family.

Thanks also to his expertise in his field, to his warm welcome and good neighborly relationships, he has managed to attract a very large group of customers.  However, an increasingly large customer base means that the demand from his customers now exceeds his supply capacity.  This is the reason why he is in need of a loan to carry out his activity.

This loan will help him to buy staple products such boxes of soap and sugar, bags of rice and (bouillon) cubes.  This, in turn, will allow him to adequately meet his customers' needs, increase his sales and his profit margin.

Since Charles' dream is to run a large grocery store, he will reinvest part of his profits in his business, with a view to expanding it.  The remaining part will be used to support his family, whom he cares for.

loans.use: to buy staple products such as boxes of soap and sugar, bags of rice and (bouillon) cubes.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 24-year-old single man. He has a mobile phone store that sells different types of mobile phones and accessories. It has been a profitable project, and it is his only source of income. He has many loyal customers, but he does not make enough to cover his costs.

Ali is requesting a 1,500 USD youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing a new collection of mobile phones and accessories that customers often request and buy. This will create a better collection in his store, which will increase his sales and improve his income.

Ali is photographed in his store.

loans.use: To purchase a new collection of mobile phones and accessories to sell

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en: Rachel is 48 years old and married. To earn a living, Rachel owns and operates a food stall. She has been in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities. Rachel aims to raise their status of living so they can educate their children and give them a bright future. Rachel hopes to improve and expand her business and make it a viable source of income. To make it possible, Rachel is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 50,000 to buy raw ingredients such as pork, chicken, and vegetables for making food to sell. This would really be a big help to her, both in satisfying her customer’s demands and in providing for her family's needs.

loans.use: To buy raw ingredients such as pork, chicken, and vegetables for making food to sell

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
Mirasol is a fish vendor from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. She is 46 years old and married with seven children. Her eldest is 26, and her youngest is 15. Her husband also works as a fisherman to help augment the family's income. Mirasol's business has been her source of livelihood for 26 years now. Aside from selling fresh fish, she also dries fish for additional income. Dried fish is a common appetizer for most Filipinos. 

She is asking for a loan to buy gasoline, repair her boat's engine, and buy sacks of rice for her family's consumption. She hopes that her business will flourish so she can send her children to school and give them a better future.

loans.use: To buy gasoline, repair her boat's engine, and buy sacks of rice

loans.name: Jumwa

texts.en:
Jumwa has been selling fish and her business is great. This will be her second business loan from KADET LTD, and she plans to use it to purchase more tilapia, prawns and sardines to resell to her customers. 

Jumwa will use the anticipated profits to buy more stock of fish and to repay her loan. She hopes to realize more profits from the sales and thus be able to expand her business further.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose previously accessed an 18,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help to the family's personal, household and business expenditures. 

Rose would like to apply for another loan of 20,000 PHP to buy more merchandise and products to increase her inventory. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better, as more items to sell will result in better profit. Rose's profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Rose dreams of giving her children a good and quality education and hopes to expand her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise needed in her business.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a 37 years old married man. He has 4 children with ages ranging from 1 years to 15 years. He describes himself to be customer friendly. 

He operates a retail business where he sells cows. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located near a busy road in a rural area and his primary customers are local residents and butcher men. He describes his biggest business challenge to be outbreak of diseases affecting many cows. 

He will use the Kes 12900 loan to buy a solar lamp which will be used by his family members for lightining. His business goal is to improve his business within 5 years. He hopes that in the future he will expand his business by buying more cows for his business. In addition, Michael sells milk which increases his business income.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
La socia es la señora Bertha, tiene 39 años de edad, es soltera y vive en el distrito de Santiago de la ciudad del Cusco, la socia tiene un almacén y se dedica al comercio de productos como cerveza, gaseosa y abarrotes en general. Bertha ha crecido mucho en esta actividad, por ello está abriendo otro almacén mas para comercializar los mismos productos y para cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por ayudarla a desarrollarse en su actividad y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente. Bertha pertenece al banco comunal “Rumbo al Éxito-Santiago” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
Bertha espera seguir creciendo empresarialmente comprar un vehículo para distribuir sus productos y en un futuro desea convertirse en una de las principales distribuidoras de los productos con los que comercia.
texts.en:
The member is Bertha. She is 39 years old, single and lives in the district of Santiago in the city of Cusco. The member has a general store and she mainly sells products such as beer, soft drinks, and groceries.  Bertha has grown a lot in this activity, so she is opening another general store to sell the same merchandise to meet the customer demand. 

The member is very grateful to Kiva for helping her to develop her activity and she agrees to make her payments on time. Bertha belongs to the communal bank Rumbo al Éxito-Santiago in the city of Cusco, Perú.

Bertha hopes to continue growing entrepreneurially to buy a vehicle in order to distribute her products and in the future she hopes to become one of the main suppliers of the products which she sells.

loans.use: to open another general store to supply soft drinks, beer and groceries to meet the customer demand

loans.name: Erastus

texts.en:
Erastus, 26 years old, is married.  He has owned a salon in Mombasa for three years. The business is doing great.

Erastus is requesting his second loan from KADET LTD to finance his business. He plans to purchase new blow dryers, hair tongs, hair foods, chemicals and rollers. Erastus will use the anticipated profits to repay his loan and to open another salon. He hopes to have a more profitable business and be able to provide for his family comfortably.

loans.use: to purchase new blow dryers, hair tongs, hair foods, chemicals and rollers

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is a married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 12 years to 16 years. She describes herself to be loving, determined and honest. 

She operates a restaurant where she sells food, tea and snacks. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located at a strategic business area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the Kes 80,000 loan to pay for the renovation of the restaurant and buy cooking pot. Her business goal is to run another similar restaurant  within 5 years. This is his fifth loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to purchase cooking pots and pay for the renovation of the restaurant.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
This is Marilyn, 36, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Jan Ruel and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Marilyn operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Marilyn hopes to grow her business and dreams to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en: Angelita has operated a grocery store in her hometown of Talibon, Bohol, Philippines, for several years. She sells various products to the people in the community. Angelita  needs more capital for the expansion of her business. She is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy more stock such as soda, food, dry goods, shampoo and other items in bulk to sell in her store. In the future, Angelita hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more stock, such as soda, food, dry goods, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Normelita

texts.en: Normelita has owned a sari-sari (convenience) store in Bien Unido, Bohol for 10 years. She sells basic household needs such as canned goods, chips, toiletries, condiments and seasonings. The income helps in supporting the needs of her family. Normelita is asking for a loan to buy more supplies of canned goods, toiletries, seasonings, snack foods and soft drinks. Normelita hopes that she can expand her business or explore other businesses that will help boost her income. The profit will supply her family with basic household needs such as their daily consumption.

loans.use: to buy more supplies of canned goods, toiletries, seasonings, snack foods and soft drinks

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
Liz, de 37 años es una mujer trabajadora y alegre. Está casada con Ricardo quien es empleado y padre de 2 niños, el primero tiene 14 años y está en etapa escolar, mientras que la menor una linda y robusta bebe recién acaba de nacer hace 6 meses y es un motivo más para ella en trabajar arduo para brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. La actividad que realiza Liz es la venta de bebidas gasificadas heladas y golosinas de diversos sabores y marcas. Para esto cuenta con una refrigeradora que compró con sus ahorros, donde  guarda a temperatura helada sus bebidas gaseosas. Instala sus estantes en el frontis de su propia casa, desde donde atiende a sus clientes con sus productos. Iniciándose con un préstamo de MFP hace más de 1 año y atendiendo ella sola de  manera cordial a sus clientes. También realza decoraciones de fiestas infantiles esporádicamente. Considera rentable su negocio por las buenas ganancias que le deja.
Le gusta su negocio pues le permite estar en casa y cuidar a sus pequeños hijos a los que quiere mucho, además de contar con  los ingresos económicos para pagar los gastos de su hogar. Por lo contrario, no le gusta cuando llueve muy seguido ya que le dificulta la venta de su producto pues depende mucho del clima para mejorar sus ventas.  Pero eso no la desanima y  tiene planes de continuar y aumentar la variedad de sus productos. Este es el crédito número 12 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos, por su parte se compromete a ser puntual en sus cuotas y así no quedar mal con el grupo al que pertenece ya que todos son muy responsables y muy buenos.
Con el monto solicitado de 1400 nuevos soles lo invertirá en su totalidad en la compra de bebidas gasificadas y golosinas de diversas marcas y sabores para tener un stock disponible para la venta, buscando precios más bajos por sus compras al contado y en volumen
texts.en:
Liz is 37 years old. She is a hard-working and happy woman. She is married to Ricardo, who is employed and is the father of two children. The first is 14 years old and is of school age, while the younger is a pretty and robust recently born baby of 6 months, who is one more reason for Liz to work hard to offer them a better quality of life. Liz's business is selling cold soft drinks and candies of various flavors and brands. To do this, she has a refrigerator that she bought with her savings. This is where she keeps her soft drinks cold. She installed her shelves at the front of her own house, where she serves her products to her customers. She began with a loan from MFP more than a year ago and tends her business alone, serving her customers in a cordial manner. From time to time, she also makes decorations for children's parties. She feels that her business is profitable because of the good earnings that it gives her.

She likes her business because it allows her to be at home and care for her little children, whom she loves very much, in addition to having the economic income to pay the household expenses. On the other hand, she doesn't like it when it rains a lot, since it is difficult for her to sell her products, since she depends a lot on the weather to improve her sales. But this does not discourage her, and she has plans to continue and to increase the variety of her products. This is her 12th loan from MFP. She is very happy to know that she will have a loan so that she can complete her goals. On her part, she promises to be on time with her payments and thus stay on good terms with the group (communal bank) she belongs to, since they are all very responsible and very good.

Of the 1400 PEN that she has applied for, she will invest it all in the purchase of soft drinks and candies of various brands and flavors to have a ready stock for sale, seeking lower prices by making her purchases for cash and in volume.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and various brands of candies for her store

loans.name: Iluminada

texts.en: Iluminada, 56 years old, is a patient mother with three children who are presently working and have own families. Iluminada manages a hog fattening and breeding business to earn a living. She doesn't want to rely on her children's remittances so she keeps improving her sales. Iluminada is now asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy vaccines, medicines and feed to maintain her hogs. The vaccines and medicines given to her hogs will ensure good nutrition and allow her to offer them at a higher price upon disposal. Iluminada hopes to someday make her business grow very well to achieve income stability and the desired success in her life.

loans.use: to buy vaccines, medicines and feed for her hogs

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en: Raquel is a 38-year-old farmer from the town of San Miguel, in the province of Bohol. She is married and has seven children whose ages range from 4 to 20 years old. Raquel and her husband grow rice for a living. She is asking for a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy fertilizer, seedlings and pesticides and to pay for labor on her rice field.  Raquel hopes to make a good return on her investment so she can continue to provide for her children's education. Her income will be used for the family's daily consumption and school fees.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seedlings and pesticides and to pay for labor

loans.name: Cristy

texts.en:
Cristy previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase quantities of raw materials such as fabric, thread and other materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children's education and the family's personal, household and business expenditures. 

Cristy would like to apply for another loan of 25,000 PHP to buy additional supplies of raw materials needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the children's educational expenses. Cristy looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Cristy dreams of giving her children a good and quality education and hopes to have a good life through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for textiles needed in her business.

loans.name: Roselie

texts.en: Roselie, 39 years old, is married and has 2 children who are in school. Roselie works very hard to provide for them. For the past 4 years, Roselie has operated a business buying and selling nipa (woven palm mats used for house repair and construction) in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of nipa to sell. In the future, Roselie would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of nipa to sell

loans.name: Jaqueline Alexandra

texts.es:
Jaqueline inicio trabajando en una ferretería,  después por motivos de salud física tuvo que cerrar su negocio. 
Actualmente vende cosméticos y tiene un pequeño centro de copiado con eso ayuda económicamente a su familia. 

Su trabajo lo hace sola desde las 8:30am hasta las 17:00pm. Unas de sus dificultades en su trabajo es la delincuencia. Jaqueline es madre soltera y tiene un hijo que estudia en escuela fiscal. Con el préstamo va a comprar perfumes, cremas y una impresora.

Unas de sus metas es poder habilitar su local y generar más ingresos para su familia y también dar empleo para quienes lo necesiten.
texts.en:
Jaqueline began working in a hardware store, then, for reasons of physical health, she had to close her business. Now she sells cosmetics and has a little copy center. With this, she helps her family economically.

She does her work alone from 8:30 am to 5:00 pm. One of the difficulties of her work is crime. Jaqueline is a single mother and has a son who goes to public school. With the loan she is going to buy perfumes, creams, and a copier.

One of her goals to be able to improve her business space and generate more income for her family and also give jobs to those who need them.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, and a printer.

loans.name: Hendritah

texts.en:
Hendritah is a 39-year-old poultry farmer in Voi. She is married to Liverson Sale and they are blessed with five school-going children. Hendritah ventured into the poultry business three years ago and her business has been doing well. She sells chicken and eggs to her customers. Hendritah also sells fruits and vegetables to supplement her income.

This is Hendritah's fourth business loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the loan to purchase more one-year-old chicks for rearing and chicken feed. The proceeds from the business will be used to expand her business and to repay her loan. Hendritah hopes to excel in this business.

loans.use: to purchase more one-year-old chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more quantities of products such as meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. Her earnings were a big help for her children's education and for the family's personal, household and business expenditures. 

Rosita would like to apply for another loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients and supplies needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and her children's educational expenses. Rosita looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Rosita hopes that her business will last and continue to help her in sustaining her family's needs. She dreams of having her own restaurant someday. She is active in attending the weekly fellowship* as she enjoys sharing God’s love and provision in her life.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Serafina

texts.es:
Serafina de 48 años, es una mujer laboriosa; esta casada con Rubén de 50 años, habitan en su propia casa que compraron durante 14 años de casados, junto a sus 07 queridos hijos. Serafina, es una mujer trabajadora, se dedica a la venta de calzados. Esta labor empezó hace 04 años y comenta que le ha ido muy bien en esta actividad, ya que siempre se moviliza a diferentes comunidades para realizar sus ventas. Su labor lo efectúa con el apoyo de su esposo, quien le acompaña en cada viaje para realizar la venta de sus zapatos (niños, jóvenes y adultos). 
El trabajo que realiza Serafina es de mucho agrado, ya que en el transcurso de sus viajes conoce a gente nueva ofreciendo sus calzados; sin embargo después de mucho recorrido termina muy cansada; aun así se esmera por seguir trabajando para salir adelante con su familia. Con el préstamo que obtuvo por los financieros, viajará a la ciudad de Lima para abastecerse de mercadería de calzados para seguir continuando con sus planes de trabajo. Este es su crédito número 04, se siente contenta con el apoyo que le brindan, ya que así seguirá con su trabajo. Asimismo se compromete a ser puntual con sus cuotas de pago como en créditos anteriores.
Con los 4,000 nuevos soles comprará sandalias, zapatos para niños, damas y caballeros.
texts.en:
Serafina, 48 years old, is a hard working woman. She is married to Rubén who is 50 years old. They live in their own home that they bought during a period of 14 years of marriage, together with their seven dear children. 

Serafina is a hard working woman who works selling shoes. This work began four years ago and she says she has done well in this work, as she is always traveling to different communities to make sales. Her work is carried out with the help of her husband, who accompanies her on each trip in order for her to sell the shoes (children, youth, and adults).

The work that Serafina does is very agreeable as in the course of her trips she meets new people while selling her shoes, but after a lot of traveling she ends up very tired, but even so she does her best to continue working in order to move her family forward.

With the loan that she obtains through lenders, she will travel to Lima in order to stock up on shoes in order to continue with her work plans. This is her fourth loan and she feels happy with the support they provide so she can continue with her work. She agrees to make her payments on time as she has done in previous loans. With the 4,000 soles she will buy sandals, and shoes for children, ladies and men.

loans.use: to buy sandals, and shoes for children, ladies and men

loans.name: María Guadalupe

texts.es:
La señora María Guadalupe esta solicitando un préstamo para invertir en su negocio de venta de ropa, ya que le esta haciendo falta mas variedad de mercancía y quiere invertir en comprar zapato, ropa de invierno para adulto y niños, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión y no quiere descapitalizar en ingreso que obtiene.
La señora María Guadalupe tiene un año que quedo viuda y se quedo con la responsabilidad de tres hijos que están estudiando. 
Desea invertir en su negocio y así obtener más ganancias, que con las cuales planea pagar el crédito, ya que los gastos familiares y escolares de sus hijos los cubrirá con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo en una bodega.
texts.en:
Señora Maria Guadalupe is applying for a loan to invest in her clothing sales business, since she needs a greater variety of merchandise. She wants to invest in buying shoes and winter clothing for adults and children, but she does not have the necessary money for the investment and she does not want to reduce the income that she obtains.

Señora Maria Guadalupe has been a widow for a year and has the responsibility for three children who are in school.

She wants to invest in her business and thus obtain more earnings, with which she plans to pay back the loan, since she will cover the family expenses and her children's school fees with the wages that she receives from her work in a store.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her clothing sales business

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en:
Rizalina, 51 years old, is from Trinidad, Bohol. She is married and has 7 children whose ages range from 10 to 25 years old. Rizalina earns a living by selling bread in her community. She works with her husband in their bakery and they also make deliveries to different sari-sari stores in her locality.

Currently, the business is doing well but Rizalina lacks additional funds to maintain her bread production. She is asking for a loan to buy flour, sugar and margarine for the bakery and gasoline for motorbike deliveries. She hopes that this loan will enable her to do better with her service and quality of baked bread, thereby attracting more customers. The income generated from this loan will provide education for her children and nutritious food for her family.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar and margarine for the bakery and gasoline for motorbike deliveries

loans.name: Nicole Anette

texts.fr: Nicole est une jeune femme de 36 ans fiancée, mère d'enfants. Elle est commerçante dans un marché de la capitale  depuis 15 ans ou elle commercialise les vivres frais (tomates, poivrons, et oignon...) en fonction des saisons. Cette activité lui permet d'aider son conjoint à resoudre certaines petits besoins quotidiens. son activté fonctionne normalement, mais ne rapporte pas beaucoup parce qu'elle achète sa marchantise en détail pour la revendre. grace à ce crédit, nicole pourra s'acheter ses marchandises en gros( des cajots de tomates, des filets d'oignons. ceci augmentera ses ventes et donc sa marge bénéficiaire. Elle économisera une partie de ce benefices pour aider son fiancé avec la scolarité de leurs enfants et le reste sera réinvesti dans son activté pour l'agrandir.
texts.en: Nicole is a 36-year old woman. She has children and is engaged to be married. For 15 years, she has been working as a vendor at the capital city’s market, where she sells produce (tomatoes, peppers, onions…) in season. This work allows her to help her partner to cover some everyday expenses. Her business is going well, but does not bring in a lot because she buys her wares at retail prices before reselling. Thanks to this loan, Nicole will be able to buy wholesale (crates of tomatoes, strings of onion etc). This will lead to an increase of her sales and thus her profit margin. She will save part of her revenues in order to help her fiancé with the education expenses for their children, and the rest will be reinvested in her business in order to grow it further.

loans.use: to buy crates of tomatoes and strings of onions.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia, es madre soltera, tiene 34 años; vive en su propia casa que compró gracias a sus esfuerzos de cada día, ya que depende de su labor puede solventar los gastos para sus dos pequeños hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Delia, se dedica a la agricultura; hace 08 años que cultiva plantas de cacao y café en su propio campo de cultivo. En los tiempos de desyerbo y cosecha siempre cuenta con el apoyo de jornaleros, ya que de esa manera logra avanzar rápido su trabajo.
Su mayor orgullo es que sus plantas le resulten con muy buena obtención para que sean bien remuneradas en su venta; sin embargo su dificultad es evadir a las plagas que dañan su buena producción; es por ello que cuenta con el apoyo de los financieros, quienes le facilitan el préstamo para que siga con su trabajo.
Con el tiempo desea abrir un negocio y así estar mas con sus hijos, pero por el momento prioriza en realizar el mantenimiento de su parcela “desyerbar y fumigar sus plantas de cacao y café”. Este es su crédito número 02, agradece por esta confianza que le brindan, se compromete a ser puntual con sus cuotas de pago como en anterior crédito. Con los 4,000 nuevos soles, realizará la compra de funguicidas para fumigar su parcela y con el resto contratará a jornaleros para que le apoyen.
texts.en:
Delia is a single mother. She is 34 years old. She lives in her own house that she bought thanks to her daily efforts. She depends on her labor so she can pay the expenses of her two young children wanting to give them a better quality of life. Delia works in agriculture. For eight years she has grown cocoa and coffee plants in her own field. During weeding and harvesting she always has the help of laborers in order to get the work done faster.

Her greatest pride is that her plants obtain very good results in order to receive high prices, but the difficulty is to evade the pests that ruin her good harvest. This is why she has the help of lenders who provide the loan so she can continue with her work.

Over time she hopes to open a business and thus spend more time with her children, but for the moment her priority is maintaining her parcel, “to weed and to fumigate her cocoa and coffee plants.” This is her second loan. She is grateful for the confidence given, she promises to be punctual with her payments as she was in her previous loan. With the 4,000 soles, she will buy fungicides to fumigate her parcel and with the rest she will hire laborers to help her.

loans.use: to buy fungicides and to pay laborers to help her plants obtain good results

loans.name: Roberto Antonio

texts.es:
Roberto es un joven de 20 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Chincha, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido, posee playas hermosas, así como también sus pobladores tiene un don para la preparación de platillos, ya que lo hacen de manera deliciosa. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta mucho escuchar música y en ocasiones le encanta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos “Carapulcra con sopa seca”.

Con mucho esfuerzo Roberto logro estudiar la carrera de Técnico de Soldadura, con lo cual trabaja en una fábrica de su ciudad como soldador, el labora alrededor de 9 horas al día y con el fruto de su trabajo puede apoyar a sus padres con los gastos del hogar, ya que ellos son de condición humilde, el cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es responsable y honrado en su trabajo.

Roberto está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que con la gran ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar mejoras en su vivienda como construcción de paredes, refacciones, tarrajeo, instalaciones de tuberías, entre otros, de esta manera tendrá una mejor calidad de vida y seguirá luchando cada dia por hacer realidad su más grande sueño:”  Tener una casa propia y poder tener estudiar una carrera adicional”.
texts.en:
Roberto is a young man of 20. He lives in the city of Chincha, which is characterized by its warm climate. It has beautiful beaches, and its people have a gift for preparing delicious dishes. When Roberto has free time, he very much likes to listen to music, and sometimes he likes to eat of of his favorite dishes, "carapulcra con sopa seca" (a spicy Peruvian stew made from meat, dried potatoes, and vegetables).

With great effort, Roberto managed to study for a career as a welding technician, and he works as a welder in a factory in his city. He works about 9 hours a day, and with the fruit of his work he can help his parents with the household expenses, since they are of humble means. He believes that it is going well for him at his job because he is responsible and honest in his work.

Roberto is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since with the great help that they have offered him, he will be able to complete improvements in his home, such as constructing walls, remodeling, plastering, and installing plumbing, among other items. In this way he will have a better quality of life and will continue striving every day to make his great dream a reality: to have his own house and to be able to study for an additional career.

loans.use: to improve his home (construct walls, remodel, plaster, and install plumbing, among other items)

loans.name: German Adonay

texts.es: German tiene 33 años de edad, casado, tiene un hijo y vive en una colonia periférica de San Pedro Sula. El realiza dos actividades de negocio, hace 4 años que se quedo sin empleo y decidió establecer su propio negocio de compra y venta de materiales reciclados como aluminio, cobre, baterías en mal estado, vehículos chatarra, desperdicios de hierro etc. estos materiales los vende en una empresa de reciclaje. Además  hace 4 meses estableció un negocio de venta de golosinas donde vende refrescos, churros, jugos y comidas rápidas. Ha solicitado un préstamo para compra de chatarras y materiales de reciclaje para vender. Y también necesita comprar utensilios de cocina para el negocio de venta de golosinas. Su objetivo es mejorar los ingresos para su hogar. Su sueño es llegar a obtener su propia vivienda y establecer allí los negocios mejor acondicionados y tener una estabilidad económica familiar.
texts.en:
German is 33 years old. He is married, has one son, and lives in a neighborhood on the outskirts of San Pedro Sula. He has two business activities. Four years ago, he lost his job, and decided to to set up his own business buying and selling recycled materials such as aluminum, copper, dead batteries, junk vehicles, scrap iron, etc. He sells these materials to a recycling company. 

In addition, four months ago, he set up a business selling candy, where he sells soft drinks, churros (a treat made with fried dough), juices and fast food. He has requested a loan to buy scrap metal and materials for recycling to sell. He also needs to buy kitchen utensils for his candy-selling business. His objective is to improve his household income.

His dream is to obtain his own home, to set up there the best-equipped businesses, and have financial stability for his family.

loans.use: To buy materials for recycling, dead batteries, metal scrap to sell, as well as kitchen utensils for his candy business.

loans.name: Domino

texts.en:
