Domino is a 28-year-old merchant from Talibon, Bohol, in the Philippines. He has been running a sari-sari (convenience) store for more than two years now as his main source of income.

Domino is in need of capital to expand his business. He is asking for a loan 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy more stock to sell, such as noodles, dry goods and snack foods. With this, he will be able to cater for more customers. In the future, Domino wants to invest in other business ventures so that he can improve his income.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell, such as noodles, dry goods and snack foods

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
This is Florence, 49, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is single, and she manages her household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Florence operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings when all of the family members are at home to take part of the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition, but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands costs less than raw food. She mainly offers food for breakfast. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 Philippines pesos (Php) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, and frozen food products. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Florence dreams to have a good life through all her hard work on her business. She also hopes to have her own restaurant. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Yury Geraldina

texts.es: Yury de 35 años de edad, casada, tiene una hija, vive en el municipio de Tela, Atlántida. Desde hace 7 años ella vende ropa nueva de niño, blusas, calzado, perfumes, juguetes y cosméticos. Las ventas las realiza de forma ambulante y por encargos. Este negocio es su fuente de ingresos y lo ha hecho crecer por su buena administración y la inversión de préstamos. Actualmente solicita otro préstamo a ODEF que es por 10,000 Lempiras, con el cual va surtir de ropa y juguetes para aprovechar la temporada del día del niño. Su meta a futuro es construir su casa y continuar apoyando a su hija con el estudio.
texts.en:
Yury is 35 years old, married, and has one daughter. She lives in the town of Tela, Atlántida. For seven years, she has been selling new children's clothing, blouses, footwear, perfumes, toys and cosmetics. 

She sells door-to-door and by orders. This business is her source of income, and she has made it grow by her good management and by investing money from loans.  

Currently she is requesting another loan from ODEF, for 10,000 lempiras, with which she is going to stock up on clothing and toys to take advantage of the Children's Day season. 

Her goal for the future is to build her house and continue helping her daughter with her schooling.

loans.use: To buy clothing and toys to sell during the Children's Day season.

loans.name: Bayaraa

texts.en:
Mr. Bayaraa, who is 38 years old, lives with his wife and two daughters in a little house in Arhangai province. His wife works as an elementary teacher in the school. His oldest daughter is a college student and his youngest daughter joined school this year. Mr. Bayaraa has been running a business supplying wool, cashmere, and livestock skins to Ulaanbaatar city for 10 years. He purchases the raw materials from herders in a market of his province. He buys the raw materials for 2,000,000 MNT a day and then he sells them one day a week. His profit is 1,200,000 MNT per month. 

Because he has been running this business, he has a good business network in his province. His wife's salary is not enough for their family needs so he needs to pay his older daughter's tuition fees. Therefore, he requests a 2,000,000 MNT loan.

loans.use: to pay his older daughter's tuition fees.

loans.name: Tapeku

texts.en:
Tapeku is married and has three children, with one below the age of 15 years. The entire family lives in a three-room apartment house at Ntamulung, Bamenda, in the northwest region of Cameroon.

Lots of problems have been faced by this woman, including the lack of adequate startup financing and less means to provide better health care for her children and a proper education with good moral upbringing. This situation was further compounded by the death of her father, elder sister and father-in-law. However, she intends to use this loan to purchase in bulk rice, beans and other foodstuff items, and to keep more fowls in her poultry business.

She believes she will succeed in doing this business because of the increased demand for foodstuff products in the community,  Also, she has been in the business for over 10 years. This business will help the community in that it improves the quantity and quality of foodstuffs the community can afford; customers will not have to go long distances to buy food; and time will be saved. The gain from this business will help her to expand the foodstuff sales and expand the poultry activity. Also, the profit will be used to pay for the children's needs and to pay for the medication of the family.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans and poultry.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 31-year-old married woman. She has three children, ranging in age from 2 years to 15 years. She describes herself to be a  visionary and patient woman. 

She operates a stall where she sells food . She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located at a strategic business area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high price of food ingredients.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy food ingredients for preparing meals for sale.

Her business goal is to run a new business of real estate where she will provide accomodation to people within five years.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients for preparing meals to sell.

loans.name: Zamira

texts.en:
A beautiful woman by name of Zamira lives in a house that is in poor shape. Her husband is a kind man who helps to Zamira with animal husbandry. They have a clever and little daughter.  Zamira’s daughter wants to live in a house in good condition, but the family's income from animal husbandry is not enough for it. 

Zamira is asking for a loan of TJS 3,000 to repair her house. In this way, she will be able to offer her family a better quality of life and moral stability that will allow them to progress. Each month she will make her payment on time. 

She awaits your support and mercy. Please help her and her family if possible.

loans.use: To buy building materials, such as cement aand wood, for repairing her house

loans.name: Sopheak

texts.en:
Sopheak is aged 28 and married. She lives in a village of Sampov Meas district, Pursat province. Sopheak has two dependent sons who are still in school. To feed the family, she has farmed rice on four hectares farmland for six years. This business earns her approximately 13,000 KHR per day and she saves about 6,000 KHR each day after offsetting daily expenses. Low crop yield resulting from insects is the main challenge for the paddy field. 

This is the first loan for Sopheak with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. She is applying for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR to spend on purchasing fertilizers for her farmland, hoping the crops will produce good yield so that she can sell the products for good money as it then allows her to buy some piglets to raise and sell for additional income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Magdeline

texts.en:
Magdeline is a 25-year-old single woman. She has three children, with ages ranging from 4 years to 9 years. She describes herself to be an honest and God-fearing woman.

She operates a retail store where she sells household items such as sugar, salt, maize, flour, and margarine. . She has been involved in this business for two years.  Her business is located within a residential area, and her primary customers are local residents . She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

She will use the KES 12,900 loan to buy a solar lamp that will be used by her family for lightiing. 

Her business goal is to run a wholesale shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her business. Previously, she had taken one loan that she repaid.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp foir lighting at home.

loans.name: Astou

texts.fr:
Madame Astou mariée et mère de famille, est une matrone de profession et exerce dans une mutuel de santé du village. En plus de cela, Astou fait de la vente de marchandises diverses. Elle a une expérience de 2 ans dans le petit commerce. Elle sollicite un crédit de 150000F CFA pour acheter des habits pour enfants, des chaussures et des parfums qu’il va revendre. Le crédit lui permet aussi d’épargner et d’améliorer les conditions alimentaires de son foyer.
Elle a comme ambition si elle a les moyens, d’ouvrir une boutique de ventes de produits cosmétiques et divers.
texts.en: Mrs. Astou is married, with children. She is a birth attendant by trade and works in the community healthcare facility in her village. In addition, she sells various items. She has two years of experience in retail. She is seeking a loan of 150,000 West African francs in order to buy children’s clothing as well as shoes and perfume for resale. This loan will allow her to save and improve the nutrition of her family. Her goal is, funds permitting, to open a store to sell cosmetic products and miscellaneous items.

loans.use: to buy various goods such as shoes, perfume and children's clothing for resale.

loans.name: Mariana Stefania

texts.es:
Mariana es una joven de 21 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Nazca con sus padres y hermanos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación, gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Mariana se encuentra estudiando la carrera profesional de Enfermería y adicionalmente Diseño Gráfico, en sus ratos libres le gusta dibujar y en algunas ocasiones cocina unos deliciosos Tallarines Verdes para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, Mariana trabaja en una librería, brindando servicios de atención al público y fotocopiado, todos los días desde tempranas horas inicia su labor, ella puede trabajar un aproximado de 8 horas diarias y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Mariana se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir sus gastos de estudios, tales como el pago de matrícula, mensualidades y compra de uniforme; de esta manera Mariana podrá seguir cursando sus estudios, con el deseo de culminarlos satisfactoriamente para convertirse en una buena profesional y así espera lograr su sueño de tener su propio negocio de diseño.
texts.en:
Mariana is a young woman of 21. She is single, and lives in the city of Nazca with her parents and brothers. She is a very kind person; hard-working and enthusiastic, who has great desire for self-improvement. Thanks to her efforts and her parents' support, Mariana is studying for a professional degree in nursing, as well as graphic design. 

In her spare time she likes to draw and sometimes cooks delicious "tallarines verdes" (spaghetti with a spinach and basil sauce) to share with her family. 

With much determination and enthusiasm, Mariana works in a bookstore, serving the public, and providing photocopying services. She starts work from an early hour every day. She can work approximately 8 hours daily, and believes it is going well because of her good performance and the kind way she treats others. 

Mariana is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, as thanks to the assistance offered, she will be able to cover her education costs, such as tuition, monthly fees and uniform purchase. In this way, Mariana will be able to continue with her studies, with the desire to complete them satisfactorily, in order to become a good professional. In this way, she hopes to achieve her dream of having her own design business.

loans.use: To cover her education expenses.

loans.name: Ruth Elizabeth

texts.es: Ruth, de 35 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos y vive en Chamelecón, San Pedro Sula, con sus padres y sus dos hijos. Ella es una persona emprendedora, quien ha buscado como mantener a sus hijos, hace 4 años decidió dedicarse a la venta de verduras, carne de res, cerdo, de pollo y también refrescos. Este negocio lo tiene en su casa. ya ha solicitado varios préstamos para mantener su negocio, actualmente solicita el cuarto préstamo que es por 20,000 Lempiras, con el cual va comprar más refrescos, verduras y carnes para surtir el negocio y seguir creciendo. Sus planes son mantener surtido el negocio para darles la manutención a sus hijos y también sentirse motivada de que tiene una fuente de ingresos fija.
texts.en:
Ruth is a 35-year-old single mother. She and her two children live with her parents in Chamelecón, San Pedro Sula. Ruth is an enterprising individual who looks for ways to support her children. For the past four years, she has been selling vegetables, beef, pork, chicken, and soft drinks. Her business is located in her home. She has requested several loans in order to maintain her business.

Ruth is currently requesting her fourth loan in the amount of 20,000 HNL so that she can buy more soft drinks, vegetables, and meat to restock her business and keep growing. Her plans are to keep her business stocked so that she can support her children. She also motivates herself to have a steady source of income.

loans.use: to buy meat, soft drinks, and vegetables.

loans.name: Sambo's Group

texts.en:
Sambo, age 63, is one of the breadwinners in her family. She is originally from Prey Chhor District in Kampong Cham Province, and she has five children. She and her husband have managed one and a half hectares of rice-cropping farmland to survive and to meet the daily basic needs of her entire household. Sambo has been in this business for 45 years and now earns about 15,500 KHR per day. However, she can save only 6,700 KHR each day after her expenses. For her, the main challenge is an insufficient amount of working capital, making her unable to increase production.
Now, Sambo is leading a group of two female members to apply for a loan. Neither Sambo nor her group member has ever been with VisionFund (Kiva's partner). She is seeking a loan of 500,000 KHR, and her group member is applying for 1,000,000 KHR. As the group leader, Sambo will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer, rice seed, gasoline, and insecticide for her rice field, and she will use a portion of the loan to buy vegetable seeds to grow for extra income. She hopes to enlarge her profits significantly from her current business and to sustain her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer,rice seed, and gasoline for farmland and vegetable for growing

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
This is Alicia. She previously accessed a 14,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and for her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a 20,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Alicia hopes to be able to expand her business soon, just as she hopes to give her family a good future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
Liz tiene 24 años, vive en la compañía de su esposo y su hijo en casa de su suegro desde hace 5 años. Se dedica a la elaboración de fustanes típicos, faldas de colores que son autóctonos de su zona. Desde hace 4 años, su esposo también la apoya en estas actividades en sus horarios libres y trabaja en su misma casa, provista de su esencial herramienta de trabajo que es su maquina de coser y también donde diseñan día a día los modelos de cada bordado de acuerdo a cada temporada, una vez realizados los trabajos los fines de semana  sale a vender lo producido en las ferias comerciales de las zonas rurales de su ciudad  y donde recibe las ganancias  de su trabajo, la elaboración de sus faldas considera que son rentables porque  es un producto demandado  por lo que su deseo es mejorar sus herramientas y aumentar su producción. Ya que esta teniendo muchos pedidos de otras ciudades. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “los puntuales del ovalo” y este es el  quinto crédito con MFP, donde  ha tenido buenos aprendizajes que le han servido en su vida diaria de la cual esta agradecida  y renueva su compromiso de ser puntual en sus pagos.
Liz invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de telas al por mayor para realizar los pedidos que tiene.
texts.en:
Liz is 24 years old. For five years she has been living with her husband and son in her father-in-law's house. She makes traditional "fustanes", colored petticoat skirts that are indigenous to the area. 

For four years, her husband has also been helping her in this work in his free time, and he works right in their home, equipped with their essential work tool, which is their sewing machine. This is also where they design the style of each embroidery from day to day, according to each season. 

Once the the items are finished, she goes out on weekends to sell what they have produced, in the street markets in the rural areas of her city, where she receives the earnings from their work. She feels that making her skirts is profitable because it is a product in demand. 

Therefore, her wish is to improve her tools and increase her output, since she is getting many orders from other cities. 

She belongs to the “Los Puntuales del Ovalo” communal bank. This is her fifth loan with MFP, where she has had good learning, that has really helped her in her daily life. For this she is grateful, and renews her commitment to be on time with her payments. 

Liz will use the money requested in the purchase of fabric at wholesale, in order to fill the orders she has.

loans.use: To buy fabric at wholesale.

loans.name: Mariluz

texts.es:
Mariluz, de 31 años de edad, esta casada con Carlos de 29 años; juntos compraron su casa, donde habitan con su pequeño hijo. Mariluz, se dedica a la venta de víveres en general, esta labor lo efectúa en su propia casa hace 05 años. Normalmente trabaja sola, pero a veces cuenta con el apoyo de su pareja quien se encarga de las ventas; para ella su trabajo es lo que mas le gusta hacer, ya que siempre anhelo tener un negocio propio. 
En este negocio siempre tiene ingresos económicos gracias a los pobladores, quienes acuden a tienda a comprar los insumos para el preparativo de sus alimentos; sin embargo le consta que a veces tiene problemas a falta de algunos víveres; por ello necesita el préstamo, ya que así logrará proporcionar su tienda con todos los abarrotes necesario. Este es su crédito número 02; una vez mas agradece por la confianza y asegura que seguirá siendo puntual con sus cuotas de pago como en anterior crédito. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles, se abastecerá d mercadería para llenar su tienda como: arroz, azúcar, especias, verduras, conservas, bebidas, entre otros.
texts.en:
Mariluz is 31 years old and married to Carlos, age 29. They bought a house together and live there with their young son. Mariluz sells groceries and has been working out of her home for the past five years. She normally works alone, but sometimes she has the help of her partner who takes charge of making sales. Mariluz enjoys her work very much since she had always wanted her own business.

Her business always generates income thanks to the villagers who come to her store to buy supplies for preparing their meals. However, the problem she faces on occasion is the lack of certain products. For this reason, she needs to access this loan so that she can stock her store with all of the necessary grocery items.

This will be her second loan. Once again, Mariluz is grateful for the trust shown to her and promises to submit her payments on time just as she did with her previous loan. With this loan of 3,000 PEN, she will restock her store with merchandise such as rice, sugar, spices, vegetables, preserves, beverages, and other products.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, spices, vegetables, preserves, beverages, and other products.

loans.name: Enrique Roberto

texts.es:
Enrique es un hombre de 63 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con su pareja y sus 2 hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su pareja dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Ingeniería Mecánica, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, Enrique trabaja como chofer de taxi, el cuenta con un auto propio él cual utiliza para laborar, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana sale a recorrer las calles de su ciudad en busca de pasajeros, él puede trabajar un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Enrique se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos de limpieza y abono de un pequeño terreno en el cual sembrará pallares, así también podrá abonar sus árboles de pecano; de esta manera Enrique tendrá su terreno en buenas condiciones para iniciar su cosecha, así él espera que su cultivo se logre adecuadamente para tener una buena venta e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda adquirir más hectáreas y tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Enrique is a 63 year-old man who lives in the city of Ica with his partner and their 2 children.  He loves his family, and they are his main reason for living.  He is a very pleasant, enthusiastic, and hardworking man.  He and his partner dedicate all of their efforts to helping their family get ahead.  Regrettably, Enrique was not able to study for a career in mechanical engineering as he would have liked.  He enjoys playing soccer with his friends in his free time, and sometimes he prepares a delicious Carapulcra (a Peruvian potato stew) with Sopa Seca (a noodle dish) for his family.  

Enrique works very hard as a taxi driver and is very enthusiastic about his job.  He has his own car that he uses for work.  Every day he leaves very early in the morning to drive the streets of his city in search of passengers.  He is able to work about 8 hours a day and thinks it is going well because of his dedication and the pleasant treatment that he provides for his customers.  

Enrique is very grateful to Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help he will be able to cover the costs of clearing and fertilizing a small field on which he will plant lima beans; this, in turn, will help him to fertilize his pecan trees.  As a result, Enrique’s field will be in good condition for his crops.  He hopes that his crop will be sufficient so that he can have good sales and increase his family’s income.  This would be very helpful for Enrique in the future, since he wants to acquire more land and have a house of his own.

loans.use: to cover the costs of clearing and fertilizing a small field.

loans.name: Benilda

texts.en:
Benilda is a 54-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. She has four children and some of them are still in school. Benilda works as a farmer tilling their field and planting it with rice and other crops. His husband works as a carpenter.
Benilda gives her best to provide support to her husband in meeting the needs of the family especially of the schooling of their children. 
As of this time, Benilda is in need of financial support for her farming business. She is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy fertilizer for the crops and materials for carpentry and to pay the school fees of her children.
In the future, Benilda hopes to improve their way of living and see her children become successful professionals some day.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the crops and materials for carpentry and to pay the school fees of her children

loans.name: Rosa Gladys

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 57 años es divorciada tiene una a hija que vive con ella ya que  tiene 19 años y estudia en universidad. Rosa siempre le ha gustado trabajar y le vino una magnífica idea de aprender a cortar cabello ya que es una mujer divorciada la cual tiene que trabajar mucho para poder subsistir y sobre todo pagar gastos de ella y su hija. 

Con las ganancias del salón de belleza pudo ahorrar para su pequeño negocio, ella atiende sola el negocio y trabaja desde la 09:00 am hasta las 7:00 pm de lunes a sábado. Con el préstamo quiere comprar tijeras, planchas para cabello, tintes etc. El sueño de Rosa es que su negocio crezca y también sus ingresos ella quisiera ampliar el negocio para así tener más clientes.
texts.en:
Rosa is 57 years old, divorced, and has a 19-year-old daughter who lives with her and attends university.

Rosa has always enjoyed working and came up with the great idea that she should learn to cut hair. Being a divorced woman, she has had to work hard to support herself and pay all of her expenses and those of her daughter.

With the earnings from her beauty salon, Rosa has been able to set aside money for her small business. She works alone at her business from 9 A.M. to 7 P.M., Monday through Saturday. With this loan Rosa will buy scissors, curling irons, dyes, and other supplies. She dreams of seeing her business and income grow. Rosa also wants to expand her business so that she can have more customers.

loans.use: to buy scissors, curling irons, dyes, and other supplies.

loans.name: Dainah

texts.en:
Dainah is a 42-year-old landlady in Mtopanga, Mombasa. She is married to Terry Carty and together they are blessed with three children aged 17, 14 and six years. She ventured into the rental property business five years ago. She also sells electronics to supplement her income.

This is Daina’s first loan from KADET LTD. She plans to install electricity and paint her newly built rental houses. 

She will use the anticipated profits to purchase more stock for her electronics shop. She hopes to have a happy and prosperous family.

loans.use: to install electricity and paint her newly built rental houses

loans.name: Mekhriban

texts.en:
Mekhriban is from the village of Kakuti, Kobuleti district. She is 62 years old and lives with her husband, grown son, daughter-in-law and three grandchildren. Mekhriban and her husband are pensioners. The family is involved in an agricultural business. In particular, they have a plot of land, where maize and nuts are grown. The family does all seasonal agricultural work to insure a good harvest. Mekhriban is a very hard-working woman, with a rich experience in her work.

She requested a loan to purchase cattle. With this loan, she will be able to develop her animal husbandry business and get an increased profit.  With the increased profit, she will be able to reinvest in the family agricultural business to expand it and make it more profitable. Taking into account the above mentioned activities, living conditions of the family will be improved. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: José María

texts.es:
El señor José esta solicitando un préstamo debido a que le surgieron gastos imprevistos de gastos escolares de su hijo, y no cuenta con el dinero necesario para cubrir esta  gasto.
El señor José trabaja en una compañía de gasolina en el aria de despachador, te es el ingreso que tiene en para su familia y con el cual un parte será para pagar el crédito.
Desea que su hijo sega desempeñándose y aprendiendo lo educativo para que en un futura sea un triunfador.
texts.en:
Sr. José is requesting a loan to cover unexpected school expenses for his son. He does not have the necessary funds to cover these expenses.

Sr. José works for a gasoline company as a dispatcher. With his income, he is able to support his family and some of his earnings will be used to repay this loan. José wants his son to develop and learn through his education so that he can be successful in the future.

loans.use: to pay for his son's school expenses.

loans.name: Thaet's Group

texts.en: Thaet is aged 32 and a rural villager from Tbaung Khmum district (Cambodia). She is married and has three children who are students. To provide daily sustenance for her children, she has managed her two-hectare area for growing cassava and about one and half hectares for growing rice. She has 12 years of experiences in the current businesses and can earn about 12,000 KHR. Thaet is a second-time borrower for this loan cycle. The first loan, which she has paid back on time, has provided her with working capital to pay her rice harvesting fee and her cassava weeding fee. Now, in a group of three women members, she is a leader. Thaet and one of her co-members are requesting 1,200,000 KHR each, whereas the other member is applying for 1,000,000 KHR. Her loan portion will be used to buy fertilizer for her farmland for both cash-crops. She hopes to receive a good yield so she can double her profit to keep supporting her household, especially her children's education.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Maria Petronila

texts.es: Doña María, tiene 56 años de edad, casada, tiene 6 hijos, su esposo trabaja de director de una escuela primaria, viven al sur este de San Pedro Sula. Ella estudio belleza y su sueño era establecer su propio salón de belleza, y con la ayuda de su esposo lo logro. Ya tiene 10 años de tenerlo y le ha ido muy bien, atiende todos los días dedicándole 12 horas diarias. Su negocio ha crecido tiene más clientes y variedad de productos. Esta solicitando un segundo préstamo con ODEF y es por 15,000 Lempiras con el cual va comprar productos que necesita tener en su salón para realizar los trabajos como ser: tintes, esmaltes, champú, cremas, maquillajes etc. Su sueño es hacer crecer su negocio y que sea reconocido y poder obtener ingresos para darle el estudio universitario a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Doña María is 56 years old, married, and has six children. Her husband works as a principal at an elementary school. They live southeast of San Pedro Sula.

María studied cosmetology and dreamed of establishing her own beauty salon. With the help of her husband, she accomplished her goal. María has been in business for 10 years and has done very well. She manages her business every day and works 12 hours each day. Her business has grown and now has many customers and an assortment of products.

She is requesting her second loan from ODEF in the amount of 15,000 HNL. The money will be used to buy products that she needs for her salon so that she can perform her work such as dyes, nail polishes, shampoo, crèmes, make-up, and other supplies. Her dream is to grow her business and become recognized. This will enable her to generate income so that she can provide for her children’s college education.

loans.use: to buy dyes, nail polishes, shampoo, crèmes, make-up, and other beauty supplies.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
This is Amelia. She previously accessed a 26,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional supplies of raw materials needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

She dreams that her business will last and continue to grow. She hopes to give her family a good life. She never fails to attend the fellowship* meeting every week as it helps her to entrust to the Lord all her plans and dreams in life. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials she needs in her business.

loans.name: Abeli

texts.en:
Abeli is from Kobuleti district, West Georgia. He is 66 years old and lives with his wife and 18-year-old grandson. His grandson is a student. Abeli and his wife are provided with a retirement pension. The family is involved in the agricultural business. In particular, they have a small dairy farm of two calves and a milk cow, whose milk is used for dairy production. In addition, they grow mandarins, nuts, sweet cherries and persimmons on family-owned land. The harvested products are sold at the local open market. Abeli works hard, but the family still doesn’t have enough income to make some savings and improve the living conditions of the family.

Abeli requested a loan to build a cattle shed. He will purchase construction materials for a new cattle shed. The existing one is already too small and doesn’t allow Abeli to plan future expansion of the family’s farming activities. In the future, he is going to purchase additional cows so he can produce and sell more cheese. This will increase the family income, and Abeli will be able to improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to build a cattle shed.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is a 26-year-old business lady who sells new clothes, shoes and handbags in Mshomoroni, Mombasa. She is married to Shem with whom she has three children. She has been running this business for the last one year. Her business is doing great.
 
This will be Teresia's second business loan from KADET LTD to finance her business. She plans to purchase more shirts, skirts, blouses, trousers, handbags and shoes to resell to her customers.

She will use the anticipated profits to repay her loan. She hopes to succeed and grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase more shirts, skirts, blouses, trousers, handbags and shoes.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita lives in Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. She is in the fish-vending business, since her husband is a fisherman. They have been in this business for several years now. This is the source of their income.
,
Conchita is in need of financial support for their fishing business. She is asking for a loan worth 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy new fishing nets and fuel for the fishing boat. Conchita is optimistic that through this loan, she and her husband could improve their income.

Conchita hopes of making huge progress in their lives. Moreover, she plans of buying a new fishing boat for her husband.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and fuel for the fishing boat.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 37 years old, living at Furagui with her spouse and four children. Her spouse is a farmer while she is selling grocery items to the people in her village. She had been in the business for over five years now and earns PHP 300 each day. 

She wants to sell more products so she is asking for a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy sardines, breads, eggs, soft drinks and biscuits to sell. She hopes to keep selling good products and that her friendly service will lead to an increase in her income to cover the educational expenses of her children. She will be very happy to see them all professionals in their chosen career someday.

loans.use: to buy sardines, breads, eggs, soft drinks and biscuits to sell.

loans.name: Naziko

texts.en:
Naziko is from Kobuleti district, West Georgia. She is 69 years old and lives with her husband and a grown son. Naziko and her husband have a retirement pension. The main source of income for the family is their agricultural business. In particular, the family owns a plot of land where mandarins, maize, nuts and persimmons are grown. In addition, Naziko has a milk cow and a calf. She milks the cow twice a day and produces cheese. She sells her agricultural production locally. Naziko is very hard working person with a rich experience in her work.

She requested a loan to cultivate her plot of land and repair the fence. Naziko will purchase building materials to fence the land and work hard to get a good harvest. She hopes her business will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions. Naziko awaits your support.

loans.use: to cultivate her plot of land and repair the fence.

loans.name: Venerando

texts.en:
Venerando is a fisherman from the town of Bien Undido, Bohol. He has been a fisherman for 32 years. He is married with eight children aged three to 23. He works hard to provide for his family's needs. 

He is asking for a loan to buy a new engine for his fishing boat. This will guarantee to Venerando that his fishing activity will be smooth and always productive. His income will support the needs of his family for things such as food and school fees. In the future, he hopes to make a bigger business out of fishing to better provide for his family.

loans.use: to buy a boat engine.

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.en:
This is Maria Victoria, 29, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Joselito, a call center agent. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Maria Victoria maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are counting on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Maria Victoria hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams of creating a good life for her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Sokleap's Group

texts.en:
A young 28-year-old mother living in Tbaung Khmum district's Kampong Cham province, Sokleap has to cater for her two daughters who are still in school. She is a farmer, and grows rice on one hectare and cassava on two hectares of farmland to support her family's survival. To improve this support, she also run a small grocery stall.

She has engaged in this business for eight years and is able to earn about 13,000 KHR per day. For her and two of her co-members, this is their second cycle. The other member of their group has just joined VisionFund this cycle. She has succeeded in paying back the entire first loan which has helped her set aside some money to run a small stall selling grocery items. 

Now, she is leading a group with three other members and applying for a new loan. Sokleap will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer for the cassava field and rice-farm. She hopes to grow her cassava healthily and sell it at a good price so that she can maintain a good lifestyle for her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Sophea's Group

texts.en:
Sophea is 35 years old and originally from Kampong Cham province's Tbaung Khmum district. She has five children, four of whom are living with her and helping the family business. She sells grocery items and her husband grows paddy rice plus cassava in order to strive for a living for their household’s sake. Having been engaged in this business for 15 years, she can earn about 30,000 KHR per day and save about 15,000 KHR per day after daily expenses.  

Sophea's group is composed of five women members and all of them, including her, are second-time borrowers with Kiva's partner. She has managed her first loan with success to alleviate her family's burden and improve its livelihood. Now, her entire loan first loan has been paid back. For this cycle, she is a group leader. She will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her farm; some portion of it will be used to buy additional grocery items such as soaps, canned food, storage food ingredients etc. for resale. She hopes that her business will gradually grow so she can increase her income and improve her living conditions so they are better than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for farmland and grocery items.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is from Likoni, a town in the coastal region of Kenya. She is 28 years old, married, and she has two young children.

She has a food selling business, selling dumplings from her home, a business she has run for three years. She started her business so as to help her spouse to cover the household expenses. She also sells water in her compound. It has been a very good source of income.

Fatuma is now requesting this loan to buy wheat flour, baking powder, and cooking oil. With this investment, which will be very beneficial to her business, she hopes to get new customers.

Among her future plans is to establish a cafe in the future.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, baking powder, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Rom

texts.en:
Residing in Pursat Province's Kror Kor district, Rom is a 46-year-old mother of eleven children. Out of her 11 children, she needs to cater for eight children, some of whom are still little, some are still in school, one kid is helping the family, and the remaining one has his own employment. Because of this big household, she has struggled to provide for her children's basic needs, with rice cultivation being the main source of income. To supplement the family's income, she also raises pigs at home while her husband works for others for a fee and produces palm-sugar to sell. 

Having been in this business for several years, she is able to make about 23,500 KHR per day. Rom took her first loan with VisionFund (Kiva's partner) one cycle ago and completely paid back the loan. The previous loan has helped her to grow her cash-crop and to better support her household especially paying for her children's education. 

Now, she is applying for a second-cycle loan with an amount of 1,000,000 KHR. She will use this loan to buy fertilizer for her rice farm and to buy a cow to support her business including for plowing. She expects to gain more yield and to increase her income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and a cow for her rice farm.

loans.name: Minette

texts.fr: Minette est une jeune femme de 30 ans en séparation et mère de 4 enfants dont l'age varie entre 2 et 8 ans trois vont déjà à l'école. Elle a ouvert un mini-alimentation qu'elle gère depuis 1 an dans un quartier de la capitale.Grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine et son accueil chaleureux et son rapport avec son voisinage,elle a pu acquérir une très grande clientèle. L'augmentation croissante de sa clientèle rend son offre inférieure à la demande d'ou l'importance de ce crédit dans son activité.Grâce à lui elle pourra acheter Acheter les produits de première nécessite(carton de savon, sac de riz, carton de sucre et cubes...) ce qui lui permettra de satisfaire convenablement sa clientèle, d'augmenter ses ventes ainsi sa marge bénéficiaire. Elle réinvestira une partie de ce bénéfice dans son activité et le reste lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille dont elle en a la charge.
texts.en:
Minette is a young woman who is 30 years of age. She is separated and mother to four children aged between 2 and 8 years of age, three of whom are already at school. She opened a small food store a year ago, which she manages in a neighborhood of the capital. Thanks to her experience in this area and her warm welcome and rapport with the locals, she has been able to build up a very large customer base. 

The constant increase in Minette’s customer base means that supply is lower than demand, and loans are therefore important for her business. Thanks to these loans she has been able to buy basic goods (a box of soap, bag of rice, box of sugar and cubes), which will allow her to easily satisfy her customers, increase her sales and have a higher profit margin. Minette plans to reinvest part of her profits in her business, while the rest will allow her to provide for her family, for which she is responsible.

loans.use: To buy basic goods (a box of soap, bag of rice, box of sugar and cubes).

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en:
Geofrey is a 46-year-old married man. He has ten children with ages ranging from three to 22. He describes himself as supportive. He operates a barber shop where he provides hair cuts. He has been involved in this business for eight years. His business is located within an urban area and his primary customers are business people from environs and local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be high prices of hair products such as shampoo, soap and towels. 

He will use the KES 12,900 loan to buy a solar lamp for his family to use at night. His business goal is to run another barber retail shop within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be the best barber shop in his home town. Geofrey also does farming.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
This is Angelina, She previously accessed an 18,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase fish of different kinds needed for her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and for their personal, house hold and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional fish needed for her business. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Angelina dreams of being able to give her all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week; there she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of fish needed in her business.

loans.name: Lana

texts.en:
Lana is 25 years old and lives in Chkhorotsku district with her family that includes her husband and parents-in-law. Her parents-in-law are provided with a retirement pension. The family is involved in an agricultural business. In particular, they own a plot of land where nuts and maize are grown. In addition, Lana runs a small dairy farm and has two milking cows and three calves. She milks the cows twice a day and produces cheese. She sells her agricultural products at the local open market. Lana is a very hard working woman, with a great desire to get ahead.

She requested a loan to repair her house. The existing house is old and damaged. Lana will purchase building materials and renovate her house. Then, the living conditions of the family will be improved, and they will be able to spend their evenings after a hard working day in a more comfortable environment. Lana hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to repair her house.

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr:
Moussa est un jeune commerçant, célibataire qui as investi dans l’habillement depuis 3 ans maintenant. Il a ouvert un magasin de vente de prêt à porter  qu’il ouvre de 8h du matin à 22h du soir. Il n’a jamais bénéficié de crédit à l’IMCEC, et aimerait avoir 300000F CFA  pour pouvoir acheter des jeans pour hommes et dames, des body, des serviettes, des tee-shirts, des chaussures…et revendre dans sa cantine.
Bien qu’étant célibataire, cela ne l’empêche pas d’appuyer à la dépense quotidienne de la famille.
Moussa possède un champ et aimerait l’exploiter en y faisant du maraichage comme activité primaire.
texts.en:
Moussa is a young retailer. He is single, and has worked in clothing for three years now. He opened a store selling ready-to-wear clothing, which he runs from 8 in the morning until 10 pm.  

Moussa has never had a loan from UIMCEC, and would like to ask for 300,000 francs CFA to be able to buy men’s and women’s jeans, leotards, towels, t-shirts, and shoes, which he will resell in his store. Although he is single, he still supports the daily household expenses. Moussa has a field and would like to make the most of it, carrying out market farming as his main business.

loans.use: To buy various merchandise for resale: leotards, jeans, towels, and shirts.

loans.name: Duhuzubumwe / Kzh Group

texts.fr:
Monsieur Isaac est le membre et le président du groupe Duhuzubumwe. Le nom du groupe signifie «unir des forces».Il a 30 ans et il est marié avec 4 enfants de 1 an  à 7 ans, dont 1 scolarisé. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Isaac est cultivateur de riz. C’est son deuxième  cycle de prêt avec ACB et il dit que le crédit antérieur a aidé ses activités de l’agriculture de riz beaucoup et il n’a pas attendue aucunes difficultés de non remboursement du crédit. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des fertilisants et payer la main d’œuvre pour son activité d’agriculture de riz. 

Pour accroitre son agriculture du riz, il planifie de demander d’autres prêt pour augmenter la capacité de ses activités de la culture de riz. Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait être le meilleur producteur de riz dans la région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer le frais scolaire et médicaux de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Isaac is a member and the president of the Duhuzubumwe group, the name of which means “uniting forces”. He is 30 years of age, married, and has four children aged from 1 to 7, one of whom is at school. He studied six years of elementary school.

Isaac works as a rice farmer, and this is his second loan cycle with ACB. He says that his prior loan helped his rice business a lot, and that he had no difficulties repaying his loan. He plans to use this loan to buy fertilizers and pay the labor costs associated with his business.

To expand his business, Isaac plans to request further loans to increase his rice-growing capacity. Over the coming years, he would like to become the best rice grower in his region, and he plans to use his profits to pay for his children’s health and education expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers and pay for the labor expenses associated with his rice field.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Yum's Group

texts.en:
Yum lives in a rural area of the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She is a 49-year-old mother of four children. She has earned a living through raising pigs for ten years. Yum is able to earn approximately KHR 27,000 per day from her current business and she manages to save about KHR 19,000 each day for the future needs after deducting daily expenses. 

Yum has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for four cycles and fully repaid the past loans, which have helped her relieve her family’s financial burden and improve their livelihood. Now, she is leading her group of three to apply for a loan with VisionFund. Yum will use her portion to buy more piglets for raising. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her pig-raising business and also hopes to feed her pigs to be fat and healthy so as to sell them for a good price to gain more income to improve her family's living condition.

loans.use: To buy piglets for raising.

loans.name: Viviana

texts.en:
Viviana is 56 years old with four children. She is a seaweed farmer from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. She also collects sea cucumbers, seashells and sells fresh fish to earn an additional income. 

She is requesting for a loan to purchase straw, wooden pegs, gasoline, and more sea cucumbers. Her income will provide healthy food for her family and will be used to reinvest in the same business. 

In the future, she hopes to have a sustainable business so she can continue to expand, make improvements and earn more.

loans.use: to purchase straw, wooden pegs, gasoline and more sea cucumbers.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is a forty-year-old hardworking woman with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her personal goal is to educate her children to attain degrees as a minimum qualification. She has a retail shop that has facilitated her in paying school fees for her children and renovating her house. Her business is challenged by price fluctuations, inflation and inadequate capital to buy enough stock while her vision is expanding her business to new markets. Margret needs a loan to buy sugar, washing soap and rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, washing soap and rice to sell.

loans.name: Asina

texts.en:
Asina is married and has two children, who are still young. Since her husband does not earn enough to provide a good quality of life in their home, Asina decided to start her own business which would help her household financially and enable her two children to have a better quality of life and her and her husband to overcome their economic difficulties. That was why she began selling doughnuts from her home, selling to the neighborhood.

The financial situation of her home has been improving and she expects to provide good quality education once her children are enrolled. Asina is requesting a loan to purchase ingredients such wheat flour, cooking oil, and other foods. Her dream is that this business will move forward and that her family will have the opportunity to have a better quality of life and more opportunities to succeed.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such wheat flour, cooking oil, and other foods.

loans.name: Baljinyam

texts.en:
Mr.Baljinnyam lives with his wife and two sons, in a ger, in the Howd province of Mongolia. His older son is a secondary school student and his youngest son goes to kindergarten. He and his wife manage a billiard service business, which they started in 2010. He has prior loan experience in which he bought car to use for taxi service. 

They also started to grow organic vegetables such is tomatoes, cucumbers and watermelon, which he has sold in a nearby province since 2012. Now Mr.Baljinnyam is requesting 4,000,000 MNT to pay the transport costs of selling his organic vegetable in Uvs province. His character is good.

loans.use: To pay the transport costs of selling his organic vegetable in Uvs province.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a fifty-year-old married man with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. For the last ten years he has been running a poultry project and he started the business in order to supplement his dairy farm which was often affected by the prolonged dry seasons. Patrick's dreams are educating his children and buying land to expand his farming activities despite challenges of inadequate capital and lack of skilled manpower. 

Patrick is requesting a loan to buy chicken feeds for his poultry project.

loans.use: To buy more chicken feeds.

loans.name: Phally's Group

texts.en:
A 56-year-old married mother of three children, Phally lives in a rural area of the Sangke district of Battambang province. One of her three children is dependent on her and sometimes works for others for a fee to help generate income for the family. She has been involved in farming rice to support the family for thirty years, earning about 44,000 KHR per day to feed her family members. The main challenge for her paddy is flooding.

Phally has been with VisionFund for six cycles and completely paid back the past loans which have helped her relieve her family’s financial burden and improve their livelihood. Now she is leading her group with two other members to ask for a loan with VisionFund. Phally will use her portion to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to make more healthy rice so as to gain more income to better her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Sokheap's Group

texts.en:
Sokheap, 38, is married and lives with her husband and four children in a rural village of the Sangke district of Battambang province. Out of her four children, she still has three children to take care of and all of them are still in school. To make a living, she has been farming rice for almost twelve years and supplements family’s income by selling grocery items in her village. From her current business, she is able to earn about 80,000 KHR per day and manages to save about 20,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. Low crop yield is the main challenge for her paddy-rice business.  

Sokheap has been with Kiva’s partner, VisioFund, for one cycle while the other member has been with VisionFund for three cycles. She successfully repaid the past loan which has helped her to support and expand her business. Now she and her group member are requesting a loan of 1,200,000 KHR and 1,4000,000 KHR respectively. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland and use a portion of it to buy more grocery items to sell. With this loan, she hopes her current business will become productive and more profitable in order to increase further her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Amanda

texts.en:
Amanda, 35, resides with her three children and her husband at West Point. She is a college student, and her husband is a business man. Her children are between the ages of four and 19. She has sold rice, vita, pepper, washing soap, palm oil and other items in the market for the past fifteen years. 

She started in this business with initial capital from her husband and learned to sell from her mother. She likes this business because it helps her with her children's schooling. She also makes profits when she sells. With the profit she buys more goods to improve the business. She is requesting a loan to  purchase more vita, rice, palm oil, washing soap and pepper for the business. Her plan for the future is to become a big business woman.

loans.use: to  purchase more vita, rice, palm oil, washing soap and pepper for the business.

loans.name: Chanthou's Group

texts.en:
Chanthou is 36 years old and married. She lives with her husband and five children in a village of the Ratanak Mondul district of Battambang province, Cambodia. All of her children are dependent and still in school. To make a living, she has grown corn for ten years. Chanthou is able to earn about 20,000 KHR per day and manages to save about 6,000 KHR each day after deducting daily expenses. Drought is the main challenge for her paddy-field business.

She has been with VisionFund for four cycles while the other members have been with VisonFund for five cycles. The past loans have improved her current business. She and her group member are now asking for a loan with VisionFund of 1,200,000 KHR each. As the leader, Chanthou will use her portion to buy seeds and fertilizers for her corn business and use a fragment of it to spend on plowing the field. She hopes to grow her corn fruitfully in order to sell it for a good price in the market so as to make a better  living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her corn business.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a 28-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. She is engaged in a sari-sari (convenience store) business for four years now. This is the source of her income. Marites is in need of additional capital for her business. She is asking for a loan worth PHP 5,000 to buy more stock to sell in her store such as canned goods, dry goods, noodles, snack foods etc. Through this, she will be able to attract and cater to more customers.
In the future, Marites wants to keep reinvesting to augment her income for the future schooling of her two young children.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell in her store such as canned goods, dry goods, noodles, snack foods, etc.

loans.name: Sokhorn's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in the Moung Ruseey district of Battambang district, Cambodia, Sokhorn is a 49-year-old mother of seven children, three of whom are dependents. To support the family, she has sold rice soup and Chinese noodles in her local area for ten years. She can earn about 34,000 KHR per day from her current business. 

Sokhorn has been a member of VisionFund for two cycles while the other members have been with VisionFund from one to two cycles. She has successfully used the past loans to improve her business and family's living condition progressively. Now she is leading her group of three to ask for a loan with VisionFund. Sokhorn, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy kitchen wares and condiments for her current business. She hopes this loan will help her business grow in order to gain more income so as to earn a good living.

loans.use: to buy condiments for making soup for selling.

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en:
Jeniffer used a previous loan to buy soap, sugar and matchboxes to sell. She is a thirty-six-years-old diploma holder, married with three children, living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. The responsibility of looking after the family is vested in her, and her family dream is to educate her children and build a permanent house. 

She has a retail shop which she has been operating for the last four years. She faces the challenge of price fluctuation, and her dream is to own a wholesale shop. Jeniffer needs the loan to buy merchandise like sugar, posho (maize flour), soap and match boxes to sell.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like sugar, posho (maize flour), soap  and match boxes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy packets of metabolic tea.

loans.name: Daouda

texts.fr:
Daouda est un jeune qui s’est très vite lancé dans le commerce qu’il a hérité de ses parents. Il a une expérience de plus de 10 ans dans ce domaine. Et c’est grâce à son père qu’il a bien pu démarrer car il possède une grande boutique d’alimentation  générale et a une renommé dans le village ou il loge. Il est marié et responsable de famille.   
Daouda a toujours travaillé avec ses propres moyens seulement pour cette fois ci, il vient solliciter l’appui de l’IMCEC pour un crédit de 200000F CFA avec lesquels il va se ravitailler en riz d’une quantité de 20 sacs, en huile, un baril et du sucre.
Il gère la dépense quotidienne de son foyer. Il nourrit l’ambition e faire un jour, s’il a les moyens, de l’embouche.
texts.en:
Daouda is a young man, who quickly started working in the store that he inherited from his parents. He has over 10 years’ experience in this field. It was thanks to his father that he was able to start up, as he has a large general food store and is well-known in the village where he lives. Daouda is married and responsible for a family.

Daouda has always worked with his own means, but for this first time he has requested the financial support of UIMCEC. He has requested a loan of 200,000 francs CFA, which he will use to buy 20 bags of rice, a barrel of oil, and sugar. Daouda is responsible for his daily household expenses and, in the future and if he has the means, he dreams of working in raising livestock.

loans.use: To buy food items to stock his store.

loans.name: Ten

texts.en: Ten is 53 years old and a rural villager from Kror Kor district of Pursat. She is a widow and mother to two children, one of whom is a student at a local public school in the community. From a one-hectare area of farmland, she can grow rice as a main source of income; she also adds to her income by selling clothes and grocery items. She can make about KHR 33,000 per day from the current business that she has been with for 25 years. Her main challenge is lack of water supply for her rice field. This is her second-cycle loan with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. She has successfully paid back the entire previous loan, which has enabled to support her both businesses. Now, she is requesting the amount of KHR 3,000,000. She will use this loan to buy fertilizer and to pay for the plowing and harvesting fees. She expects to receive a good yield so she can enlarge her profit and improve her living condition.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay the plowing and harvesting fees.

loans.name: Deo

texts.en: Deo is a fifty-five year old married man with six children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is hardworking and determined to change his future and that of his children by educating them. Deo is a farmer and also operates a drug shop as a supplementary income source since farming is seasonal. He has been in business for eight years and with the income earned, he has been able to buy more land and pay school fees for his children. Like all farmers, he is challenged by the unpredictable seasonal weather changes and price fluctuation. His dreams are to venture into modern farming methods and setting up a fully-fledged clinic to serve his community. Deo intends to use the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay schoool fees for his children.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy spare car parts for her husband's repair shop.

loans.name: Justine Claire

texts.fr: Justine est un femme  de 30 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants, deux d'entre eux vont déjà à l'école. Elle gére un centre d'appels téléphoniques dans un quartier de la capitale depuis 04 ans déjà où elle vend des crédits de communication et les friandises et fruits en fonction des saisons.Grâce à son expérience et à la bonne maitrise de cette activité, elle a conquis une clientèle considérable au fil des années.Cependant, cette clientèle étant de plus en plus grandissante,le maximum de crédit qu'elle est en mesure de se procurer auprès des opérateurs téléphoniques avec son capital ne lui permet guère de satisfaire la demande de celle-ci.Elle sollicite donc ce crédit afin de pouvoir s'approvisionner convenablement ce qui lui permettra de satisfaire aux mieux sa clientèle et augmentera ses bénéfices. Bénéfices qui lui permettront d'une part de réinvestir dans son activité afin d'étendre ses points de vente et d'autre part de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Justine is a 30-year-old woman, who is married and mother to three children, two of whom are already at school. She has managed a telephone call center in a neighborhood in the capital for four years, where she sells call credit, candies and seasonal fruit. Thanks to her experience and her skills in this business, she has built up a considerable customer base over the years. However, as her customer numbers keep growing, the maximum amount of call credit she can buy from the telephone operators does not allow her to satisfy demand.

Justine has requested this loan to get enough supply to better meet her customers’ needs and, therefore, increase her profits. These profits will allow her to reinvest in her business and expand her points of sale, as well as to provide for her family.

loans.use: To increase her stock of call credit.

loans.name: Gloria Margarita

texts.es:
Gloria es una mujer trabajadora que comenzó con su negocio porque quería ser independiente y a la vez tener un negocio en la casa porque también necesitaba atender a sus hijos. 

Por lo cual convirtió una parte de su casa en una pequeña tienda donde vende víveres de primera necesidad. Trabaja en la tienda sola desde las 7:00am hasta las 20:00pm, Gloria está casada y si tiene hijos pero son adultos y casados su esposo es albañil.  Con el préstamo va a comprar arroz, azúcar, sal, enlatados para su tienda.  Unas de sus metas es poder incrementar con mas productos su tienda y también hacer más grande su negocio
texts.en:
Gloria is a hard-working woman, who started her business because she wanted to be independent, as well as to have a business in her home, as she also had to look after her children. She therefore turned part of her home into a small store, where she sells basic provisions. She works alone in the store from 7 am until 8 pm.

Gloria is married and has children, although they are now married adults. Her husband is a bricklayer. With this loans he plans to buy rice, sugar, salt and canned goods for her store. One of Gloria’s goals is to increase the stock of products she sells in her store, as well as to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, salt and other provisions.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es: La Sra.  Sofía tiene 51 años dos hijos que son de las edades de 25 y 21  años,  La Sra. Sofía se dedica  a la   venta de variedad de ropa, ella tiene un puesto fijo en la zona Villa Ortuño,  donde ofrece sus productos,  este préstamo es su quinta secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Sofía va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de variedad de  ropa por mayor y de esta manera brindar variedad de ropa  a su clientela e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Sofía va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando variedad de ropa, la Sra. Sofía es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en: Sofía is 51 years old and has two children who are 25 and 21 years old.  Her business is selling clothing.  She has a fixed stall in Villa Ortuño where she sells her products.  This loan is her fifth from the institution.  She will use it to buy more clothing wholesale so that she can provide her customers with a good range and thereby increase her profits.  She is requesting this loan so that she can continue improving in her business and will use her profits to continue buying a range of clothing.  Sofía is a very hard-working person who feels happy for the opportunity she has been given.

loans.use: to buy a range of clothing

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es: El Sr. Fredy tiene 38 años, casado con tres hijos de las edades de 6, 3 y un año, el es repostero, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan, galletas y tortas en una de las avenidas más concurridas de la zona de Pampahasi,  este préstamo es su primera  secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Fredy  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de una batidora industrial como tiene  un horno de mayor capacidad y quiere incrementar su producción y así satisfacer la demandada de sus clientes, Fredy enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia de una panadería que produce en mayor cantidad, con este crédito mejorara sus ganancias, Fredy es una persona  con ganas de superación se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que esta es la única fuente de ingresos que tiene para mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
Fredy is 38 years of age, married, and has three children aged 6, 3 and 1 year of age. He works as a pastry chef, making and selling bread, cookies and cakes in one of the busiest streets in the area of Pampahasi. This is his first loan with this institution. 

Fredy plans to use this loan to buy an industrial beater, as he has a large-capacity oven and would like to increase his output. This will allow him to meet his customers’ requests. Fredy faces various challenges with his business, such as competition from a bakery which has greater production capacity. With this loan he will improve his profits. 

Fredy is a person who wants to get ahead in life. He is happy and thankful to the microfinance institution for the support given to him, as this is the only source of income he has to provide for his family.

loans.use: To buy an industrial beater.

loans.name: Juan Rogelio

texts.es: El Sr. Juan tiene 43 años, casado con cuatro hijos de las edades de 22, 18, 15 y 12, el es pescador el vive en una isla Del lago Titicaca, centro turístico del departamento de la paz, hay artesanías  de totoras y en lana, la mayoría de los habitantes de esta isla se dedican a la pesca,   este préstamo es su primera  secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Juan va a usar este préstamo para la compra de una bote pesquero de mayor capacidad su mercadería producto de su pesca lo venden en la ciudad de La Paz y con este nuevo bote  quiere incrementar su producción y así satisfacer la demandada de sus clientes, Juan enfrenta retos en su negocio que son el viento que no le permite pescar por el olaje que levanta, Juan es una persona  con ganas de superación se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que esta es la única fuente de ingresos que tiene para mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan is 43 years of age, married, and has four children aged 22, 18, 15 and 12. He works as a fisherman and lives on an island on Lake Titicaca, a tourist center in the department of La Paz. This area is known for bullrush and wool handicrafts, and the majority of the island’s inhabitants work in fishing. 

This is Juan’s first loan with this institution, and he plans to use it to buy a larger fishing boat. He sells the fish he catches in the city of La Paz, and with his new boat he wants to increase his output and meet his customers’ requests. Juan faces challenges in his business, such as the wind which can raise high waves which do not allow him to go out fishing. 

Juan is a person who wants to get ahead in life. He is happy, and thankful to the microfinance institution for the support given to him, as this is the only source of income he has to provide for his family.

loans.use: To buy a boat and nets.

loans.name: Zoe

texts.en: Zoe, aged 45, is a mother of five children and is married. She lives in West Point; her husband is a carpenter. Her children are between the ages of nine and 28; three of them attend school, two are independent, and the oldest one is married. For the past eight years, she has been selling rice, palm oil, vita, coal, and onions at the community market, she learned to sell from her aunt, she is proud of her business because she earns her own income and helps her husband with the expenses of the home. She is requesting this loan to purchase more rice, palm oil, onion, coal, and vita for the business. Her plan for the future is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, palm oil, onion, coal, and vita for the business.

loans.name: Kpannah

texts.en:
Kpannah is 45 years old and lives in Sinkor. She is married and has four children between the ages of 22 to 27. Two of her children are presently in school and live at home.

For the past 20 years, Kpannah has been running a cook shop (restaurant). She enjoys her business and she has a lot of customers. She is requesting this loan to purchase fish, rice, oil and pepper for her business. Her plan is to send her children to a quality university in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase fish, rice, oil and pepper for her business.

loans.name: Sheyla Lissette

texts.es:
Sheyla es soltera tiene 22 años no tiene hijos, ella empezó su negocio hace 5 años con una pequeña vitrina y una percha vendiendo papelería. Sheyla estudia en la mañana en la universidad por lo cual permanece cerrado el bazar-papelería en la mañana y lo  abre ya en la tarde para sus clientes. 

El tipo de negocio que emprende es bazar papelería en donde hace anillados, encuaderna y venta de  libros. Con el préstamo quiere comprar papelería, cuadernos, suministros. El sueño de Sheyla es finalizar su carrera, que su negocio crezca y que su familia permanezca unida
texts.en:
22-year-old Sheyla is single and doesn't have any children.  She started her business five years ago with a small display case and a stand, selling stationery.  Sheyla studies at university in the mornings so her stationery store is closed in the mornings.  She opens for her customers in the afternoons.

Sheyla's business is a store selling miscellaneous items and stationery where she offers ring binding and binding services, and sells books.  She would like to use this loan to buy stationery, notebooks and supplies.  Sheyla's dreams are to finish her degree, for her business to grow, and for her family to remain united.

loans.use: to buy stationery, notebooks and other supplies

loans.name: Sokun's Group

texts.en:
