loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Yendry

texts.es: Yendry, tiene la edad  de 19 años, está soltera,  vive con sus padres  actualmente. Ella con el crédito pretende comprar  insumos como abonos y fumigaciones  y ayudarse con la mano de obra. Ella  tiene pensado asistir este almacigo para su posterior siembra   y así  poder producir un poco mas y  poder generar más ganancias  y obtener una mejor calidad de vida y una estabilidad económica y poder ayudar a sus padres. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Yendry is 19 years old and is single. She currently lives with her parents. She intends to use the loan to buy supplies such as fertilizer and fumigants and to pay for some labor. She plans to prepare her seedbeds for planting later and so to produce a little more and to be able to generate a better income and get a better quality of life and economic stability to be able to help her parents. This is the first loan that she has had from FUDECOSUR. She has not had earlier loans from a state bank but FUDECOSUR has offered her the loan with better facilities and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: get assistance and grow coffee.

loans.name: Mean's Group

texts.en:
Mean, a rural villager from Kror Kor district, Cambodia, is also a 65-year-old, married mother of four children who currently are living with her. To meet the daily basic expenses in her household, Mean has been farming on one hectare of farmland for 45 years, earning about 14,000 KHR per day. Besides helping in the rice field, Mean’s husband also helps with a pig-raising business. For this couple, their main challenge is the insufficient water supply for her paddy field. 

Including this cycle, Mean has joined VisionFund (Kiva's partner) for two cycles. With success, she has paid back the entire first loan which has helped her to afford working capital to buy fertilizer for her rice farm and additional pigs to raise. Also, she has received a decent income from her business. Now she forms a group of four female members; three members, including her, are in the second-cycle seeking 1,200,000 KHR each while a remaining fellow group member is in the fourth-cycle applying for 500,000 KHR. As the group leader, Mean will use her loan portion to buy more fertilizer and to pump water for her farm. She also will use a portion of it to buy pig feed. She expects to receive more profit from her cash-crop so as to stabilize her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pig feed, and pay for water pumping

loans.name: Las Azucenas Group

texts.es: La Sra. Vilma es conviviente, tiene 1  hijo, Vilma   tiene 52  años de edad  actualmente es integrante en la alcancía comunal “Las Azucenas” grupo  conformado por 9 socios que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio. Vilma  trabaja  desde hace 15  años en la venta y crianza de cerdo a su vez tiene una moto propia que lo alquila, Vilma tambien trabaja en un hospital en el aerea de central telefonica, Vilma nos cuenta que tiene clientes fidelizados y su negocio sigue creciendo , gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación a logrado mejores ingresos económicos, esta construyendo su casa y se ha comprado su segunda moto para alquilarla.  con el fin de seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar cerdos alimentarlos y criarlos para luego venderlos. Vilma  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y agradece el prestamo de Edaprospo y kiva.
texts.en: Vilma lives with her partner. She has one son. Vilma is 52 years old and is currently a member of the community bank "Las Azucenas" (the Lilies). This group has 9 members who work in various commercial sectors. Vilma has been working for 15 years selling and raising pigs and she has a motorbike that she rents out. Vilma also works at the central switchboard of a hospital. Vilma tells us that she has loyal customers and her business continues to grow. Thanks to her efforts and dedication, she has achieved better income. She is building her house and has bought a second motorbike to rent out. She has requested a new loan with the goal of continuing to grow. She will buy, raise, and feed pigs to sell later. With a lot of handwork and effort, Vilma will meet her goals. She is grateful to Edaprospo and Kiva for the loan.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Juan Pedro

texts.es:
Juan es un vendedor ambulante de mariscos pero con la reubicación en el Municipio ya tiene un puesto en el mercado de mariscos y por ese motivo decidió seguir trabajando en esta línea de venta. 

Su horario de trabajo es de lunes  a domingo de 7:00am hasta las 19:00pm. Unas de sus dificultades es tener que transportar su mercadería pues no cuenta con vehículo propio. Juan está casado tiene 3 hijos estudian en escuela fiscal y su esposa se dedica a vender artículos para el hogar.

Con el préstamo  va a comprar pescados y mariscos. Unas de sus metas para los próximos 5 años es tener un local propio para tener rentabilidad.
texts.en:
Juan was selling seafood as a street vendor, however with relocation in the town, he now has a stall selling seafood in the market. Thus he decided to continue working in this type of sales.

His work schedule is from Mondays to Sundays, from 7 a.m. until 7 p.m. One of his difficulties is the need to transport his merchandise, since he does not own a vehicle.

Juan is married and has three children, who are in pubic school. His wife sells household items,

He will use the loan to purchase fish and other seafood. One of his goals for the next five years is to have his own shop and to become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase fish and shrimp.

loans.name: Kantutas De Exaltación Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “KANTUTAS DE EXALTACIÓN” iniciará el ciclo primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Gimena es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: transportista, tienda y carnicería, ferretería, venta de cosméticos, alojamiento, venta de ropa, venta de chompas, comerciante de sandwin.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Gimena es una integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su amiga que es socias de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa, ella nos cuenta que este negocio lo inicio por el incentivo de sus padres desde hace varios años 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ropa) que comprará de las comerciantes que venden por mayor y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Kantutas de Exalatción" will begin its first loan cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the regional center of Villa Exaltación. It consists of nine members and is governed by a board of directors, with Señora Gimena as its president. The members of the communal bank conduct a variety of businesses. Among them are transportation, store and butcher shop, hardware store, cosmetics sales, accommodations, selling clothing, selling sweaters, and selling sandwiches.

The loan that they will take out will benefit these little micro-entrepreneurs, one of whom is Señora Gimena. She comments that this is the first time that she has been part of Pro Mujer, joining at the invitation of her friend, who is a member of the institution. Now she has a business of selling clothes. She tells us that she began this business with the encouragement of her parents a number of years ago.

The loan that she will take out now will be used to increase her capital by purchasing clothing to sell; she will buy from wholesale dealers and will then sell at her sales location. This form of work allows her to generate income to support her family, since she is in a common-law marriage and has two children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health training and the loans.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Joselin Stefania

texts.es:
Joselin es una joven de 20 años, es soltera, vive con sus padres y hermanos en la ciudad de Chincha, a pesar de su corta edad Joselin es una joven trabajadora y entusiasta que tiene un gran deseo de superación y muchas ganas de ayudar a sus padres, ya que desea agradecerles por los cuidados y apoyo brindados; en sus ratos libres le gusta dedicar tiempo a sus estudios y en algunas oportunidades invita a su familia un riquísimo Pollo a la Brasa para compartir con ellos.
Con mucho empeño, entusiasmo y con el apoyo de sus padres, Joselin se encuentra estudiando la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas, gracias a ello y a su esfuerzo ella trabaja como auxiliar contable en una empresa de su ciudad, Joselin se siente a gusto realizando su labor ya que lo consideran mucho por su buen desempeño y trato amable hacia los demás.
Joselin se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos para la tramitación de su matrícula y pago de mensualidades en su centro de estudios; de esta manera Joselin podrá mejorar su condición académica y reforzar sus conocimientos, para así poder desarrollarse como una buena profesional y con ello espera poder obtener un buen trabajo con el cual pueda seguir apoyando a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Joselin is a young woman of twenty. She is single and lives with her parents and brothers in the ciy of Chincha. Her youth does not prevent her from being hardworking and enthusiastic, eager to do her best and wanting to help her parents. She is very grateful to them for raising her and taking care of her. In her spare time she likes to study and to cook for her family, her signature dish being braised chicken. With a lot of dedication, enthusiasm, and her parents' support, she is studying business administration. Thanks to that and her efforts she is working as an accountant in a company in her city. Joselin  is happy with her work, as are her employers, who value her efforts and her good relationship with colleagues. Joselin is very grateful to Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help she will be able to cover the costs of obtaining her professional licence and the cost of enrollment in her school. Thus she will be able to have a higher diploma and learn more about her trade, in order to become a knowledgeable professional and get a good job with which to continue helping her family have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to cover her education costs.

loans.name: Cesar Rolando

texts.es:
Cesar es un hombre de 26 años muy trabajador, él  vive en la ciudad de Pisco, caracterizada por sus hermosas playas y clima cálido. Cuando Cesar cuenta con tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte, siendo su comida favorita el delicioso Cau Cau de Pollo; con mucho empeño logró concluir sus estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado poder cursar la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas. 
Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación, y gracias al apoyo de su madre, Cesar se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, especialmente de tubérculos, él trabaja diariamente un aproximado de 14 horas y puede atender hasta 20 ó más clientes, debido a su experiencia, acogida y carisma hacia la atención de ellos.  
Cesar se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a ellos va poder comprar más mercadería, tales como arroz, azúcar, aceite, etc. , para equipar mejor su negocio de venta de abarrotes y con ello más adelante podrá obtener un puesto en el mercado de su ciudad, de esta manera podrá mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida para él y su familia.
texts.en: Cesar is twenty-six and very hardworking. He lives in the town of Pisco, know for its beautiful beaches and warm climate. In his spare time, he likes to practice sports, and his favourite dish is 'cau cau de pollo' (Peruvian diced chicken). He managed to finish secondary school, but he would have liked to continue his studies and graduate in business administration. With a lot of effort and dedication, and the support of his mother, Cesar sell groceries, principally tubers. He works about fourteen hours every day and tends to more than twenty customers, thanks to his experience and the warm welcome he gives them. Cesar is very grateful to Kiva lenders, whose help will enable him to buy more merchandise to sell in his shop, such as rice, sugar, oil, etc. Thus his grocery shop will be better-stocked and he will stand a chance to have a stall in the city's market. He will then be able to improve his income and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Lesvi Lizeth

texts.es: Lesvi tiene 37 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos y vive en Puerto Cortes.  Lesvi hace 7 meses que decidió tener su fuente de ingresos fija y vende granos básicos, frutas, productos de limpieza, tajadas, condimentos y otros abarrotes. Ya tiene buena clientela en su comunidad. El préstamo que solicita es de 10,000 Lempiras y lo invertirá en la compra de más productos de abarrotería para surtir su negocio e incrementar las ventas. Su plan es seguir trabajando y seguir invirtiendo para hacer crecer el negocio.
texts.en:
Lesvi, age 37, is a single mother with three children.  She lives in Puerto Cortes.

Seven months ago Lesvi decided to have a source of fixed income and sell basic grains, fruit, cleaning products, ‘tajadas’ [fried banana slices], condiments, and other groceries.  She now has good clientele in her community.

She will use the loan for 10,000 lempiras that she is requesting to buy more grocery products to stock her business and increase sales.  Her plan is to continue working and to continue investing in order to make her business grow.

loans.use: to buy grocery products like basic grains, condiments, 'tajadas' [fried banana slices], and cleaning products, etc.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.es: Jonathan, tiene la edad  de 26 años, está casado,  vive con su esposa y dos hijos, están en la escuela. El con el crédito pretende comprar una bomba de fumigar para la plantación de café. El tiene pensado comprar  esta bomba  para fumigar de una forma más rápida  y que le rinda mas el producto y sea más efectivo y  mantener el café en buen estado y poder producir un poco mas y  poder generar más ganancias  y obtener una mejor calidad de vida y poder pagar el estudio de los hijos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Jonathan is twenty-six, married, and lives with his wife and their two children, who are in school. With the loan, he wants to buy a fumigation pump for his coffee plantation. He wants to buy the pump in order to fumigate quicklier and more efficiently, and to waste less product. That way, he can keep the coffee plants in good condition and produce a bit more, in order to increase his earnings, have a better quality of life and be able to afford his children's education. This is his first loan with field partner Fudecosur. He never even took out a loan with a state bank: he turned to Fudecosur because of the much lower interest rates and the less strict granting conditions.

loans.use: to buy a fumigation pump.

loans.name: Iris Iveth

texts.es: La señora Iris, tiene 41 años de edad, casada, tiene una hija, vive en Chamelecón, San Pedro Sula. ella tiene 9 años de dedicarse a vender comida, vende pollo frito con tajadas de banano, tacos, tajadas con carne molida, baleadas, etc. el negocio lo tiene en su casa y lo ha mantenido estable y activo, está creciendo cada día. Esta solicitando un segundo préstamo y es por 8,000 Lempiras, con el cual va comprar los insumos para la elaboración de comida para vender. Su plan es hacer crecer el negocio para obtener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Iris, age 41, is married and has a daughter.  She lives in Chamelecón, San Pedro Sula.

She has been selling food for nine years.  She sells fried chicken with fried banana slices, tacos, fried banana slices with ground meat, and ‘baleadas’ [flour tortillas with beans, eggs, butter, cheese and meat], etc.  The business is at her house, and she has kept it stable and active.  It is growing each day.

She is requesting a second loan for 8,000 lempiras.  She will use the loan to buy supplies to make the food she sells.  Her plan is to make her business grow and to get greater income.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make the food she sells.  She will buy meat, chicken, vegetables, condiments, and lard, etc.

loans.name: Luis Eduardo

texts.es: Luis Eduardo, tiene la edad  de 33 años, está casado,  vive con su esposa y dos hijos, uno en la escuela y el otro en el colegio   actualmente. El con el crédito pretende comprar  insumos como abonos y fumigaciones  y un poco de herbicidas y además  ayudarse con la mano de obra. El tiene pensado comprar  estos insumos para mantener el café en buen estado y poder producir un poco mas y  poder generar más ganancias  y obtener una mejor calidad de vida y poder pagar el estudio de los hijos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Luis Eduardo is thirty-three, married, and lives with his wife and two children, one of whom is in school, while the other attends secondary school. With the loan, he wants to buy supplies for his coffee plantation, such as fertiliser, fumigation, and some herbicide. He would also like to hire help. These will help keep the plants in good condition, enabling him to produce a bit more and thus earn a bigger income to have a better quality of life and be able to afford his children's education. This is his first loan with field partner Fudecosur. He never even took out a loan with a state bank: he turned to Fudecosur because of the much lower interest rates and the less strict granting conditions.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Yamilet

texts.es: Yamilet, tiene la edad  de 33 años, está casada,  vive con su esposo y dos hijos actualmente. Ella con el crédito pretende comprar dos novillos de engorde ella  cuenta ya con dos  novillos en su poder y lo que pretende es reforzar el negocio. Ella  tiene pensado engordarlos y poder venderlo en el mercado local y lugares aledaños y  poder generar más ganancias  y obtener una mejor calidad de vida y además poder pagar el estudio de los  hijos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Yamilet is 33 years old, married and currently lives with her husband and two children.  With this loan, she intends to buy two heifers to fatten.  She already owns two heifers but wants to reinforce her business.  She is planning on fattening them to be able to sell them in the local market and other neighboring places in order to generate greater profits, obtain a better quality of life and to pay for her children's schooling.  

This is the first loan that she has received from FUDECOSUR.  She had never had other loans from state-owned banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered her the loan with more ease and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: purchase two heifers for fattening

loans.name: Edwin Alberto

texts.es: Edwin Alberto, tiene la edad  de 46 años, está soltero,  vive con su mama actualmente. El con el crédito pretende comprar una vaca de leche, el cuenta ya con tres vacas en su poder y lo que pretende es reforzar el negocio. El tiene pensado producir más leche, queso y natilla y poder venderlo en el mercado local y lugares aledaños y  poder generar más ganancias  y obtener una mejor calidad de vida. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Edwin Alberto is forty-six and single. His mother lives with him. With the loan, he wants to buy another milk cow. He already has three, and he wants his business to grow. He plans to produce more milk, cream and cheese in order to sell these products at the local market and other places in the area, and thus increase his income and have a better quality of life. This is his first loan with field partner Fudecosur. He never even took out a loan with a state bank: he turned to Fudecosur because of the much lower interest rates and the less strict granting conditions.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise like shoes, sneakers, boots, etc.

loans.name: Carlos Octavio

texts.es:
Carlos trabaja en el taller de tapicería que viene de tradición familiar, y gracias a que su padre le enseñó la actividad desde muy joven para trabajar a su lado, ahora cuenta con una gran experiencia que le permite ofrecer a sus clientes productos de muy buena calidad. Desde hace mucho tiempo que está el negocio ubicado y esto ha permitido que se posicione en el municipio, y por tanto las dificultades económicas en su hogar se habían venido superando poco a poco. Sin embargo, debido a que en los últimos meses Carlos se vio enfrentado a una dura situación familiar con uno de sus hijos, ha visto como su condición económica se ha afectado fuertemente y ha hecho que en su hogar tengan que enfrentar serias adversidades. Gracias a su esfuerzo, ha logrado superar la dificultad, pero debido a que dejó de trabajar en el taller durante unos días ha visto como los pedidos de sus clientes se retrazan y ahora no cuenta con el capital suficiente para poder responder por ellos. Es por esto que Carlos busca un préstamo para comprar materias primas que requiere para la tapicería de los pedidos retrazados que tiene por parte de sus clientes.

Carlos espera poder seguir saliendo adelante y superar la adversidad que se le ha presentado en su familia. Además, aspira a que su negocio le permita ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida en su hogar y mayores oportunidades económicas para progresar.
texts.en:
Carlos works in his family's upholstery workshop.  Thanks to his father teaching him the craft at a young age, he now has a lot of experience which allows him to offer his clients high quality products.  Since the business has been around for a long time, it has attained a good standing in the community and because of that, the economic hardships in his family have been getting better little by little.  However, in the past few months due to a difficult situation with one of his sons, Carlos has come to see his financial condition be strongly affected, causing serious setbacks in his household.  

Thanks to his hard work, he has been able to overcome the difficulty, but due to the fact that he was not able to work in the shop for a few days, his clients' orders have backed up, and he does not have the capital to fulfill the orders.  For this reason, Carlos is looking for a loan to purchase the raw materials needed for the upholstery of his backordered items.  

Carlos hopes to continue prospering and overcoming the adversity that his family has faced.  Furthermore, he strives for his business to offer him a better quality of life at home and better economic opportunities for growth.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials needed for the upholstery of his clients' backordered items.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es:
Jorge comenzó trabajando desde los 14 años de edad como ayudante en un minimercado y así aprendió la actividad de los negocios y la venta de alimentos. Luego trabajó en una cafetería durante 4 años y durante estos años ahorró lo que más podía porque su meta fue siempre ser independiente. Hace 4 meses logró montar su propia legumbrería y ha tenido buenos clientes en el sector, y trabajando fuertemente ha logrado venir superando la dificultad de capital que tiene. Debido que al ofrecer más variedad de verduras que sus clientes han demandado sus ventas aumentarán considerablemente, Jorge busca un préstamo para comprar una estantería y verduras y frutas para surtir su negocio y ofrecer mayor variedad.

Su sueño es poder salir adelante con su propio negocio y crecer para generar empleo y en un futuro abrir su propio minimercado.
texts.en: Jorge began working when he was 14 years old as an assistant in a mini market and this is how he was able to learn the trade. He then worked in a cafeteria for 4 years and during this time, he began to save as much as he could so that he could one day be independent. Four months ago, he was able to achieve this goal and has had good customers since.By working hard, he has been able to overcome the difficulties of not having enough capital. Because he wants to offer a wider variety of vegetables to his customers, as they have asked, he believes his sales will increase considerably. Jorge is looking for a loan in order to purchase shelving and vegetables and fruits to stock his business and offer a wider selection. His dream is to be successful in his own business and to grow it enough to generate employment and in the future open his own mini market.

loans.use: To buy shelving and fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Marey

texts.en:
Marey is 25 years old. She lives in Sinkor and has two children, ages 1 and 6. She is a married, and she was not able to attend school. She's making an effort to send all her children to school. 

Since 2000, she has been preparing and selling cooked food at a restaurant. She started this business with some help from her mother. She's proud to be in this business because she can send her children to school and have some savings. 

Marey has requested a loan to purchase oil, rice, pepper, juice, and cold water for her business. Her plan for the business is to open a shop in the near future.

loans.use: To purchase oil, rice, pepper, juice, and cold water for her business

loans.name: Victor Andres

texts.es:
Victor es un joven emprendedor que comenzó trabajando desde hace mucho tiempo en un restaurante y gracias a esto aprendió la actividad de los negocios y también alcanzó a ahorrar un pequeño dinero para montar su propio negocio, ya que siempre había soñado con ser independiente. Fue así como montó una pequeña tienda general donde en un principio solo contaba con el capital suficiente para poder ofrecer a sus clientes productos básicos de la canasta familiar; ahora gracias a su esfuerzo, ha venido aumentando la variedad de productos que ofrece y adicional a los productos de la canasta familiar puede ofrecer a sus clientes comidas rápidas. Debido a que el invierno le ha venido perjudicando bastante, Victor busca un préstamo para comprar una carpa, una mesa y sillas para adecuar un espacio afuera de su tienda donde pueda atender a sus clientes cuando llueve.

Su sueño es poder tener un negocio más grande y seguir aportando económicamente en su hogar para que sus padres sigan teniendo una mejor calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades económicas para progresar.
texts.en:
Victor is a young entrepreneur who began working a long time ago in a restaurant. Thanks to this he learned the basics of business and was able to save a little money to start his own business, since he always dreamed of being independent. 

By saving, he started a small general store where, at the beginning, he only had enough money to offer basic products for the tipical pantry. Now, thanks to his efforts, he has increased the variety of products that he offers, and additional to basic pantry items, he can offer quick meals to his customers. 

Wintertime has arrived and it is hurting his business. 

Victor is requesting a loan to buy a tent, table, and seats so he can attend to his customers when it rains. 

His dream is to be able to have a larger business and continue contributing financially to his home. This way his parents may continue to have a better quality of life and better economical opportunities.

loans.use: to buy a tent, table, and seats to accomodate enough space outside of his store where he can support customers when it rains.

loans.name: Oliva De Jesus

texts.es:
Oliva salió de su municipio natal hacia la ciudad desde los 13 años de edad para buscar trabajo y poder mejorar las condiciones económicas, ya que sus padres eran muy pobres. En la cuidad consiguió trabajo con diferentes empresas, también se casó y tuvo 3 hijos, pero cuando el padre de sus hijos la abandonó quedó sola a cargo del sostenimiento de sus hijos. Así, trabajó durante unos 3 meses gratis para una señora por la comida para ella y sus 3 hijos y también le enseñó la actividad de la confección, lo que luego le permitió emplearse en una empresa de confecciones por más de 20 años. Ahora tiene la ventaja de que un hijo suyo ya es mayor y tiene un trabajo con el que le colabora para seguir sosteniendo el hogar y sus otros 2 hijos, y esto ha permitido ir mejorando la calidad de vida en el hogar. Por dificultades de salud, Oliva se vio obligada a dejar su trabajo, pero como aún requiere de los ingresos para sostener el hogar, decidió montar el taller de confección en su casa con una máquina básica y así poder trabajar poco a poco. Como no cuenta con un gran capital en su taller de confección, Oliva busca un préstamo para comprar telas e hilos para confeccionar su propia línea de prendas de vestir.

Su sueño es poder seguir gozando de buena salud para seguir trabajando y poder sacar adelante sus 3 hijos ofreciéndoles una buena calidad de vida y el acceso a una educación de calidad a sus 2 hijos menores. También sueña con en un futuro poder tener una casa propia.
texts.en: Olivia left her home town when she was 13 years old in order to look for work and to improve her economic conditions because her parents were very poor. In the city, she was able to find employment at different businesses and she also married and had 3 children, but when the father of her children left her,  she was left alone to care for them. And so, she worked for free for 3 months for a woman just for food for herself and her children, but she also learned to sew, which allowed her to get a job as a seamstress for more than 20 years. Now, she has the advantage of having her oldest child who has a job and helps her to maintain her home and her other 2 children, and this has helped her to improve the quality of life at home. But because of health problems, Olivia has been obligated to quit her job, but because she needs to still earn an income, she has decided to open her own sewing business from home with her basic machine and in this way be able to work a little bit at a time. Because she doesn't have a lot of money to invest in her new business, she is looking for a loan to purchase fabric and thread to start her own clothing line. Her dream is to be able to enjoy good health and to continue to work and for her 3 children to be successful, to give them a better quality of life and access to quality education for her 2 youngest children. She also dreams to one day own her own home.

loans.use: purchase fabric and thread.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys aprendió a cocinar desde muy joven al lado de sus tías, y ahora para colaborarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y generar su propio ingreso se dedicó a vender algunos alimentos que vendía cada 15 días. Gracias a que le fue bien con este negocio, Gladys comenzó a incrementar los días en que ofrecía a sus clientes los alimentos y ahora trabaja todos los días vendiendo cafés en las mañanas, almuerzos y otros alimentos a sus clientes. Desde que comenzó a generar ingresos, las condiciones económicas en su hogar han mejorado considerablemente, lo que ha permitido que su esposo y sus 3 hijos puedan acceder a una mejor calidad de vida. Buscando aumentar sus ingresos y aprovechando que sus clientes le siguen comprando cada vez más, Gladys busca un préstamo para comprar un termo para el café y una olla más grande donde preparar los alimentos.

Así, espera que sus ventas aumenten considerablemente y sus ingresos permitan tener en su hogar una mejor estabilidad económica, permitiendo que sus hijos accedan a una educación de mejor calidad y en su hogar tengan una mejor calidad de vida. Su sueño es poder salir adelante con su familia y llegar a tener su casa propia.
texts.en: Gladys learned to cook when she was very young at the side of her aunts and now she share the responsibilities of household costs with her husband and to generate her own income, she sells foods every 15 days. Thanks to the fact that this enterprise has went well, Gladys began to increase the number of days she sold food and now she works every day selling coffees in the morning, lunches and other foods to her customers. Since she began to generate an income, the economic conditions in her home have improved considerably, which has been allowed her husband and her 3 children to enjoy a higher quality of life. Looking to increase her profits, she is taking advantage of of the fact that her customers keep buying more and more. Gladys is looking for a loan to purchase a thermos for the coffee and a bigger pot to cook the food in. In this way, she hopes that her sales will increase and that the profits will allow her to have a more stable economic stability in her home, allowing her children access to a better quality education and a better quality of life. Her dream is to be successful, along with her family, and to one day own her own home.

loans.use: purchase a thermos for coffee and a bigger pot to prepare foods.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy milk for her husband's milk and yogurt selling-business

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz Marina recibió clases en el área de la fabricación de calzado y desde entonces fabrica sandalias y bolsos que vende a vecinos, amigos y referidos. Decidió iniciar su negocio para poder generar ingresos con los que colaborara en su hogar a tener una mejor calidad de vida para su esposo y sus 4 hijos, dado que las condiciones económicas estaban en grandes dificultades. La mayor ventaja que tiene es poder manejar su propio tiempo para poder ofrecerles el tiempo necesario a sus hijos preparándoles la comida y arreglándolos para ir a la escuela. Gracias a que últimamente ha tenido buenas ventas, Luz Marina busca un préstamo para comprar sintético, suelas e hilos y fabricar los pedidos que no ha podido responder por falta de capital.

Su sueño es poder sacar su familia adelante brindándoles una buena calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades económicas, además de en un futuro llegar a tener su casa propia. También aspira a algún día poder tener su almacén de venta de calzado donde ofrezca sus propios productos.
texts.en:
Luz Marina took classes in her area, learning how to make shoes. Since that time, she has been making sandals and handbags which she sells to neighbors, friends and customers who are referred to her. She decided to start her business so that she could generate income, which she uses to contribute to her household and achieve a better quality of life for her husband and their 4 children, since they were in a very difficult economic situation. The greatest advantage she has is that she can manage her own time, so that she can offer her children the time they need, preparing their food and getting them ready for school. Thanks to the fact that she has had good sales recently, Luz Marina is seeking a loan to buy synthetic material, soles and threads so she can fulfill orders she was not able to fill due to a lack of capital. 

Her dream is to be able to help her family get ahead, providing them with a good quality of life and better economic opportunities. In addition, in the future she hopes to be able to have her own house. She also aspires to have her own shoe store one day, where she can offer her own products.

loans.use: to buy synthetic material, soles and thread to make shoes in response to customer orders.

loans.name: Juraboy

texts.ru: Дом, где живет Джурабой,  не отвечает стандартам жилья и он срочно должен отремонтировать свой дом. Ему 39 лет, он женат на прекрасной женщине, которую зовут Мамлакат и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Его жена швея. Дети учатся в средней школе и всегда просят родителей отремонтировать их дом, но его доход от скотоводства не достаточно для этого. Он должен отремонтировать крышу, так как скоро начнется дождевой сезон. Джурабой запрашивает кредит на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов для ремонта дома. Джурабой и его дети будут ждать, пока добрые кредиторы помогут им решить проблему жилья.
texts.en:
Juraboy's house is substandard and needs to be repaired urgently. Juraboy is 39 years old and married to a wonderful woman named Mamlakat. They are raising three children. Juraboy's wife is a seamstress. His children are in middle school and are always asking their parents to repair the house, but his income from animal farming cannot cover it.
Juraboy must repair the roof as the rain season will start soon. He has requested a loan of 3,000 Somoni to buy building materials for repairing his house. Juraboy and his children ask the lenders' to kindly help them solve their housing problem.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as cement and wood for repairing his house

loans.name: Monica Janeth

texts.es:
Monica ha trabajado durante varios años en la actividad de venta de mercancías y venta en almacenes, lo que le ha permitido adquirir una gran experiencia y poder así tener los conocimientos básicos para llevar su propio negocio. Después de trabajar durante 7 años vendiendo productos en un almacén, con unos ahorros decidió hacer el esfuerzo y montar su propio negocio de venta de productos de uso personal, y a pesar de que cuando montó su negocio tenía grandes dificultades de capital, su esfuerzo le ha permitido sacarlo adelante y captar cada vez más clientes. Con su negocio las condiciones económicas de su hogar han mejorado y ahora contribuye junto con su esposo para tener en su familia una mayor estabilidad económica. Buscando satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes y superar también su dificultad de capital, Monica busca un préstamo para comprar productos de uso personal y surtir su almacén con productos que se han ido agotando.

Su sueño es llegar a tener un gran negocio donde pueda generar empleo para las personas más necesitadas y también poder ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Monica has worked for several years in the sale of merchandise and sales in stores.  This has allowed her to acquire a lot of experience and be able to gain basic knowledge about how to run her own business.  After working for seven years selling products in a shop with some savings she decided to make the effort and start her own business of sales of personal products.  Despite the fact that when she started her business she had great difficulties with capital, her efforts have allowed her to get ahead and get ever more customers.

With her business, the economic conditions of her home have improved and now she contributes together with her husband to give her family more economic stability.  Looking to satisfy the needs of her customers and also overcome the difficulty of capital, Monica is seeking a loan to buy personal use projects and stock her shop with products that have been running out.  

Her dream is to have a large business where she can generate jobs for people who need them and also offer her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy personal use products and stock her store with products that have been running out.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy the required ingredients for her husband's food cart

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Becaause of cultural reasons, Bushra prefers that her photo not appear on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband.

Bushra is 33 years old and married, from Bani Kenanah - Irbed in Jordan.  She has three children

She has requested a 600 JOD loan to buy sewing tools and fabrics to make clothes. In the future, she would like to buy sewing machines and expand her project, buying more machines and employing people to work with her.  She wants to improve her family's situation.

loans.use: to pay for buying sewing tools and fabrics

loans.name: Azer

texts.en:
Azer is from the Bolnisi district. He is 25 years old and lives with his wife, mother, and grandmother. His grandmother is a pensioner. The family is involved in the agricultural business. In particular, they have a plot of land where maize and haricots are grown. Azer owns a minibus and runs his own business. His business consists of selling different kinds of vegetables, fruits, and food products. He has been in this business for 5 years and is very well-known in the area.

Azer requested a loan to expand his business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular vegetables and fruits, to stock his store and better satisfy his customers. This purchase will help him to better meet the needs of his customers. This will increase his income. With the increased income, Azer will improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of products for resale.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is 48 years old and the mother of four children.  She lives at West Point with her husband, who is a driver.  Her children are between the ages of 18 and 27; they are all independent. 

She sells used clothes in the market.  She has been involved in this business for the past five years.  She sells both boys and girls clothes.  She makes a profit when she sells, and with the profit, she improves the business and improves  her life.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for the business. Her plan for the future is to become a big business woman.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothes and accessories to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy rice to sell.

loans.name: Cathrine

texts.en:
Cathrine is 25 years old, married, and lives in Sinkor. Her husband is a driver and they have two children aged 2 and 8; both are attending school. 

For 4 years, Cathrine has been selling rice. She wasn't able to attend school and says this is a business she can understand. She started with susu money (susu is a savings club). She likes being in business because she is able to save and do things by herself. She is requesting a loan to purchase rice by the bag for her business. 

In the future she wants to buy land and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase rice by the bag for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy vehicle-washing items for his service station.

loans.name: Ramadhan

texts.en: Ramadhan is married and a father of three children, all of whom go to school. He lives in his own home and doesn't support anyone else besides them. He earns a living by selling construction blocks. He will use this loan to buy more blocks to sell. Ramadhan has been in this business for the last five years. In the future, he hopes to build a rental house. To do this, he promises to make his payments on time so he can request more loans from Yehu. His challenge is the high transport cost.

loans.use: To buy more blocks to sell

loans.name: Riffat

texts.en:
Riffat is 42 years old and married. She has three children, two daughters and one son. She is striving hard to meet their demands, including food, clothing, and health. Her husband is employed in a small restaurant. His income is not sufficient to meet the  daily expenditures of the family. She started her business to contribute in the family income.

She is in the business of sewing for many years. She is well familiar with the stitching techniques. She initiated her business with the support of Kashf foundation; she took her first loan to buy a sewing machine. At present, she enjoys a great client list and has gained a lot of appreciation and popularity in her community. 

She requested a loan of Rs 15,000 to buy a stock of threads of different colors, buttons, needles, etc. So then she would be able to meet the demands of her customers without fail. 

She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: To buy a stock of threads of different colors, buttons, and needles.

loans.name: Eraj

texts.en:
Eraj is a 37-year-old man. He is married and the father of two children who are already in school.

He has been a builder for more than 12 years. He builds very wonderful houses, but he can’t build such kind of a wonderful house for himself because he does not have enough income for it. He wants to repair his house because he can’t afford to build a new house. He is asking for a loan of 5,000 somoni to buy building materials such as wood, cement and paint to repair his house.

This loan will help him buy building materials to repair his house. In this way, he will provide a higher quality of living conditions for his family and put an end to the problems with his house.

loans.use: To buy building materials as wood, cement and paint to repair his house.

loans.name: Oscar Osvaldo

texts.es:
Oscar es un joven emprendedor de 22 años de edad que buscando generar ingresos para contribuir en su hogar con sus padres, aprendió la actividad de la venta de productos de uso personal de un amigo que le enseñó y vio que era rentable. Por esto hace 1 mes decidió iniciar su propio negocio con un poco de dinero que tenía ahorrado y así comenzó a vender a sus amigos, familiares y vecinos productos de uso personal. A pesar de que no cuenta con un gran capital, Oscar ha hecho un gran esfuerzo que le ha permitido sacar adelante su negocio y conseguir buenas ventas. Es por esto que busca un préstamo para comprar productos de uso personal y responder a los pedidos que han hecho sus clientes que no logra satisfacer por la falta de capital.

De esta manera seguirá saliendo adelante con su negocio y podrá continuar contribuyendo económicamente en su hogar para que sus padres tengan una mejor calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades económicas para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Oscar is an enterprising young man who is twenty-two years old. He is looking to generate income to contribute to living expenses in his parents’ home. He learned to sell personal products from a friend who taught him, and he saw that it was profitable. As a result, he decided to start his own business last month with a little money he had saved. He started to sell personal products to his friends, relatives, and neighbors. Even though he does not have a lot of capital, Oscar has made a great effort which has allowed him to get ahead with his business and make good sales. It is for this reason that he is requesting a loan to purchase personal products and be able to fill the orders his customers have made which he has not been able to fill due to a lack of capital.

In this way, he will continue getting ahead with his business and will be able to continue contributing economically to his household living expenses so that his parents will have a better quality of life and better economic opportunities to get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase personal products and be able to fill the orders his customers have made which he has not been able to fill due to a lack of capital.

loans.name: Fawzeya

texts.en: Fawzeya is a 51-year-old married woman from Bani Kenanah Irbid, Jordan who has a 4-year-old child. She is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to pay for her home's improvements. She wants to build a bathroom and to buy the household some new furniture. In the future she would like to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to pay for her home's improvements

loans.name: Sawsan

texts.en: Sawsan is a 38-year-old married female from Jarash in Jordan. She has 4 children and requested a 500 JOD loan to pay for home improvements. She would like to expand the living room.

loans.use: to pay for her home's improvements

loans.name: Wayua

texts.en:
Wayua, 39, is happily married and lives in the town of Likoni with her husband and three adult children. She’s a very kind, hardworking, enthusiastic person who, together with her husband, focuses all their efforts into moving their family forward and ensuring that their children are educated.

For over ten years, Wayua has been running a retail shop, selling basic consumer goods like breads, sodas, flour, etc.

Wayua is grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help provided she will be able to buy larger amounts of merchandise like cooking fat, balers of flour, sacks of sugar, rice, and other fast-selling products so that her business will be better stocked with a wider variety of merchandise to increase sales and income. It will serve much so that in the not-too-distant future she’ll see her children become good professionals and responsible citizens.

loans.use: to buy larger amounts of merchandise like cooking fat, balers of flour, sacks of sugar, rice, and other fast-selling products

loans.name: Matu

texts.en: Matu resides with her husband at West Point. She is 27 years old and has two children, ages 2 and 8. They are currently in school. Matu has a restaurant in her community. With the good services that she renders to her customers, she makes a profit every day. She works six days a week. She prepares cassava leaves, okra sauce, palaver sauce, and palm butter to meet the demands of her customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more ingredients for her business. Her plan for the future is to become an important businesswoman.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients for her business

loans.name: Yajaiza Elena

texts.es:
Yajaiza tomó clases hace 9 años en procesamiento de lácteos y luego aprendió mucho más de la actividad trabajando en una empresa durante 4 años. Cuando nació su primer hijo se dedicó al hogar y dejó atrás la actividad, pues no tenía quien cuidara de su hijo y a pesar de que las condiciones económicas de su hogar se deterioraban no tenía otra opción. Hace 1 mes retornó al negocio y decidió hacerlo de manera independiente montando su propio negocio, y aunque comenzó con muy poco capital y muy pocas unidades de yogurt a la semana, ahora su negocio ha crecido y tiene buenos pedidos por parte de sus clientes. Yajaiza manifiesta que su mayor ventaja es poder trabajar en su casa y estar al cuidado de sus 2 hijos de 3 y 5 años de edad, y al mismo aportar económicamente junto con su esposo al sostenimiento económico. Ahora que su negocio ha captado muy buenos clientes y tiene la oportunidad de vender grandes cantidades, Yajaiza busca un préstamo para comprar un fogón, ollas, canecas lecheras, y materia prima para poder hacer crecer el negocio.

De esta manera espera superar la dificultad de capital que tiene y sacar adelante su propio negocio, con el que su esposo y sus 2 hijos tengan una mejor calidad de vida gracias a sus ingresos y en un futuro puedan tener mejores condiciones económicas para progresar.
texts.en:
Yajaiza took classes nine years ago in dairy processing and then she learned much more about it working in a business over the course of four years. When her first son was born, she devoted herself to home life and left her other activities behind, since she did not have anyone to care for her son and in spite of the fact that the economic conditions in her home deteriorated, she did not have a choice.

One month ago she returned to her business and she decided to do it independently by setting up her own business. Even though she started with very little capital and very few units of yogurt per week, now her business has grown and she has good orders from her customers. Yajaiza states that her biggest advantage is to be able to work in her house and be caring for her two children who are 3 and 5 years old at the same time as she is contributing economically, together with her husband, to the support of the household.

Now that her business has captured very good clients and she has the opportunity to sell large quantities, Yajaiza is seeking a loan to be able to buy a stove, pots, milk cans, and raw materials to be able to grow her business. In this way she hopes to overcome the trouble she has had with capital and propel her business forward. With this loan, her husband and two children will have a better quality of life thanks to their income, and in the future they can be in better economic conditions and they will progress.

loans.use: to purchase a stove, pots, milk cans, and raw materials to be able to grow her business

loans.name: Jonetta

texts.en:
Jonetta is 27 years old and lives in Sinkor. She stopped her education in the 9th grade. She is single.

Jonetta has been selling food items like pepper, onions, spices, oil, okra, etc. for the past 2 years. She likes her business because it makes her independent and she can do things on her own. She is requesting a loan to purchase more onions, rice, pepper, oil, okra, salt, etc. She hopes to buy land and build her own house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more onions, rice, pepper, oil, okra, salt, etc.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie, aged 30, lives at West Point with her husband and three children. The children are between the ages of 6 and 18, and her husband is a mechanic. Two of her children stay with her and are in school, while the other child stays with her aunt.

Annie has sold body cream, body powder, body spray, hair grease and hair accessories for the past three years. She likes to do this business because she makes a profit; with the profit, she improves the business and helps her husband with the household expenses.  

She has requested this loan to purchase more body spray, body cream and body powder for the business. Her plan for the future is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more body spray, body cream and body powder for the business.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en: Cecelia lives in Congo Town, is 48 years old, and married with three children between the ages of 18 and 20. Her husband is a school teacher. Cecelia has been selling pigs' feet for the past 20 years. She’s requesting a loan to purchase more pigs' feet for her business. She plans to improve the livelihood of her children in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more pigs' feet for her business

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en: Mwanasiti is a 30-year-old single woman. She has three children. Ten years ago she decided to open a general store. This business allows her to generate the income that she needs. This is her first loan from Yehu and Kiva, and she requested a loan in the amount of 15,000 KES to buy a range of new products, such as snacks, sugar, beans, detergents, and beverages to restock her general store with. She hopes that this loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and sales. It will also help her to improve her living conditions. This business allows her to generate the income that she needs. Mwanasiti gives her thanks in advance for the support given.

loans.use: to buy a range of new products such as snacks, sugar, beans, detergents and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase raw materials so he can make horseshoes for some large orders his customers have made.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Imtithal

texts.en: Due to cultural reasons, Imtithal prefers that her photo is not on the Internet. Thus the above photo is of her husband. Imtithal is a 40-year-old married woman from Jarash, Jordan, who has 4 family members. She is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to pay for her home's improvements. She would like to repaint the rooms and add decorations. In the future she wants to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to pay for her home's improvements

loans.name: Shakuul

texts.en: Shakuul lives together with her husband and 4 children in Edudrom, near Cape Coast. Her husband is a labourer at the University of Cape Coast. Shakuul operates a grocery shop, which she has had for 8 years. The items in her grocery shop are rice, cooking oil, tin fish, tin tomatoes, milo, different kinds of drinks, biscuits, toffees, milk, and soap. Shakuul uses her income to support her husband in paying their childrens' school fees. She will use her loan to purchase a variety of groceries to sell. With the new profits, Shakuul plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of groceries to sell

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 21 years old and lives in the town of Mukono, in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has one child. For the past three years, Sarah has been working hard to manage her small catering business, which sells fast foods like fried fish, chips, and chicken. 

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more cooking oil and chicken for resale, and will help Sarah to generate greater profits, develop her business, and build a restaurant. Sarah hopes that in the future she will be able to have a better life. 

Sarah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil and chicken for resale

loans.name: Cosmus

texts.en:
Cosmus, a 38-year-old grocery store owner in Kisauni, Mombasa, is married to Mary with whom he has five children aged 17, 15, 13, 12 and 10 years. He has been successfully running the store for the past four years.

This is Cosmus’ first business loan from KADET LTD to finance his business. He plans to purchase more kale, tomatoes, potatoes and bananas, and will use the anticipated profits to open a retail shop for his wife. He hopes to have his own permanent residential house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more kale, tomatoes, potatoes and bananas.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is married with one child. For the past two years, she has operated a grocery store at Edukrom, near Cape Coast. Linda sells tinned fish, tinned tomatoes, Milo, different kinds of drinks, biscuits, toffees, milk, soap, and other items. She uses her income to support her husband and pay their child’s school fees.    

Linda is requesting a loan to purchase a variety of groceries to sell. She plans to use the profit from her loan to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items to sell

loans.name: Maria Ernestina

texts.es:
Maria es una persona muy trabajadora que ha tenido que atravesar grandes dificultades en la vida, y que gracias a sus ganas de salir adelante ha podido superar todas estas adversidades. Desde hace unos 4 años su esposo se quedó sin empleo y con la necesidad de generar los ingresos para su hogar donde conviven con sus 2 hijos, Maria decidió montar una tienda general con mucho esfuerzo y ahora esta es la fuente de ingresos para su hogar. A menudo su esposo le colabora cuando no tiene trabajos para hacer y a veces también su hijo menor le ayuda para sacar adelante este negocio. Entre los tres han venido poco a poco superando las dificultades que se le presentan en la tienda y así la calidad de vida del hogar ha venido mejorando. Para superar una dificultad de capital que tiene, Maria busca un préstamo que le permita comprar productos de la canasta familiar y surtir su tienda con productos que se han ido agotando.

Su sueño es sacar este negocio adelante y que le permita brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades económicas para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Maria is a hardworking person who has had to overcome great difficulties in her life.  Thanks to her drive to get ahead, she has been able to overcome all of these challenges.  

Four years ago, her husband was without work and they needed to earn income for their household that they share with their two children.  Maria decided to open a general store, which took a lot of effort, but is now the source of income for their household.  When her husband does not have other work, he helps in the store, and sometimes her younger son helps her as well.  Between the three of them, they have slowly been overcoming the difficulties with the store and so their quality of life has been improving.  To overcome a lack of capital that she has, Maria is asking for a loan to purchase basic items to stock her store since they have run out of some items.  

Her dream is to improve her business and allow her family to have a better quality of life and better financial opportunities to get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase basic items to stock her store.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is 34 years old and married with three children who are in school. She lives in the Congo town area and has run a restaurant for the past 15 years. Hannah stopped her education at the third grade. Her husband is not presently working and the family depends on her for their livelihood. 

Hannah is requesting a loan to purchase more oil, rice, charcoal, and pepper for her restaurant. In the future, she hopes to build her own house and improve her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase oil, rice, charcoal, and pepper for her restaurant

loans.name: Junior Antonio

texts.es:
Junior es un joven de 22 años de edad, es un joven muy trabajador y sobre todo entusiasta, vive en la ciudad de Camaná, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido, asimismo posee playas hermosas, una gastronomía variada y sobre todo sus pobladores son muy amables. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta mucho jugar futbol con sus amigos y vecinos de su barrio, asimismo le encanta disfrutar en algunas ocasiones uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo Chupe de Camarones. Desde muy joven Junior tuvo la necesidad de trabajar ya que sus padres son humildes, por ello solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar una carrera universitaria.

Día a día Junior trabaja en su pequeño negocio de servicio de planchado y pintura de vehículos, el trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día ya que el pintar los vehículos tomas mucho tiempo; él cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy responsable y cumplido con sus clientes.

Junior está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar materiales para su negocio como pinturas, masilla, entre otros, así d esta  manera ella podrá tener los implementos necesarios para poder realizar su trabajo, lo que le permitirá seguir luchando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Junior is a very hard-working and, above all, enthusiastic youth, 22 years of age. He lives in the city of Camana, known for its hot climate, beautiful beaches, a varied gastronomy and, above all, its very amiable people. When he has free time, Junior likes to play football with friends and neighbors from his barrio. He also likes to enjoy, on occasions, one of his favorite plates, which is the tasty “Chupe de Camarones” [Peruvian Shrimp Chowder]. Since he was quite young, Junior has had to work because his parents were very poor. For that reason, he could study only to the 5th grade of secondary school. But he would have liked to study for a career at the university.

Day after day, Junior works on vehicles in his small business, a body and paint shop. He works around 9 hours a day because painting vehicles takes much time. He thinks the business is going well, since he is very responsible and considerate with his customers.

Junior is very grateful for Kiva lenders who, thanks to the help they have offered, make it possible for him to purchase materials for his business, such as paints and body putty, among other items -- the materials he needs to carry out his work. This will permit him to continue struggling each day to make a reality of his grand dream: “To have his own house.”

loans.use: to buy body putty and other repair supplies for his body and paint shop.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
Martin anteriormente trabajaba como empleado pero debido a que los ingresos que allí generaba no eran suficientes para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar, decidió montar su propio negocio con el que ahora tiene la oportunidad de generar mejores ingresos y poco a poco ir superando la dificultad de capital con la que cuenta en su hogar. Hace un tiempo inició con su tienda general donde ofrece a sus clientes productos de la canasta familiar y a pesar de que inició el negocio con muy poco capital, su esfuerzo le ha permitido superar grandes adversidades y así seguir progresando con su familia. Gracias a su tienda, la calidad de vida de su esposa y sus hijos ha mejorado considerablemente, por esto sigue buscando mejorar las ventas para seguir teniendo una mejor calidad de vida y ofrecerles a sus hijos una educación de mejor calidad. Buscando superar su dificultad de capital, Martin busca un préstamo para comprar productos de la canasta familiar y surtir su tienda para mejorar sus ventas.

Su sueño es montar un minimercado y darle continuidad a su actividad para seguir ofreciendo en su hogar el sustento necesario para su familia.
texts.en:
Martin previously worked as an employee, but since the income he earned there was insufficient to cover his household expenses, he decided to start his own business. Now he has the opportunity to generate more income and little by little begin to overcome the lack of capital he is experiencing in his home. He started his general store, where he offers his customers staple products, a while ago. Despite the fact that he started his business with very little capital, his effort has helped him to overcome great difficulties and continue to help his family get ahead. Thanks to his store, his wife and children’s quality of life has improved considerably. For this reason, he continues to look to improve sales so he can continue to have a better quality of life and offer his children a better quality education. Martin is looking to overcome his lack of capital.  He is requesting a loan to purchase staple products and to stock his store so he can improve sales.

His dream is open a mini supermarket, continuing his trade, so he can continue to provide for his family.

loans.use: to purchase staple products and to stock his store so he can improve sales.

loans.name: Gustavo Alberto

texts.es:
Gustavo se dedicó por más de 30 años a la actividad de la construcción y con esta generaba los ingresos que requería en su hogar para el sostenimiento de los gastos que allí se generaban, pero debido a problemas de salud se vio en la obligación de dejar esta actividad de lado y fue así como encontró la oportunidad de vender jugos de caña. Ya hace año y medio que inició con esta actividad y a pesar de no contar con un gran capital para sacarlo adelante, siempre se ha esforzado para poder salir adelante, por esto ahora tiene buenas ventas y espera seguir creciendo. Para tener mejores condiciones de trabajo, Gustavo busca un préstamo para comprar un parasol más grande y protegerse del sol y una nevera plástica para almacenar el hielo.

De esta manera espera poder tener mejores condiciones de trabajo y su calidad de vida mejore considerablemente, además de que podrá ofrecer cada vez mejores productos a sus clientes y así aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Gustavo worked in construction for more than 30 years.  This work generated the income he needed to meet his household expenses.  Due to health problems, he decided to stop this work and found an opportunity to sell sugarcane juice.  He started this work a year and a half ago, and although he does not have much money to get ahead, he has always made an effort to improve.  Now, he has good sales and hopes that they will continue growing.  

In order to have better working conditions, Gustavo is asking for a loan to purchase a larger umbrella to protect himself from the sun, and a plastic cooler to keep ice in.  In this way, he hopes to have better working conditions and improve his quality of life considerably.  He will be able to offer better products to his customers and increase his sales.

loans.use: to purchase a larger umbrella to protect him from the sun and a plastic cooler for ice.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa lives in West Point. She is 35 years old, married and has four children, ages 5 to 19. Her husband is a carpenter. Three of her children live with her and attend school; the other child lives with her sister. She has been selling used clothes for the past four years. She sells children's clothes for both boys and girls. She makes profit when she sells and with the profit she buys goods to improve the business and helps her husband with the family expenses. She has requested this loan to purchase more used clothes for the business. Her plan for the future is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena is married and has four children. Her husband is a laborer at the University of Cape Coast. For the past three years, Abena has produced charcoal to sell at Edukrom, Cape Coast. She uses her income to support her husband and feed and pay their children’s school fees.  

Abena is requesting a loan to purchase firewood to produce charcoal to sell. She will use the profit from her expanded business to produce larger quantities of charcoal.

loans.use: to purchase firewood to make charcoal to sell

loans.name: Ayesah

texts.en:
Ayesah is a 42-year-old married woman from Jarash, Jordan, who has three family members. Due to cultural reasons, she prefers that her photo not appear on the internet and therefore her husband is in this photo. 

Ayesah is requesting a 600 JOD loan to pay for home improvements. She would like to buy an air conditioner and new furniture. In the future, Ayesah hopes to improve her socioeconomic status.

loans.use: to buy an air conditioner and new furniture

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es: La socia es la señora Maruja, ahora tiene 40 años de edad, casada con 2 hijos, vive en la provincia de Urubamba, la socia continua con su actividad comercial en su tienda de abarrotes, vendiendo productos de primera necesidad como Arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos, aceite entre otros. Maruja se ha mantenido trabajando en esta actividad la cual le ha permitido educar a sus hijos quienes son estudiantes universitarios, La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería que le permita capitalizar su comercio y segur pagando la educación de sus hijos, por ello la socia está muy agradecida con KIVA, por ayudarla a desarrollarse en su actividad y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente. Maruja pertenece al banco comunal “San Jose de Urubamba” de la provincia de Urubamba del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
Maruja is 40 years old, married, and has two children.  She lives in the Urubamba province.  She continues to work at her grocery store selling staple products such as rice, sugar, pasta, oil, and other items.  With this store, Maruja has been able to educate her children, who are university students.  

She is asking for this loan to purchase merchandise which will allow her to capitalize her business and continue paying for her children's education.  For this reason, she is very thankful to Kiva for helping her develop her business.  She promises to make her payments on time.  Maruja is a member of the San Jose de Urubamba community bank located in the Urubamba province in Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as rice, sugar, milk, pasta, oil, and other items.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is 41 years old and married to Joseph. The couple does not have any children but they support six of Edith's siblings. For the past three years, Edith has owned rental houses and she earns a monthly income of 30,000 KES. 

Edith is requesting her second loan of 50,000 KES to purchase building materials to complete her rental rooms. She will use her anticipated profit to support her family. In the future, Edith dreams of owning more real estate.

loans.use: to purchase building materials to complete her rental rooms

loans.name: Flor Angela

texts.es:
Flor aprendió la actividad de la confección desde hace unos 25 años y así comenzó a trabajar en una empresa de confecciones. Luego de 15 años de haber trabajado en esta empresa, se vio en la obligación de dejar el trabajo y dedicarse en su hogar a cuidar sus 2 hijos, labor que desempeñó hasta los últimos años cuando el padre de sus hijos los abandonó y así las cargas económicas del hogar quedaron todas sobre Flor. Para poder generar los ingresos que requería en su hogar para poder sacar sus 2 hijos adelante, Flor compró una máquina básica y comenzó a confeccionar nuevamente, y ahora gracias a la calidad de sus trabajos tiene muy buenos clientes. La dificultad que tiene es que por la falta de una máquina no puede confeccionar las prendas completas y esto hace que su pago sea muy bajo; es por esto que Flor busca un préstamo para comprar una máquina fileteadora que le permita recibir los pedidos de la confección de prendas completas y así sus ingresos aumenten considerablemente.

Flor espera que las condiciones económicas en su hogar mejoren considerablemente y sus 2 hijos puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida y el acceso a una educación de mejor calidad.
texts.en:
Flor learned to sew twenty-five years ago, and even started working as a seamstress for a clothing company. After fifteen years of working for this company, she was obligated to stop working and stay at home to care for her two children, which she did until recently, when the father of her children left them. As a result, the economic duties of the household have fallen on her. To be able to generate the income necessary to provide for her two children and help them to get ahead, Flor purchased a basic sewing machine and began to sew again. Now, thanks to the quality of her work, she has very good customers. The difficulty she has is that since she does not have the right machine, she cannot make whole clothing, and her payment is very low. For this reason, Flor is requesting a loan to purchase an overlock sewing machine which will allow her to take orders for whole clothing and her income will increase considerably.

Flor hopes that the economic conditions in her home improve considerably, and that her two children will be able to have a better quality of life and access to a better quality education.

loans.use: to purchase an overlock sewing machine which will allow her to take orders for whole clothing and her income will increase considerably.

loans.name: Yaneth

texts.es:
Yaneth aprendió desde muy temprana edad la actividad de la confección y esto le ha permitido tener una gran experiencia en el trabajo, brindando a sus clientes productos de muy buena calidad. Anteriormente con su taller de confección contribuía económicamente en su hogar para tener una economía más estable, pero desde que el padre de sus hijos la abandonó, todas las responsabilidades económicas del hogar han caído encima suyo y por esto ha venido trabajando fuertemente para poder aumentar los ingresos con los que pueda sostener todos los gastos que se generan en su hogar. Buscando ofrecer mayores servicios a sus clientes, Yaneth busca un préstamo para comprar una máquina fileteadora y así aumentar los trabajos que realiza para mejorar sus ingresos.

Su sueño es poder tener una mejor calidad de vida en su hogar junto con sus 2 hijos y mejorar las condiciones económicas para que puedan salir adelante accediendo a una educación de mejor calidad.
texts.en:
Yaneth learned how to sew from a young age.  This has allowed her to have a lot of experience with this work and to provide her customers with very good quality products.  Her sewing workshop used to contribute financially to her household to have stable finances, but since the father of her children abandoned them, all of the financial responsibilities of the household have fallen on her.  She is working very hard to increase her income so that she can meet her household expenses.  She would like to offer better services to her customers, so Yaneth is asking for this loan to purchase a serging machine to expand the work she is able to do and increase her income.  

Her dream is to provide her two children with a better quality of life and improve her financial condition so that her family can get ahead and her children can get a good education.

loans.use: to purchase a serging machine to expand the types of work she can do to increase her income.

loans.name: Mwanalima

texts.en:
Mwanalima is 26 years old. She lives in Tiribe, Kenya. Mwanalima works every day at her small shop selling spare parts. Mwanalima is a very hardworking woman and wants above all to prosper and improve her quality of life. She attributes the success of her business to her amiable character and to the fact that she sells quality products at affordable prices. 

Mwanalima is requesting a loan to buy more spare parts for her shop. She will use her loan to offer more variety and improve her income. She is very grateful to Kiva lenders since, thanks to their help, she will be able to keep working every day towards her greatest dream: having more selling points for her spare parts.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her shop

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is married and has two children. Her husband works as a driver. For some years, Theresa has cooked and sold different kinds of food including rice, yam, banku, vegetable sauce, fried fish, and meat stew. She sells her food at Edukrom, near Cape Coast. Theresa uses her income to support her husband and help feed their children.

Theresa is requesting a loan to purchase bags of rice, maize, yams, meat, vegetables and other ingredients she needs to prepare her food. She will use the profit from her loan to acquire a location to serve her customers.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice, maize, yams, meat, vegetables, and other ingredients to prepare food

loans.name: Gloria Elena

texts.es:
Gloria aprendió la actividad empíricamente hace 10 años más o menos cuando le ayudaba a vender en un almacén a un hermano, y desde entonces ha estado trabajando en diferentes actividades como empleada en un cultivo de flores, como propietaria de unas ventas de mercancía y también con comidas rápidas, y así aportaba económicamente en su hogar para mejorar las condiciones económicas de su familia. Hace unos 6 meses le compró la papelería a una amiga que la vendió por falta de tiempo para poderla trabajar y desde entonces trabaja todos los días durante todo el día.
