La falta de capital ha sido la única dificultad que se le ha presentado en el negocio, y buscando superarla es que busca un préstamo para comprar productos de papelería y surtir su almacén de los productos que ya se han ido agotando.

Su sueño es poder tener una mejor calidad de vida en el hogar y mejores oportunidades económicas para salir adelante, conseguir su casa propia y que sus hijos puedan acceder a una educación de mejor calidad.
texts.en:
Over the past 10 years, Gloria learned her business through experience, more or less by helping her brother sell merchandise in his store. She has also worked at various jobs to pay household expenses and improve her family's financial position: employee at a flower farm; owner of a store; and fast food vendor. Six months ago, she bought a stationery store from a friend, who was selling because she didn't have time to work. Since then, Gloria has worked there every day throughout the day. 

Her only business problem has been lack of working capital. To address this issue, she is requesting a loan to buy stationery and to restock items she has sold out of. Her dream is to improve her family's well being and to have better business opportunities so that she can get ahead, buy a house, and give her children a good education.

loans.use: to buy stationery and to restock items she needs at her store.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 30 years old and is married with four children who are all currently in school. She lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past seven years, Rebecca has been working hard to manage her retail shop where she sells flasks, juice, biscuits, and other items. 

Rebecca is requesting a 3,000,000 UGX loan from BRAC Uganda to more posho, flasks, bowls, and other household goods. Her loan will help Rebecca to generate greater profits and allow her to buy more goods to sell. She hopes that in the future she will be able to sell more quality products. 

Rebecca is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Rebecca who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more posho, flasks, bowls, and household goods

loans.name: Sandra Isabel

texts.es: Doña Sandra tiene 53 años de edad, está casada, tiene 3 hijos, y vive en una Colonia suburbana de San Pedro Sula. Hace 4 años que ella estableció en casa su propio negocio de venta de mercadería como blusas, pantalones, cortinas, sabanas, jeans, y también joyas en plata como cadenas, aretes, anillos, pulseras, etc. las ventas son de acuerdo a pedidos que hacen sus clientes. doña Sandra ha sido cliente de 17 préstamos con ODEF, el que solicita actualmente es por 21,000 Lempiras y lo invertirá en el negocio, va comprar mas mercadería para cumplir con los pedidos que han hecho los clientes. Su meta es mantener siempre estable el negocio ya que es una fuente de ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Sandra, age 53, is married and has three children.  She lives in a suburban neighborhood in San Pedro Sula.

Four years ago she established her own business in her house.  She sells merchandise like blouses, pants, curtains, sheets, and jeans.  She also sells silver jewelry like chains, earrings, rings, and bracelets, etc.  Her sales are made according to her customers’ orders.

Sandra has been a client of ODEF for 17 loans.  She will invest the current loan she is requesting for 21,000 lempiras in the business.  She will buy more merchandise to fill the orders that her customers have made.

Her goal is to always keep her business stable because it is a source of income for her family.

loans.use: to buy blouses, pants, sheets, curtains, and silver jewelry like chains, rings, bracelets, and earrings, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Vanna's Group

texts.en:
Vanna, the mother of five children, is a 43-year-old farmer who strives to make a living by growing rice on her 1 1/2 hectare farm as her main source of income. Her husband is not only helping her with the rice field, but also producing sugar from sugar palm juice. With the 25 years that she has experience in her rice growing business, she is able to earn 13,500 riels (KHR) per day. 

Vanna has been with VisionFund, Kiva's partner, for the past two cycles. She has wisely managed her loan in order to better support her business. She has had success, especially by purchasing fertilizer to boost her crop production on time, and is generating a decent income for her family. 

Now, Vanna is in a group composed of two members; the other member has been with VisionFund for one cycle only. She is requesting a loan of 1,400,000 KHR and her co-member is applying for a 650,000 KHR loan. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her rice field. Also, she will use some of it to buy a high ladder made from bamboo for climbing palm trees and a bamboo container for sugar palm juice storage.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rice field and a bamboo ladder for climbing sugar palm trees.

loans.name: Rania

texts.en:
Rania is a 30-year-old married woman from Jarash, Jordan. Due to cultural reasons, she prefers that her photo does not appear on the Internet and her husband is in this picture.

Rania is requesting a 400 JOD loan to pay for home improvements. She would like to repaint a room and maintain her home. In the future, Rania wants to provide a good environment for her family to live in.

loans.use: to pay for home improvements

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a chicken coop, buy chickens and chicken feed

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es:
El socio es el señor Reynaldo, tiene 44 años de edad, está casado y tiene 2 hijos,  vive en la provincia de Urubamba, Reynaldo se sigue dedicando a la minería en la región de Puerto Maldonado, a donde debe trasladarse frecuentemente para realzar sus actividades. Reynaldo está solicitando el préstamo para comprarle un motor a su unidad vehicular la cual le sirve como herramienta de trabajo y que aún no pudo adquirir precisamente por falta de dinero.
Reynaldo está muy agradecido con KIVA por ayudarlo en su actividad económica y en la educación de sus hijos para procurarse un mejor futuro. Reynaldo tiene un sueño a futuro, y es la de poner una  empresa de transporte con varios vehículos que cubran la ruta del Cusco a Puerto Maldonado. Reynaldo pertenece al banco comunal “San Jose de Urubamba” de la provincia de Urubamba del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
Reynaldo, 44, is married, has 2 children, and lives in Urubamba province. He is a miner in the Puerto Maldonado area and must commute there often to work. Reynaldo is requesting a loan to buy an engine for his vehicle, which is key to getting to work. However, he hasn't had the money to purchase it. 

Reynaldo thanks KIVA for helping him financially and letting him provide for his children's education and offer them a brighter future. His dream is to own several vehicles and provide transit service from Cusco to Puerto Maldonado. Reynaldo belongs to the communal bank “San Jose de Urubamba” in Urubamba province in Cusco, Perú.

loans.use: to buy an engine for his vehicle.

loans.name: Amenah

texts.en:
Amenah is a 45-year-old married woman from Bani Kenanah, Irbid, in Jordan. She has three children and requested a 500 Jordanian dinar loan to pay for making pickles at home and selling them. In the future she wants to increase her capital and expand her business to making several kinds of pickles.

For cultural reasons, Amenah prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus, the photo is of her husband.

loans.use: to pay for making pickles for sale

loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
Liana 45 years old and lives with her husband and mother. She is from the Marneuli district. Liana's mother has a retirement pension and her family is involved in an agricultural business. They own a plot of land where they grow potatoes and maize. In addition, Liana runs a small dairy business. She has a milk cow and produces cheese. The family sells their produce locally. Besides these activities, Liana hires out her services as a farm worker to other local farmers to earn additional income. 

Liana is requesting a loan to purchase a milk cow to produce and sell more cheese. She wants to expand her business in order to earn a good profit. Liana will reinvest her profit into her business as well as spend more to improve her family's living conditions and provide for their daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Harrison

texts.en:
Harrison is from Kisauni, Mombasa, and operates a small barber hair salon. He wants to remodel his salon in order to offer his clients a more comfortable environment, and generate more income to help support his family. He is requesting this loan in order to help grow his business.

He is a very hardworking person with a persistent spirit and attitude. He has much experience in his field, and knows what he is doing. His goal is to one day have a large barber salon, and to be widely known for his talent. He is grateful for this opportunity, and believes that the support will be a great help to him. With the loan, he wants to establish a clothes selling stall and purchase bales of clothes.

loans.use: to establish a clothes selling stall and purchase bales of clothes.

loans.name: Irene Elmilia

texts.es: La socia es la señora Irene, ahora tiene 46 años de edad, casada con 2 hijos, vive en la provincia de Urubamba, la socia continua con su actividad comercial de compra y venta de alimento para animales de corral, principalmente con productos como pasto, forraje y alfalfa, pero ahora también se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como ovejas, patos, gallinas y cuyes. Irene se ha mantenido trabajando en esta actividad la cual le ha permitido educar a sus hijos quienes están en edad escolar, La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería  y ovejas que le permita capitalizar su comercio y segur pagando la educación de sus hijos, por ello la socia está muy agradecida con KIVA, por ayudarla a desarrollarse en su comercio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente. Irene pertenece al banco comunal “San Jose de Urubamba” de la provincia de Urubamba del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
Irene is now 46, married with 2 children, and lives in Urubamba province. She continues to buy and sell feed, mainly grass, fodder, and alfalfa, for farm animals. She also raises and sells small livestock such as sheep, turkeys, chickens, and guinea pigs. Irene has kept working in this manner, which allows her to educate her school-aged children.

Irene is requesting a loan to buy merchandise and sheep so that she can leverage her business and keep paying her children's school expenses. She thanks KIVA for helping her develop her business and promises to make her payments on time. Irene is a member of the communal bank “San Jose de Urubamba” in Urubamba province in Cusco, Perú.

loans.use: to buy sheep, grass, fodder, and alfalfa.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba lives together with her husband, who is a farmer, and their two children at Edukrom near Cape Coast. 

Aba sells corn dough, gari (cassava flakes), and maize. She has done this for a year. She uses her income to support her husband to feed their children. 

Aba will use her loan to purchase bags of maize for her dough, onions, and maize to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize for her dough, onions, and maize to sell.

loans.name: Adwowa

texts.en:
Adwowa lives together with her four children. Her husband is a laborer at the University of Cape Coast. Adwowa produces charcoal to sell at Edukrom near Cape Coast, which she has done for 20 years now. She uses her income to help her husband to feed and pay their children’s school fees. 

Adwowa will use her loan to purchase firewood to produce charcoal to sell. With the new profit from her expanded business, Adwowa will produce charcoal in large quantities.

loans.use: to purchase firewood to produce charcoal to sell

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba produces charcoal to sell at Edukrom near Cape Coast, which she has done for 30 years now.  Aba is a widow and has three children.  As a single parent, she uses her income to feed and to pay her children’s school fees. Aba will use her loan to purchase firewood to produce charcoal to sell. With the new profit from her expanded business  Aba will produce charcoal in large quantities.

loans.use: to purchase firewood to produce charcoal to sell

loans.name: Mbwana

texts.en:
With his previous Kiva loan, Mbwana bought bundles of vegetables for resale as well as fresh vegetables that he sold, increasing his working capital slightly. Now he is applying for a new Kiva loan, because his sellers have requested more products. He has an established clientele and his working capital is insufficient to meet the growth in demand.

This is the reason why his Kiva loan will be successful, because he will respond to demand by buying fruit and vegetables from the harvest at a good price and above all, very fresh. Mbwana tells the lenders that his Kiva loans have been very useful to him. He says thank you and may they continue helping him.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fruit and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena lives together with her husband, who is a carpenter, and 6 children at Edukrom near Cape Coast.  Abena is a petty trader. She sell salted fish, tubers of yams, and other food items, which she has done for 6 years. She uses her income to assist her husband in paying their accommodation bills. Abena will use her loan to purchase salted fish, tubers of yams and other food items to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase salted fish, tubers of yams and other food items to sell

loans.name: Sokhoeurn's Group

texts.en:
Sokhoeurn is married and one of the breadwinners in a family that consists of three members including her one daughter. Her entire family is living in Kror Kor District of Pursat Province, where rice farming is a common business to generate income for the villagers as well as for Sokhoeurn. Besides working on the rice field, this couple also raises pigs at home for additional income. The current business that she has been with for 11 years earns her about 13,000 riels (KHR) per day. 

This is the first loan cycle for Sokhoeurn and her fellow group member (they are in the same group of two female members). She and her co-member are applying for loan portions of 700,000 KHR and 500,000 KHR, respectively. Sokhoeurn, the group leader, will use her portion to buy an additional plot of land to expand her rice planting and buy more pigs to raise. She hopes to grow her rice healthily and fatten her pig so she can sell for a good price and keep up good progress with her living conditions. She hopes to mount up profit from her current business and improve her standard lifestyle progressively.

loans.use: to buy an additional plot of land and more pigs to raise.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is a petty trader. She sells vegetables such as tomatoes, onions, garden eggs (an eggplant-like fruit used as a vegetable), oil, and other food items. Ama has been in this business for ten years now.  

She is married and has two children. Her husband is a farmer. She uses her income to assist her husband in paying their children’s school fees. 

Ama will use her loan to purchase a variety of vegetables and other food items to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of vegetables and other food items to sell.

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en:
Matilda sells charcoal at Edukrom near Cape Coast. She has done this for 13 years now.  

Matilda is married and has six children. She uses her income to support her husband to feed their children and pay their school fees.  

Matilda will use her loan to purchase bags of charcoal to sell.  With the new profit from her expanded business, Matilda will produce the charcoal she sells herself.

loans.use: to purchase bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma tiene 37 años de edad, está casada con Clemente, con quien tiene 4 hijos de 19, 16, 10 y 8 años. Ellos viven en una casa propia ubicada en un anexo agrícola y ganadero. Norma es una mujer constante y trabajadora. Desde los 18 años viene laborando en los campos de cultivos que sus padres le otorgaron. Por su parte Clemente también posee terrenos por su herencia. 
Ella se dedica a la agricultura, con la siembra de papas de las variedades: “Yungay” y “Jilguero”. Producción que vende satisfactoriamente en el mercado mayorista de Tarma. “Estas papas se venden mejor, sus precios son mejores y siempre se mantienen”, menciona.
El trabajo en el campo no es sencillo, y más aún cuando tiene hijos en edad escolar, a quienes atiende para luego dedicarse a sus sembríos.
Norma desea sembrar más papas en este mes, ya que la temporada de siembras se acerca. Por eso requiere de su apoyo. Éste es su crédito número 4 con MFP. Da su palabra de ser puntual en el pago de las mensualidades. Pertenece al banco comunal “Mirando un futuro mejor”, y se siente a gusto con el sistema de trabajo de su cuenta interna.
Norma invertirá el dinero en la compra de bolsas de fertilizantes y guano de corral, para iniciar una siembra, porque ya cuenta con las semillas.
texts.en:
Norma is 37 years old and is married to Clemente, with whom she has four children who are 19, 16, 10 and 8 years old. They live in their own house attached to a ranch. Norma is a hardworking and persevering woman. From the age of 18 she worked in the fields her parents gave her. Clemente also has his own land which he inherited. Norma grows Yungay and Jilguero potatoes, and sells her crop in the largest market in Tarma. She says that her potatoes always sell well and she has the best prices.

Work in the fields isn't easy, especially with children of school age, who she has to look after before she can attend to her fields. Norma wants to sow more potatoes this month, as the planting season is getting closer. This is why she needs your support. This is her fourth loan with MFP. She gives her word to be punctual with her monthly payments. She is a member of the communal bank 'Mirando un futuro mejor' ('Looking to a better future'), and she is pleased that the system lets her work for herself. Norma will invest the money in buying bags of fertiliser and guano from poultry so she can start sowing, as she already has the seeds.

loans.use: To buy fertilisers and guano from poultry.

loans.name: Loudan

texts.en:
Loudan is 36 years old and lives in the town of Mbarara, Uganda. She is married and has 3 children who are all currently in school. For the past 5 years, Loudan has been working hard to manage her clothing shop, which sells shirts, skirts, belts and shoes. 

To help expand her business, Loudan has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more women's suits, school uniforms, and belts, and will help Loudan to generate greater profits and increase her sales due to wider variety of stock. Loudan hopes that in the future she will be able to own a bigger shop. 

Loudan is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Loudan who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more women's suits, school uniforms, and belts.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy operates a grocery shop at Edukrom near Cape Coast. She has done this for two years. The items in her grocery shop are tin fish, tin tomatoes, milo, different kinds of drinks, biscuits, toffees, milk, soap, etc.  She is married and has five children. Mercy uses her income to support her husband in paying their children’s school fees. She will use her loan to purchase a variety of groceries to sell. With the new profit, Mercy plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of groceries to sell

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel has been able to sell fast food products thanks to his previous Kiva loan with which he bought vegetables for resale. Currently he is applying for a new Kiva loan, which he will use to buy raw materials such as rice, oil, potatoes, and cereals in large quantities and supplies, expecting an increase in products. He can benefit from buying them with cash and in larger quantities than usual. He sends the following message to the Kiva backers: "I am very grateful for the financing of my project since you have given me the opportunity to increase my production and my income."

loans.use: to buy raw materials and supplies such as rice, oil, potatoes and cereals in large quantities.

loans.name: Khiriah Group

texts.en:
This group is called Khiriah. It consists of four ladies who live in Sana`a, Yemen. 

Amnh is 46 years of age. She is a married woman and has nine children. Her business is a retail one; she sells perfumes, incense, and clothes.  

She applied for a loan of 70,000 YER from AMB to buy more perfumes, incense, and clothes for her business. The profits generated will allow her to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy more perfumes, incense, and clothes for her business.

loans.name: Josephine's Group

texts.en:
Josephine's group is comprised of three hardworking women. Josephine is 23 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala West region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, with one of them currently in school. For the past three years, Josephine has been working hard to manage her small business, where she sells shoes for children to wear at school. 

To help expand her business, Josephine has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more shoes to sell, and will help Josephine to generate greater profits and help cover basic needs and school fees. Josephine hopes that in the future she will be able to grow her business a lot. 

Josephine is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a variety of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas sells charcoal in Edukrom near Cape Coast, which she has done for 8 years now. Dorcas is a married and has 5 children. She uses her income to support her husband in order to feed their family and pay their children’s school fees. Dorcas will use her loan to purchase bags of charcoal to sell. With the new profit from her expanded business, Dorcas will produce the charcoal she sells herself.

loans.use: to purchase bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Leila

texts.en: Leila sells dry fish, garden eggs and gari in Edukrom near Cape Coast. Leila has been in this business for the past 10 years. She is married with 7 children and her husband is a farmer. She uses her income to support her husband in the general up-keep of their family. Leila will use her loan to purchase dry fish, vegetables and bags of gari to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase dry fish, vegetables and bags of gari to sell.

loans.name: Kazingo

texts.en: Kazingo is 43 years old and has been in a committed relationship for several years. She is a tailor and has been in this line of work for more than five years. She has a large clientele because she is well known. She works on orders placed with her and also has a stock of garments ready to sell. Thanks to this activity, she has moved forward, her business has grown little by little and she is able to maintain her home and educate her children. She is asking for a loan in order to purchase fabric, which she will use to finish orders that have been placed with her. She does not want to make her customers wait. She is a responsible person with a desire to continue working and progressing.

loans.use: to purchase fabric

loans.name: Milly's Group

texts.en:
Milly's group is comprised of two hard working women. Milly is 21 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala West region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past year, Milly has been working hard to manage her small business where she sells childrens' shoes. 

To help expand her business, Milly has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more shoes to sell and will help Milly to generate greater profits and help the development of her family. Milly hopes that in the future, she will be able to stop renting after buying a plot of land and building on it. 

Milly is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell

loans.name: Sonnieway

texts.en: Sonnieway is 40 years old and lives in Congo Town. She is married and has five children between the ages of 5 and 21, who live at home and attend school. For the past ten years, Sonnieway has been selling clothes and slippers. Sometimes her customers use credit and refuse to pay. She started this business with 5,000 Liberian dollars, which her husband gave her. She is requesting a loan to purchase a carton of slippers and clothes for her business. She hopes to go back to school and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a carton of slippers and clothes for her business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is involved in retail. She rents a little store in one of the markets in the town of Tiribe, where she has been trading clothing since 2010. Thanks to the previous loan, she was able to increase her inventory of clothes.

Elizabeth has applied for this new loan to add more bales of clothes to her inventory in her store, as demand for a variety of clothing has increased recently. This is important for Elizabeth to meet her clients' demand and increase sales.

Elizabeth lives with her husband and one child.

Development of her business will bring more income for her and help her to cover the family's costs.

loans.use: to add more bales of clothes to the inventory in her store.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a petty trader who sells vegetables such as tomatoes, onions, garden eggs, oil and other food items. Mary has been in this business for 10 years now.  She is married and has four children. She uses her income to assist her husband in paying their children’s school fees.  Mary will use her loan to purchase palm oil and a variety of vegetables to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil and a variety of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Zulaika

texts.en:
Zulaika is 20 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala West region of Uganda. She is married and has one child who is currently in school. For the past two years, Zulaika has been working hard to manage her food stall, which sells and cooks chips, eggs and meats. 

To help expand her business, Zulaika has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more irish potatoes, charcoal and chicken to sell, and will help Zulaika to generate greater profits and help to buy a plot of land and build on it. Zulaika hopes that in the future, she will be able to drive herself. 

Zulaika is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more irish potatoes, charcoal and chicken to sell

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is married and has four children to support. For the last five years, she has been selling clothes at retail. She stocks her business with various clothes for adults and children and supports her family with the income. She will use the loan to buy various clothes like shirts, skirts, blouses, khangas, etc. to attract more customer attention and purchases.

In the future, she plans to open a boutique. This way, she will be able to continue providing a quality life for her family.

loans.use: to buy various clothes like shirts, skirts, blouses, khangas, etc.

loans.name: Perparim

texts.en:
Perparim is thirty-two years old and has two children, seven and five years old, both of them going to school. His family lives in northern Albania.

For the past twelve-something years, he has been raising cows to generate profit by selling dairy and baby calves to the local market. Everyone in his family is involved in the business and it’s considered by them “family activity”, the little kids said.

Perparim is requesting a loan now to rebuild the stable that was badly damaged last winter, and the loan from Kiva will help him to build just that. His further plans include increasing the number of animals and, of course, with the profit from this, Perparim wants to improve the living conditions.

Perparim is an appreciative man who wants to thank all the lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to rebuild his damaged stable.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es: La socia es la señora Dominga, ahora tiene 55 años de edad, casada con 7 hijos, vive en la provincia de Urubamba, la socia continua con su actividad comercial de venta de comida de forma ambulatoria. Dominga se ha mantenido trabajando en esta actividad la cual le ha permitido sacar adelante y educar a sus hijos, La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos como arroz, papas, carnes y verduras, que le permitan seguir produciendo sus alimentos y  capitalizar su comercio, por ello la socia está muy agradecida con KIVA, por ayudarla a desarrollarse en su trabajo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente. Dominga pertenece al banco comunal “San Jose de Urubamba” de la provincia de Urubamba del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en: Dominga, the member, is 55 years old.  She is married with seven children and lives in Urubamba province.  She continues her business selling food as a street vendor.  She has supported herself with this business, which has enabled her to get ahead and raise her children.  She is requesting the loan to purchase ingredients such as rice, potatoes, meat, and vegetables, which will enable her to continue preparing her food and to finance her business.  For this reason, she is very grateful to Kiva for enabling her to develop her business and she pledges to make all of her payments on schedule.  Dominga belongs to the “San Jose de Urubamba” Communal Bank in Urubamba province, Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as rice, potatoes, meat, and vegetables.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa is 29 years old, married, and the mother of three children, aged 6 months and 14. They all stay with her at West Point. Her husband is a driver. For the past ten years, she has been selling coal by retail in her community. She started as a housemaid, before getting into her business. She likes to do this business because she earns her own income generated from her business and is able to help with the family expenses. She is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of coal for her business. Her plan for the future is to educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of coal for her business.

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en:
Dennis is 40 years old and lives in the town of Mbarara, Uganda. He is married and has 3 children with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 2 years, Dennis has been working hard to manage his hardware store, which sells cement, iron bars and paint. 

To help expand his business, Dennis has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more paint, iron sheets, varnish and cement, and will help Dennis to generate greater profits and increase his family's prospects. Dennis hopes that in the future he will be able to set up another business.

Dennis is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Dennis who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more paint, iron sheets, varnish and cement.

loans.name: Famata

texts.en: Famata is a 35-year-old hard-working mother that live at west point, with her husband and three children, ages 6 and 18. Her husband works for a government agency. She has been involved in her business for the past ten years, selling rice, biscuits, candy, sardines, cooking oil, pepper, vita, etc., in the community market. She is proud of her business because she makes a profit every day. With the profit she improves her business and contributes to paying household expenses. She is requesting a loan to purchase more candy, biscuits, cooking oil, pepper, vita, etc., to increase her sales. Her plan for the future is to give her children a higher level of education.

loans.use: to purchase more candy, biscuits, cooking oil, pepper, vita, etc. to increase her sale.

loans.name: Dzine

texts.en: Dzine is a humble merchant of fruits and vegetables who fights day after day to improve her living conditions. To contribute to home expenses, her husband works as a businessman. This is how they support themselves to help their children move forward. Dzine needs this loan to purchase more groceries for her grocery store, such as potatoes, tomatoes, fruits, kale, etc. Her dream is to improve her living standards and to see her children have a professional career. She appreciates the support from Kiva through Yehu as they have shown confidence in giving her a loan to improve her life.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries for her grocery store such as potatoes, tomatoes, fruits, kale, etc.

loans.name: Ismail

texts.en:
Ismail is a married man with two young children, and both of them are dependent. His wife is also a business woman.

Together they set up a retail shop in their house, which is located in a strategic place in the city. He says they started with a little capital that they got from other jobs they had done previously as salaried workers. Thanks to the work they are doing, they have been able to contribute economically to the household expenses.

He is requesting the loan to buy basic needs products to stock his store. He will buy things like rice, bales of flour, sugar, and other items. He is grateful for the help that he is receiving. It is a great growth opportunity for him.

loans.use: to buy things like rice, bales of flour, sugar, and other items.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is a 29-year-old divorced woman who lives with her three children. She makes a living selling household utensils like thermos, plates, etc. She has had her business for several years and that has given her a lot of experience in sales. She has a large and loyal clientele who prefer to buy from her because she always has what they need in terms of quality products at affordable prices. Her service is also unique because it is always based on her customers’ orders.

Patricia is a very enterprising and determined woman who is eager to get ahead and is always looking for opportunities that will lead her to success. She knows that the harder she works, the greater the reward will be. In the last few months the demand for her products has increased, and so she wants to take this opportunity to invest in her business but needs capital for that. That is why she is asking Yehu for a loan that will allow her to purchase cooking pans, thermos, jugs and other products as requested by her customers.

Patrica is confident that she will be able to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase cooking pans, thermos, jugs and other products

loans.name: Antia

texts.en:
Antia is 21 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala West region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, with two of them currently in school. For the past year, Antia has been working hard to manage her food stall, which sells matoke (plantain), sweet potatoes, and other raw foods. 

To help expand her business, Antia has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more vegetables for her business, and will help Antia to generate greater profits and improve her business and pay school fees. Antia hopes that in the future she will be able to buy land and build a house. 

Antia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: La socia es la señora Carmen, ahora tiene 40 años de edad, soltera con 2 hijos, vive en la provincia de Urubamba, la socia continua con su actividad comercial de comercialización de golosinas, las cuales distribuye en las diferentes tiendas y comercios de su comunidad. Carmen se ha mantenido trabajando en esta actividad la cual le ha permitido sacar adelante y poder educar a sus hijos, La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería como dulces, chocolates, galletas, chicles etc, y capitalizar su actividad, por ello la socia está muy agradecida con KIVA, por ayudarla a desarrollarse en su trabajo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente. Carmen pertenece al banco comunal “San Jose de Urubamba” de la provincia de Urubamba del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
Carmen is currently 40 years old and is a single mother with two children. She lives in the province of Urubamba. Carmen works by selling delicacies as a commercial activity to different stores and businesses in the community.  Carmen has kept working in this activity so that she can get her family ahead and be able to educate her children. 

Carmen is requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as candies, chocolates, cookies, and chewing gum, etc. in order to sell commercially. She is very grateful to Kiva for the help to grow her business. She promises to repay promptly. 

Carmen belongs to the community bank “San Jose of Urubamba”  of the providence of Urubamba in Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy candies, chocolates, cookies, and chewing gum

loans.name: Raul Vicente

texts.es:
El socio es el señor Vicente, tiene 35 años de edad, está casado y tiene 2 hijos,  vive en la provincia de Urubamba, Vicente se sigue dedicando a la venta de materiales de construcción como arena, piedra, cemento, hormigón etc. Vicente está solicitando el préstamo para comprar  materiales de construcción y capitalizar su actividad.
Vicente está muy agradecido con KIVA por ayudarlo en su actividad económica y en la educación de sus hijos para procurarse un mejor futuro. Vicente tiene un sueño a futuro, y es la de comprar un mini volquete que le facilita la comercialización de sus productos. Vicente pertenece al banco comunal “San Jose de Urubamba” de la provincia de Urubamba del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
Vicente is 35 years old and is married with two children. He lives in the province of Urubamba. Vicente works in the sale of building materials such as sand, stone, cement, concrete, etc. 

Vicente is requesting a loan to buy building materials to capitalize on his work. Vicente is very grateful to Kiva for helping his income and improving the future of his children through education. 

Vicente has a dream of purchasing a mini dump truck to facilitate his commercial activities. Vicente belongs to the community bank of “San Jose of Urubamba” of the province of Urubamba in Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as sand, stone, cement, and concrete.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover her education expenses

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is 46 years old and lives in Congo Town. She is married, with four children, 9 to 28 years old.  Two are in school, and all of them live at home.

For the past nine years, she has been selling charcoal in the local market.  She started this business with money given to her by her husband.

She is requesting a loan to buy more charcoal for her business.  Her plans are to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal for her business,

loans.name: Kache

texts.en:
Kache is a married woman and has five children. She resides in her own house with access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include food for the family. 

For the past two years, Kache has operated a charcoal-selling business. She also generates additional income by selling fish. Kache sells to all categories of people and works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation of commodities from a rural area to her place of operation. 

Kache has applied for a loan of 15,000 Kenyan shillings from Yehu Microfinance Trust to buy sacks of charcoal for resale. Kache hopes to see her business expand to a wholesale of charcoal in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Whyea

texts.en:
Whyea is 26 years old and lives in Congo Town. She stopped her education at the 6th grade, married, and now has three children 4 to 9 years old.  All live at home and attend school.

For the past seven years, she has been selling rice, pepper, and oil in the local market.  She started this business with money given to her by her mother.  The business makes her save more money since she has more customers.  

She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, pepper, oil, and others items for her business. Her plans are to build a house for her children.
.

loans.use: to buy more rice, pepper, oil, and other items for her business

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge de 32 años de edad, esta casado con Dina  de 23 años; viven en la casa que sus padres les dio, junto a su pequeña hija Luz de 05 años. Jorge, es un hombre responsable; él se dedica a la agricultura y gracias a las ganancias de sus cosechas logró abrir una bodega para su esposa, quien contenta atiende a sus clientes. En su bodega vende bebidas, golosinas y algunos víveres como también productos de limpieza. Esta actividad empezó hace 06 meses y durante ese tiempo obtuvo una buena clientela y buenos ingresos. 
Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo en su negocio, incrementando un estante más y una vitrina, de esa manera logrará que sus productos sean visibles. Con el préstamo podrá comprar algunos productos para que su bodega se vea bien presentable y seguir llamando la atención de la clientela. Este es su crédito número 01, se siente contento con el apoyo que le brindan, ya que gracias a ello logrará mejorar su negocio.
Con los 1,500 nuevos soles se abastecerá de cajas de galleta y bebidas de diversas marcas.
texts.en:
Jorge is 32 years old. He is married to Dina, age 23. They live in a house that his parents gave them, together with their little daughter Luz, who is 5 years old. Jorge is a responsible man; he works in agriculture, and thanks to the earnings from his harvests, he was able to open a neighborhood store for his wife, who is happy serving their customers. In the store, they sell soft drinks, snacks and some groceries as well as cleaning products. This business was started 6 months ago, and during this time they have obtained a good customer base and good earnings. 

Jorge's greatest desire is to keep the business growing, adding one more set of shelves and a display case, so that the products will be more visible. With this loan, he will be able to buy some products to make the store nice and presentable and to keep attracting customers' attention. This is his first loan, and he is happy about the support being provided to him, since thanks to it he will be able to improve his business. 

With the 1,500 new soles, he will stock up on cases of cookies and various brands of soft drinks.

loans.use: to buy cases of cookies and soft drinks.

loans.name: Amor Y Amistad 3 & 4 Group

texts.en: Paula is the coordinator of this group called Amor y Amistad 3 & 4 ("Love and Friendship"). The area in which the borrowers live is a nascent tourist zone, surrounded by the Atlantic Ocean and mountains, rivers and natural breezes. She is a married mother who lives in the beautiful town of Samana with her three children. Paula says her most important challenge is to keep her business stable and sustainable. She enjoys working and serving the needs of her family and friends. Paula is receiving her 11th loan with Esperanza Internacional, having repaid all her previous loans. After six years of investment, her business has been growing to the point where she is selling a greater range of products and acquiring more clients and communities. She will use this loan to purchase clothing such as pants, skirts, blouses, shirts, and shoes for both women and men. Paula will reinvest her profits in her business and is also planning to add other high-demand products for school supplies. She thanks you all for your support!

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama  is a baker.  She bakes bread for sale at Mpredwo. Ama finished middle form three in school.  She is married and has two children.  Her husband is a pensioner.  She is responsible for supporting her husband to feed their children.

Ama has been baking for some time now.  Her loan will be used to buy flour, sugar, and other ingredients to bake her bread for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand her business.

loans.use: buy flour, sugar and other ingredients to bake her bread for sale.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 34 years old and lives in Congo town.  She is married and has six children, 8 to 16 years old. They live at home and attend school.

For the past four years, she has been running a small shop where she sells dried bonnie, fish, and bush meat. She started this business with money given to her by her husband.  The business makes her save more money.  

She is requesting a loan to purchase more dried bonnie, fish,and bush meat for her business.  Her plans are to build a house and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more dried bonnie, fish, and bush meat for her business,

loans.name: Carla

texts.es: Carla, de 22 años, es una mujer amable y muy trabajadora, es soltera y no tiene hijos por el momento ya que desea prepararse para esa etapa tanto emocionalmente y económicamente. Vive en la casa de sus padres junto a ellos y su hermana y en conjunto buscan día a día mejorar su calidad de vida. El trabajo de Carla consiste en la venta de prendas de vestir de distintas marcas en las diferentes tallas, colores y modelos para damas caballeros y niños, ella se encarga personalmente de comprar las prendas al por mayor y de seleccionarlas una a una pensando siempre en lo que más le gusta a su público y en la comodidad que sienten ellos al usar las prendas que vende. Trabaja con ayuda de su mamá. Lleva en éste trabajo ya 3 años, lo realiza en su casa o visitando algunas viviendas, ha logrado tener una lista de clientes fijos entre amigos y familiares, algunas veces vende a crédito y otras veces al contado y por ello recibe buenas ganancias que le ayudan a mantener su solvencia económica. Le gusta mucho lo que hace pues tiene libertad para manejar su tiempo y organizarse de acuerdo a la disponibilidad de sus clientes, al principio como toda persona que recién empieza con un negocio propio tuvo algunas inseguridades pero con el tiempo pudo superarlos y ahora es una gran generadora de ingresos en la economía de su hogar, espera poner una tienda de ropas para seguir contribuyendo en el progreso de su familia. Este es el préstamo número 3 con la institución MFP. Se siente contenta de saber que le brindan el acceso a una línea de crédito para avanzar con su negocio. Por eso se compromete a ser responsable con el pago de sus cuotas para continuar en el futuro. Asegura que le gusta el trabajo de su banco comunal pues lo considera un grupo responsable  y unido. Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará gran cantidad de prendas de vestir conformada por polos, blusas y pantalones que  son del agrado de su clientela.
texts.en: Carla, age 22, is a friendly and very hard-working woman. At present, she is single and has no children, since she would like to prepare herself for that phase both emotionally and economically. She lives in her parents' house with her parents and her sister, and together they strive every day to improve their quality of life. Carla's work is selling clothing of various brands and different sizes, colors and styles, for men, women and children. She personally takes charge of buying the garments wholesale and selecting them one by one, always thinking about what her customers will like most and the comfort they will feel while wearing the clothing she sells. She has help from her mother with her work. She has already done this work for 3 years, working at her house or visiting some other homes. She has been able to build up a list of steady customers among friends and family members. Sometimes she sells on credit, and other times for cash, and she receives good earnings which help her to stay ahead of her expenses. She really likes what she does, because she has the freedom to manage her time and organize herself according to her customers' availability. At first, like any person who has just started a business, she had some areas of insecurity, but over time she was able to overcome them, and now the business is a great generator of income in her household economy. She hopes to set up a clothing store so that she can keep contributing to her family's progress. This is loan number 3 for her with the MFP institution. She feels happy to know that she has access to a line of credit to move forward with her business. For this reason, she is committed to being responsible with her loan payments, so she can continue in the future. She notes that she likes the work of her communal bank because she considers them a responsible and united group. With the amount she is requesting, 1000 soles, she will buy a great quantity of clothing, including shirts, blouses and pants, which are popular among her customers.

loans.use: to buy shirts, blouses and pants to sell.

loans.name: Adwowa

texts.en:
Adwowa sells saucepans  at Mpredwow.  She is single and has three children.   She is responsible for  clothing and feeding her children. 

Adwowa has been selling saucepans for some time now. Her loan will be used to buy more saucepans for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more saucepans for sale.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua sells palm kennel oil at Mpredwow.  She is married and has five children. Her husband is a farmer.  She is responsible for assisting her husband in the general upkeep of their family. 

Efua has been selling palm kennel oil for four years.   Her loan will be used to buy palm kennel for the preparation of her oil for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy palm kennel for the preparation of her oil for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a new electric logging saw.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther operates a grocery shop in Edukrom near Cape Coast. She has done this for 10 years. The items in her grocery shop are tinned fish, tinned tomatoes, Milo, different kinds of drinks, biscuits, toffees, milk, soap, etc. She is married and has two children. Esther uses her income to help her husband pay for their children’s school fees. She will use her loan to purchase a variety of grocery items to sell. With the new profit, Esther plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of grocery items to sell

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es:
Teofila tiene 52 años, está casada Víctor, con quien tiene 5 hijos, pero solo vive con los 3 menores de 21, 17 y 15 años; en una casa propia. Teofila es una mujer persistente. Se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenía 22 años. Por eso, con toda esa experiencia produce papas y ollucos (tubérculos andinos).
Con esa actividad logró adquirir el capital necesario para iniciar otros negocios. Uno de ellos la crianza de animales como: vacas y carneros, de los que obtenía carnes para ofrecerlos en las ferias de su ciudad. Lleva como 10 años con la venta de carnes, “En Tarma visito 3 ferias de 3 distritos, pero también llego hasta Chanchamayo (selva central), llevando mi mercadería”, comenta. 
 Actualmente cuenta con más de 50 cabezas de ganado ovino, y 3 de ganado vacuno, por eso, menciona que, con las ovejas tiene mayores ganancias. Además, cuando no cuenta con más carnes, tiene que comprar de otros ganaderos para no descuidar a sus clientes.
Con este trabajo coordinado Teofila confía que seguirá en su lucha de emprendimiento hasta conseguir el dinero suficiente para construir su hogar en la ciudad para beneficio de sus hijos. Éste es su crédito número 8 con MFP. Por esa razón da su palabra de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mirando un futuro mejor”, y se siente a gusto de tener compañeros solidarios.
Con los 1000 soles podrá comprar carnes de res, oveja y cerdo, para ofrecerlos en sus puestos de ventas de las distintas ferias.
texts.en:
Teofila is 52 years old. She is married to Victor. They have five children but only three live with them; the younger ones who are 21, 17 and 15 years old. They live in their own house. Teofila is a persistent woman. She has been a farmer since the age of 22. With all of these experiences, she grows potatoes and ollucos (Andean tubers). 
With this work, she was able to acquire the necessary capital to start other businesses. One of these businesses is raising animals like: cattle and sheep. She offers the meat at markets in her city. She has been selling meat for 10 years. “In Tarma, I visit 3 markets in 3 districts but I also go to Chanchamayo (central Peruvian rainforest), bringing my merchandise”, she comments. 
Currently, she has more than 50 sheep and three cows. She mentions that she earns more with the sheep. In addition, when she has no more meat, she has to purchase products from other farmers in order to not disappoint her customers. 
With this coordinated work, Teofila trusts that she will continue in her fight for entrepreneurship until she is able to obtain enough money to build a home in the city for her children. This is her eighth loan with MFP. For this reason, she gives her word that she will be punctual with her monthly payments. She belongs to the “Mirando un futuro major” communal bank and he likes having supportive partners. With the 1000 soles, she can purchase beef, mutton and pork to offer in her stands at the different markets.

loans.use: purchase beef, mutton and pork meat.

loans.name: Nancy Amparo

texts.es: La socia es la señora Nancy, ahora tiene 45 años de edad, soltera con 4 hijos, vive en la provincia de Urubamba, la socia continua con su actividad comercial de compra y venta de ropa de cama como sabanas, edredones,  de manera directa a sus clientes y a solicitud. Nancy se ha mantenido trabajando en esta actividad comercial, la cual le ha permitido sacar adelante y poder educar a sus hijos, La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería como sabanas y edredones, y capitalizar su actividad, por ello la socia está muy agradecida con KIVA, por ayudarla a desarrollarse en su trabajo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente. Nancy pertenece al banco comunal “San Jose de Urubamba” de la provincia de Urubamba del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
Nancy, now 45 years old, is single with four children. She lives in the province of Urubamba. She is continuing with her business, which is buying and selling bedding like sheets and comforters, directly to clients, and by request. She has kept working at this business, which has allowed her to move forward and educate her children.

She is applying for the loan to buy merchandise like sheets and comforters, and to capitalize her business. She is very grateful to Kiva, for helping her to develop her business and she promises to make her payments on time. Nancy belongs to the communal bank "San Jose de Urubamba" in the Urubamba Province of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: comprar mercadería como sabanas y edredones

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es: La socia es la señora Juana, ahora tiene 42 años de edad, soltera con  hijo, vive en la provincia de Urubamba, la socia continua con su actividad comercial de venta de comida en su pequeño restaurante. Juana se ha mantenido trabajando en esta actividad comercial, la cual le ha permitido sacar adelante y poder educar a su hijo, La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos como arroz, fideos, carnes, granos etc. para poder producir sus alimentos, por ello la socia está muy agradecida con KIVA, por ayudarla a desarrollarse en su trabajo y hasta está ahorrando para abrir otro restaurante acorto plazo, la socia se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente. Juana pertenece al banco comunal “San Jose de Urubamba” de la provincia de Urubamba del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
Juana is now 42 years old.  She is single with one son and she lives in the province of Urubamba.  She continues with her commercial activity of selling food in her small restaurant.  Juana has supported herself working in this commercial activity, which has permitted her to get ahead and to be able to educate her son.  

She is applying for the loan in order to buy supplies like rice, noodles, meat and grains to be able to make her food.  She is very grateful to Kiva for helping her to develop in her work and she is even saving to open another restaurant in the short term.  She promises to comply with the payment of her installments punctually.  She belongs to the communal bank “San José de Urubamba” in the province of Urubamba of Cusco, Perú.

loans.use: to buy supplies like rice, noodles, meat, grains, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to cover the cost of labor.

loans.name: Mwafaki

texts.en:
Mwafaki is single and lives with her five children, two of whom completed school while three still attend school. Mwafaki is a hardworking entrepreneur who started working and, with a lot of effort, studied hairdressing and manicure and received the best grades. She performs her services in-home, offering her customers comfort and professionalism at a good price. She reports that it is going well with her established clientele because they are all very busy people who don't have time to wait for hours in beauty salons.

Mwafaki is requesting a loan which she wants to invest in buying a professional hair dryer and a hair straightener. This will help her a lot in her work. She very much appreciates the assistance that she is receiving, since it will be a great help.

loans.use: to buy a professional hair dryer and a hair straightener.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba is married and has three children. She is a fishmonger at Mpredwow, which she has done for six years. Her husband sells charcoal. Araba uses her income to assist her husband in the general upkeep of their family. 

Araba will use the loan to purchase fish to fry for sale. With the new profits from her business, Araba plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish to fry for sale.

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en:
Abdullah is a 47-year-old married man and has seven children who live together in Taiz, Yemen. He has tried to work hard. He has a strong determination to improve his standard of living. 

Due to the high cost of goods, he has requested a loan of 100,000 YER to buy house furnishings like blankets, carpets, cushions, etc. In the future, he hopes to have a big house.

loans.use: to buy house furnishings like blankets, carpets, cushions, etc. for his house.

loans.name: Gergette

texts.fr: Georgette est une jeune femme de 29 ans mariée et mére de 4 enfants dont l'âge vari entre 8 et 2 ans dont 3 sont scolarisés. Elle est commerçante dans un quartier de la capitale depuis 10 mois. la qualité de ses produits,son dynamisme et ses prix lui ont valu une tré grande clientéle q'elle n'arrive plus à fidéliser à cause la rupture permanente de ses stocks. Elle sollicite donc ce credit dans le but d'acroître ses stocks (acheter les pots de peinture, lles pelles...). Elle voudrait avec les bénéfices de son affaire réinvestir dans son activité et le reste lui permettra d'aider son mari avec les besoins de la maison
texts.en:
Gergette is a young woman, age 29, who is married and the mother of four children.  Her children are between the ages of 8 and 2, and three of them attend school.

For the past ten months, Gergette has been working as a retailer in one of the neighborhoods of the capital city. 

Thanks to her enthusiasm and to the quality and reasonable prices of the goods that she sells, she has managed to attract a large group of customers.  However, she is losing customer loyalty because she is constantly out-of-stock.  This is why she is requesting this loan, so that she can increase her stock of goods (she specifically wants to buy cans of paint and some shovels).

She plans to reinvest part of her profits into her business.  The rest will be used to help her husband meet the needs of the household.

loans.use: to increase her stock of goods (to buy cans of paint, shovels etc...)

loans.name: Worwolee H.

texts.en:
Worwolee H. is 43 years old and lives in Congo Town. She is married, with four children, 19 to 27 years old.  Three of them are in school, and all live at home.

She has been running a cook shop (restaurant) in her community since 2010.  She started this business with money given to her by her husband, and she learned this business from her mother. Her favorite part about her business is that she makes more profit. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, charcoal, and pepper for her business. In the future, she wants to build a house for her children

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, charcoal, and pepper for her business.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi  is married, with five children.  Esi sells gari at Mpredwowo, which she has done for 10 years. Esi uses her income to support her husband in clothing and feeding their children. 

Esi will use the loan to purchase bags of gari. With the new profits from her business, Esi plans to expand her business.

loans.use: purchase bags of gari to sell.

loans.name: Los Tres Barrios - Qoricancha Group

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal TRES BARRIOS DE CCORICANCHA,el socio tiene 74 años de edad y es conviviente,el socio alterna sus actividades diarias dedicandose a la agricultura y ganaderia,el socio siembra lo que son papa y maiz para luego venderlo a sus clientes que mas le solicitan de la misma manera el socio cria a sus vacas para venderlas a quienes le soliciten ,el socio trabaja todos los dias desde las 07:00am hasta las 04:00pm aproximadamente,el saca a pastear a sus vacas y ver sus sembrios,el socio es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta manera que el socio sale adelante.
El socio solicita el credito para la compra de semillas y fertilizantes para su chacra.

Los demas socios se dedican a la misma actividad agricultura,ganaderia,crianza de animales menores,venta de comida.

El socio que sale en la foto adjunta es socio que pidio permiso para llegar tarde a la reunion y la persona que sale con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal.


El socio se siente agradecido por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotes establecidas.
texts.en:
The borrower belongs to the "Tres Barrios de Qoricancha" communal bank. She is 74 years old and lives with her partner. She alternates her daily activities, engaging in farming and livestock-raising. The borrower grows potatoes and corn, to later sell them to her customers who most request them. 

In the same way, she raises her cows to sell them to those that ask to buy them. She works every day from approximately 7:00am to 4:00pm. She takes her cows out to pasture and to see to her crops. She is a responsible and determined person and this the way she is moving forward in life. 

The borrower is requesting the loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for her small farm. 

The other members also work in farming, as well as in livestock-raising, raising small animals and selling food. 

The member shown in the attached photo is one who asked permission to arrive late to the meeting, and the person shown with their face covered does not belong to the communal bank. 

The borrower feels grateful for the loan granted, and promised to make her instalment payments on time.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers for her small farm.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi is married and has four children. Esi is a baker and a petty trader in Mpredwow. She has been in this business for two years. Her husband is a driver. Esi uses her income to assist her husband with the general upkeep of their family. Esi will use this loan to purchase flour and sugar for her bakery and ladies underwear to sell. Esi plans to expand her business with her new profit.

loans.use: to purchase flour and sugar for her bakery and ladies underwear to sell.

loans.name: Fuerza Divina 1 Group

texts.en:
Yohanny is the coordinator of her group, Fuerza Divina (Divine Force) 1. This group is located in Hato Mayor, a rural town where the economy is based around agriculture. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her three children.

Yohanny sells cosmetics in her house and by walking in her community and others nearby. She went into business using her savings, setting up a stall in her house. Almost a year ago she went to Esperanza and took out a loan that made it possible for her to invest a greater amount in her business and so earn more in profits.

Yohanny is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan. She is planning to use her loan to buy cosmetics such as body lotion, deodorant, beauty cream, make-up, and other products. Her profits will be reinvest in her business. She wants to improve it and sell more. 

She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy cosmetic products to sell.

loans.name: Felleze

texts.en:
Felleze is in her mid forties and has three children: 21, 15 and 9 years old. All of them are attending school. Being a single mother hasn’t been very easy at all. Her family lives in the southeastern part of Albania where Felleze raises animals and sells milk, butter and cheese. She is very good at making delicious dairy products and has established a good clientele these past six years that she has been involved in this activity.

Felleze now is requesting a Kiva loan via VisionFund Albania to purchase one more cow that will help her grow her business and increase her profit.

Felleze hopes that she will get some understanding from lenders and wants to thank them in advance. She has had two loans prior to this one. She has repaid them successfully and she promises that she will do the same thing with this loan – she will pay it off on time.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena is married and has six children. Abena sells cosmetics, ladies wear and underwear in Mpredwow, which she has done for two years. Her husband is a mason. Abena uses her income to assist her husband with the general upkeep of their family. Abena will use this loan to purchase cosmetics, ladies wear and underwear to sell. With the new profits, Abena plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics, ladies wear and underwear to sell

loans.name: Unidas Con Cristo 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Maria is the coordinator of her group Unidas con Cristo (Unite with Christ) 1, 2 & 3.  This group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, where the sugarcane harvest and tourist industry dominate the economy. She is excited to be taking out her fifth loan. 

She sells clothing, including pants, underwear, blouses, skirts, and shirts.  She started this business with the first loan she took from Esperanza International. She will reinvest the profits in her business and provide for her children's school supplies. 

Maria makes her home in a simple structure with her long-term partner and five of her eight children. She says that her most challenging goal is to acquire her own house. 

She thanks you all for your support!!!

loans.use: To buy pants, underwear, blouses, skirts, and shirts to sell.

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es: El Sr. Ramiro es originario del poblado de El Cedral del vecino estado de San Luis Potosí y a los 6 meses de edad sus padres emigraron a la ciudad de Monterrey, N.L., buscando una mejor calidad de vida. Comenzaron a trabajar en mercaditos, y el joven Ramiro apoyaba a sus padres que con el tiempo se quedo al frente del pequeño negocio, donde vendía cajas de cerillos, bolsas de papel y fibras para cocina y las ventas apenas le dejaban para comer. En 1982 Ramiro contrajo matrimonio con la Sra. Sandra, y de ese matrimonio nacieron tres (3) hijos, que en la actualidad estudian. Con el apoyo de su esposa, el negocio de Ramiro fue creciendo e incrementando la variedad de artículos para ventas; más tarde agregaron la venta de refacciones electrodomésticas y con el crédito solicitado aumentarán el volumen del inventario que le permitirá obtener mayores ganancias y de esa manera ayudar a sus hijos.  Ramiro junto con su esposa son los que atienden el negocio y se sienten con mucha esperanza de lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Ramiro is from the town of El Cedral in the neighboring state of San Luis Potosí. When he was six years old, his parents emigrated to the city of Monterrey, Nuevo Leon, seeking a better quality of life. 

They began to work in street markets, and the young Ramiro helped his parents. In time he was at the head of the small business, where he sold boxes of matches, paper bags and kitchen twine. The sales barely left him enough to eat.

In 1982 Ramiro married Sandra; and from that marriage, three children were born, who are now in school. With his wife's help, the business began growing, and adding to the variety of items for sale. Later they added sales of parts for household appliances.

With the requested loan, they will increase their inventory, which will allow them to earn greater profits and that way help their children. 

Ramiro and his wife are the ones who run the business and they feel very hopeful of achieving their objective.

loans.use: To purchase household appliances such as blenders, as well as batteries, kitchen twine, light bulbs, tools and electrical parts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy popsicles, sorbets and ice cream

loans.name: Rolando Alberto

texts.es:
Rolando, necesita un préstamo para financiar su cultivo de granos básicos, lo invertirá en la compra de insumos tales como: compra de cuatro sacos de abono, mano de obra, insecticidas, semilla entre otros, que son muy importantes para que se apliquen al cultivo y fortalezcan la produccion así como eviten las plagas.
El crédito anterior aumento la cosecha y sus utilidades, la familia  se compone de tres miembros incluyendolo a él, la cual se encuentran muy bien económicamente y de salud, gracias al crédito que Kiva les proporciono.
texts.en:
Rolando needs a loan to finance his cultivation of staple grains.  He will invest the loan in the purchase of supplies such as: 4 sacks of fertilizer, insecticides and seeds, and he will also pay for labor.  It's important to apply these products to the crops, because they increase the yield and avoid infestation with pests.

His previous loan increased his harvest and profits.  There are 3 members of his family, including him, and they are doing very well financially and in good health, thanks to the Kiva loan that was provided to them.

loans.use: to pay for 4 sacks of fertilizer, insecticides, seeds and labor

loans.name: Makbule

texts.en:
Makbule is an Egyptian woman from one of the two most vulnerable ethnic minority communities of central Albania. She is in her early fifties and has four children, all being grownups. This is her first time applying for a loan.  In the past, she had somehow managed it financially and otherwise; raising the children and doing everything around the home. 

Makbule is in the tenth year now of selling used clothes and other used items. Currently, she has an inventory of used items, yet they are not up for sale because they are summer clothes, and we just left the summer behind. So this is why she is requesting a loan, to buy seasonal clothes.

Makbule trusts that lenders will understand her situation and lend to her.

loans.use: To stock up on an inventory of seasonal used clothes

loans.name: Lavdije

texts.en:
Lavdije is 37 and married. She has three children, aged 14, 13 and 12; all of them go to school. She is a hard-working Romani from the vulnerable ethnic minority community of central Albania. She started working when she was 13 years old and since then she has been selling used clothes, like so many other people in her community. She is not educated herself, yet her children go to school and she is proud of them. Her dream is that someday her children will attend university.

Lavdije wants to stock up on inventory items--used clothing for the winter season and other used home accessories that she knows are in demand. To fulfill this, she needs a loan, and that’s why she applied for one from the VisionFund Albania (VFA) institution. Soon she was called by the staff to let her know that she can get a Kiva loan instead. 

Lavdije is thankful to both Kiva and VFA for the help they have been providing to her community.

loans.use: To stock up on inventory

loans.name: Ousmane

texts.fr:
Ousmane est un agriculteur depuis plus de 25 ans. Il est plein d’énergie et aime le métier qu’il fait. C’est aussi un habitué du guichet de l’IMCEC car il est à son 5ème crédit. Il aimerait obtenir un montant de 200000F CFA pour acheter 14 pots de semences choux, 50 sacs de fumiers et une moto pompe. Il est marié et père de famille et s’occupe de la dépense quotidienne.
Avec le crédit, il pourra épargner et  améliorer les conditions alimentaires de son foyer.
Ousmane a la chance d’avoir des champs et il envisage s’il a les moyens, d’exploiter ses terres pour augmenter ses revenus et mieux s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ousmane has been working as a farmer for more than 25 years.  He is a very dynamic man and he loves his job.  He is also a regular client of the UIMCEC, as this is his fifth loan with the institution.

He would like to receive a loan in the amount of 200,000 CFA francs to buy 14 cans of cabbage seeds, 50 bags of manure and a powered water pump.

He is married and has a family.  He manages the household's day-to-day expenses.

This loan will help him to save some money and to better feed his family.

Ousmane is lucky to own some fields.  If he can afford it, he is planning to cultivate his land in order to boost his income and to better provide for his family.

loans.use: to buy 14 cans of cabbage seeds, 50 bags of manure and a powered water pump.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.es:
La  Señora Olivia tiene 32 años de edad, es casada, tiene 3 hijos, vive en  una comunidad rural del Municipio de Arizona, Departamento de Atlántida.
Doña Olivia comenzó su negocio de pulpería hace tres años, también dedica parte de su tiempo a la venta de ropa de manera ambulante.
En su negocio vende productos de la canasta básica familiar como ser granos básicos, productos lácteos, carnes, frutas y verduras, manteca, productos de aseo y variedades.
Olivia ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad de 13,000 Lempiras, los cuales piensa invertir en surtir más la pulpería con productos alimenticios, productos de aseo y limpieza y variedades. Con la inversión que hará, espera aumentar las ventas y mejorar sus ganancias para brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Olivia is 32 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in a rural community in the municipality of Arizona, Atlántida department. 

Olivia started her small general store business three years ago. She also devotes part of her time to selling clothing as a street vendor. 

In her business, she sells basic household products such as staple grains, dairy products, meats, fruits and vegetables, lard, personal hygiene products and a variety of other items. 

Olivia has requested a loan in the amount of 13,000 lempiras, which she intends to invest in further stocking her small general store with food products, personal hygiene and cleaning products, and a variety of other items. 

With the investment she will make, she hopes to increase sales and improve her earnings, so that she can offer a good education to her children.

loans.use: To buy food products such as staple grains, dairy products, soft drinks, and a variety of other items.

loans.name: Mafate

texts.en: Mafate is 27 years old and lives in West Point. She is married and her husband is a school teacher. They have two children, ages 6 and 9 years old. For the past five years now, she has been operating a provisions shop where she sells soda, soap and rice amongst other things. She makes a lot of profit and she uses it to help with the upkeep of her house. She is requesting a loan to purchase more goods for her shop. She hopes to send her children to quality schools in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more goods (soda, soap, rice, oil, etc.) for her business.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida lives in Mantic, Tangub City. For five years, she has earned money by providing transportation services, so as to support the needs of her family. She receives an income of 5,000 PHP a month for this business. For a 44-year old mother, there’s nothing that can make her happier than to see her family living in good conditions. 

Without hesitation, Zenaida is borrowing 12,000 PHP from GDMPC microcredit to repair the transport vehicle used in her business. She joined GDMPC in 2010. Her plan in the future is to hopefully improve her business.

loans.use: to repair the transport vehicle used in her business

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en:
Rodrigo is from Mayor's Village, Clarin. He is 59 years old, separated, and has six children. 

To make a living, Rodrigo owns and operates a business operating tricycle transport services. Rodrigo has engaged in his business for over eight years and earns PHP 7,500 per month from these activities.  

In 2008, Rodrigo joined GDMPC. He is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 that will be used to repair his existing vehicle to provide a better service. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to repair his existing vehicle to provide a better service.

loans.name: Brigida

texts.en:
Brigida is a 64-year-old married woman. She lives in Cabungaan, Clarin.
