Brigida plants, harvests, and sells bananas for a living. She's been in the business for 20 years and gains PHP 4,000 a month from this business. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 that will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. In 2011, Brigida joined GDMPC. 

She hopes to improve her family's living conditions and to save a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, such as manure.

loans.name: Blas

texts.es:
Blas tiene 49 años de edad, convive con Dionicia, con quien tiene un hijo de 10 años. Esta familia vive unida en una casa propia que Blas construyó con esfuerzo.
Blas tiene un carácter amical y es empeñoso. Se dedica a varias actividades: servicio de transporte con un vehículo, la agricultura y la ganadería. 
Su zona es propicia para la producción de una variedad de papas harinosas y para la crianza de animales como ovejas y vacas, gracias a los pastos naturales. Por esas razones Blas se esfuerza en mejorar su cosecha y sus ganados. “Estos meses me voy a dedicar a criar terneras, porque se gana bien”, dice, entusiasta.
Cuenta que adquiere cada ternera a 500, 600, 700 u 800 soles, dependiendo del tamaño y raza. 
Cuando cree que sus animales ya alcanzaron el tamaño y peso ideal, los traslada hacia la ciudad de Huancayo y los ofrece en ferias de ganados mayores. De esa manera trabaja Blas. Esta vez quiere continuar con la crianza de estos animales, por ello requiere de su apoyo para adquirirlos. Éste es su préstamo número 10 con MFP, por ello se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las mensualidades. En cuanto a su banco comunal “Mirando un futuro mejor”, menciona que le agradan las reuniones y las charlas educativas.
Blas desea comprar 4 terneras de 600 soles, para criarlos y luego venderlos.
texts.en:
Blas is 49 years old. He lives with Dionicia with whom he has a 10-year-old son. This family lives together in their own home that Blas built with effort. Blas’ personality is friendly and diligent. He works in several activities such as: a car transportation service, agriculture, and stockbreeding. 

Due to the natural pastures, his zone is favorable to the production of a variety of potatoes and to the breeding of animals such as sheep and cow. For these reasons, Blas works hard to improve his crop and his cattle. 

“These coming months I will to work to raise cattle, because it sells well,” he said enthusiastically. He expects that he will buy each calf at 500, 600, 700 or 800 soles, depending on the size and breed. When he believes that his animals have reached the ideal size and weight he will take them to the city of Huancayo and offer them in cattle shows. This is Blas’ living.

This time he wants to continue to breed the animals and he needs help to purchase them. This is his tenth loan and he promises to be punctual in his monthly payments. 

He is part of a community bank called “Mirando un future major” (Looking into a better future), where he enjoys the meetings and educational conversation. 

Blas wants to purchase 4 calves at 600 soles each to raise and sell them.

loans.use: to purchase 4 calves

loans.name: Virgen Natividad De Chuso Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN NATIVIDAD DE CHUSO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Chinchero, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Elena ella es casada y tiene 43 años y tiene 5 hijos; La socia trabaja con su negocio de su pequeña tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azúcar,leche y galletas, la socia también se dedica al negocio de crianza de animales como chanchos y cuyes y también la socia tiene un terreno de cultivo donde siembra papas,zanahorias,tomates y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias de Anta, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia se dedica a la agricultura 10 años, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite y galletas.
Las socia que estan pegadas a la foto grupal se les tomo despues la foto porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
La socia que esta tapada con un circulo su cara ya no pertenece al banco comunal virgen natividad de chuso
Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de agricultura, negocio de venta de vacas, negocio de venta de pollipapas y negocio de crianza de animales.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These individuals belong to the communal bank "Virgn Natividad de Chuso."  This bank is located in the Chinchero district, which is in Urubamba province in the department of Cusco.

Elena, 43, is a member of this group.  She is married and has 5 children.  She works in her business, which is a small grocery store.  She sells consumer staples such as rice, sugar, milk and cookies.  Elena also has a business raising animals such as pigs and guinea pigs, and she cultivates a plot of land where she grows potatoes, carrots, and tomatoes.  She later takes her products to sell in the various markets in Anta.  Elena works from 8am until 5pm.  She has been farming for 10 years.  Her dream is to expand her grocery store business.  She is requesting a loan to buy groceries such as rice, sugar, milk, cooking oil and cookies. 

The members who are seen in the inserted pictures had their pictures taken later because they requested permission to miss the group picture for work reasons.  The woman whose face is covered with a circle no longer belongs to the communal bank "Virgen Natividad de Chuso."  The other members of this group have businesses including: farming, selling cows, selling fried chicken, and raising animals.

Elena thanks all of those who are helping her to make her dream a reality through these means.  She promises to make her payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy groceries, including: rice, sugar, milk, cooking oil, and cookies

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba is married and has four children. Aba sells kenkey [fermented corn dough wrapped in corn or banana leaves] and palm kennel oil in Mpredwow. She has done this for 10 years. Aba uses her income to feed, clothe and pay for her children's school fees. Aba will use this loan to purchase kennel for her oil and bags of maize to prepare her kenkey for sale. Aba plans to save the new profits from her business to give her children the best education.

loans.use: to purchase kennel for her oil and bags of maize to prepare her kenkey for sale.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza, who lives in Molicay, Ozamis City, helps her family through buying and selling of jewelry and accessories. 

She is 38 years old and married with three kids. She is someone who tries her best to earn on her own. For 10 years, she has managed this business and earns about PHP 3,500 per month. 

For the time being, she’s in need of buying accessories and jewelry to sell.   She joined last 2007, and she says thanks to GDMPC micro finance for the loan of PHP 5,000 they provided her. Liza desires to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy accessories and jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en: Jessica is married and a mother of three dependents. She is 46-years-old and lives in Malaubang, Osamiz City. Jessica owns and operates a motorcycle transport business. She established the motorcycle transport business as a way of generating extra income of 4,600 PHP per month. She has been engaged in this type of service for 5 years. Jessica requested a loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. She intends to use the money from the loan to purchase motorcycle spare parts and accessories. Jessica has been a good member of GDMPC since 2008. In the future, Jessica wants to purchase more motorcycles to use in her business.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts and accessories

loans.name: Jeanna

texts.en: Jeanna has a food vending business to earn a living. Her main source of income comes from selling barbecued food in her community. She has been in this type of business for 2 years. She earns 4,000 PHP each month from these activities. Jeanna is 49-years-old and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is married and the mother of two children. Jeanna has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC to purchase raw ingredients to barbecue and to purchase kitchen utensils for food preparation. She has been a member of GDMPC since 2011. In the future, Jeanna hopes to expand her barbecue vending and have a stall in the city for food vending.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients to barbecue and to purchase kitchen utensils for food preparation

loans.name: Ronelyn

texts.en:
Ronelyn is a 36-year old resident of Clarin. She has helped her family for five years with the small income of 8,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) she gets monthly from her piggery, which is in addition to her husband's income.

However just this year she joined GDMPC and is applying for a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy feeding supplies. She wants to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies.

loans.name: Cita

texts.en: Cita is a hog-raiser in the village of Culalabat. She is married and has three children. As she said, she is willing to do everything to provide the family's daily needs. Cita has been engaged in her hog-raising business for almost three years. She usually acquires an income amount of 7,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) per piglet. Right now, Cita is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 10,000 to buy feed and vaccines to sustain her hogs. She believes that through her loan, she will be able to improve her business and gain a higher income.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines to sustain her hogs.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is a hardworking mother who raises hogs. She established the enterprise to increase her income. Right now, Erlinda is requesting a loan of 12,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy feed, vitamins and medicines for her pigs for breeding. With proper growth and nutrition, she can sell them for a good price, thereby increasing her income. She aims to have a diversified business and establish a stable income for the overall welfare of the family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and medicines for her pigs for breeding.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a twin needle sewing machine.

loans.name: Donald

texts.en:
Donald is from Lapasan, Clarin. He is 31 years old and married, with four children. 

To make a living, Donald owns and operates a transportation services business. Donald has engaged in his business for three years and earns PHP 8,000 a month from these activities. In 2010, Donald joined GDMPC. 

Donald is now requesting a loan of PHP 40,000 that will be used to repair his existing vehicle for better service. 

He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to repair his existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en: Guillerma, 54 years old, is from Gango Rizal, Ozamis City. She is married and has 5 children. For the past 13 years, Guillerma has run a sari-sari (general) store where she sells both food and daily use products in the local community. Guillerma earns PHP 5,000 a month. She is requesting a loan of PHP 10,500 to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. Guillerma joined GDMPC in 2010. She dreams of business expansion one day.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en: Carolina, 50 years old, is married and has five children. She has been raising livestock for 3 years in the Philippines. Carolina has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF and, more recently, from Kiva to sustain her business. She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more livestock. Carolina works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 17000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her restaurant business.

Mildred has been in this business for five years. Mildred also earns more income from buying and selling livestock and from a general store.

Mildred has sustained her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Arnolfo

texts.en:
Arnolfo, aged 48, believes that, "if there is persistence, there is movement".  He is a hardworking father who wants to provide for all the needs of his three children and his loving wife. Arnolfo has devoted himself to his job (electrician) in their municipality. He is very friendly, approachable and kind, qualities that cause people to like him very much. He is also a very good electrician who offers inexpensive services. Even with his low income, he is already happy. However, his family triggers him to earn a higher income, especially with his three children already in school. 

Arnolfo needs to become accountable and responsible. To make a viable income, he is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase electrical equipment such as a new tester, pliers, wires, a long nose cutter and a circuit breaker.  This would enable him to offer accurate and fast service. As a result, Arnolfo could offer high quality, accurate and additional household services within a day. He hopes that his requested loan will be approved.

loans.use: to purchase electrical equipment such as a new tester, pliers, wires, a long nose cutter and a circuit breaker

loans.name: Emerson

texts.es:
Emerson, de 30 años, es un hombre honesto y muy amable, siempre trabajó mucho para poder brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, convive con Idaura con quien tiene un hijo de 2 años, actualmente vive en el terreno de su suegra en donde le brindaron un espacio en el que pudo construir su casa con mucho esfuerzo y que ahora puede disfrutar habitándola con su familia. La actividad de Emerson, como todos los días, es de conducir mototaxi, realiza su trabajo por las principales calles de la ciudad en busca de sus eventuales pasajeros a quienes transporta hasta su destino con bastante serenidad ya que considera que la seguridad de sus clientes es lo más importante, de la misma manera siempre brinda su numero de celular para que pueda ser contactado por algún cliente que necesita de su servicio de transporte. Los 5 años de experiencia y la calidad de su trabajo lo coloca como una pieza clave en el oficio que desarrolla. Tiene también un puesto de venta de abarrotes en un mercado de la ciudad pero que lamentablemente está decayendo, es por eso que ahora quiere dedicarse a la venta de ropa porque lo considera más rentable y de esta forma complementar su trabajo como mototaxista. Aunque al principio no le fue muy bien, afirma que ahora esa situación ha cambiado y sus ingresos se han visto multiplicados gracias a las recomendaciones de algunos de sus clientes a quienes prestó sus servicios. Ahora espera continuar trabajando como mototaxista y en un plazo relativamente corto desea consolidar su negocio de venta de ropa. Este es el préstamo número 4 con la institución MFP. Es por eso que agradece a quienes hacen posible este financiamiento que le ayudará a cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, comenta sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal, pues conoce a sus integrantes y los considera personas responsables y solidarias.
El monto solicitado 2000 soles, lo invertirá en la refacción de su mototaxi para que funcione de manera óptima, otra parte del dinero lo invertirá en el acondicionamiento de su local de venta de ropa.
texts.en:
Emerson is 30 years old. He is an honest and very kind man who has always worked hard so that he can offer a better quality of life to his family. He lives with his partner Idaura, and they have a two-year-old son. 

Currently he lives on a plece of land belonging to his mother-in-law, where they have provided him a space where, with much effort, he was able to build his house. Now he can enjoy living in it with his family. Emerson's day to day work is driving a mototaxi. 

He carries on his work around the main streets of the city, seeking his casual passengers, whom he transports to their destination quite calmly, as he considers that the safety of his customers is the most important thing. In the same way, he always offers his cell number so that he can be contacted by some client who needs his transportation service. 

His five years of experience and the quality of his work make him a key figure in his trade. 

He also has a stand selling groceries in a market in the city, but business is unfortunately declining. That is why he now wants to sell clothing, because he considers it more profitable and wants to complement his work as a mototaxi operator in this way. 

Although at the beginning things were not going very well, he says that that situation has changed and his income has multiplied, thanks to the recommendations of some of his customers to whom he provided his services. 

Now he hopes to continue working as a mototaxi operator, and within a relatively short time, wishes to build up his clothes-selling stand.  

This is his fourth loan with the MFP institution. That is why he is grateful to those who make possible this loan that will help him fulfill his objectives. Moreover, he says that he feels at ease with his communal bank, as he knows the members and considers them responsible and supportive people. 

He will use the amount of 2,000 soles to repair his mototaxi so that it functions optimally. He will use the other part of the money to equip his clothes-selling shop.

loans.use: To pay for mechanical work on his vehicle, and to equip the place he sells clothing.

loans.name: Alexander Alejandro

texts.es:
Alexander es un joven de 20 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Santiago con sus padres y hermanos, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta que tiene un gran deseo de superación, gracias a su esfuerzo y al poyo de sus padres, Alexander pudo estudiar la carrera técnica de manejo de maquinarias pesadas, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina unos deliciosos Chicharrones para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, Alexander trabaja como obrero en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, todos los días desde tempanas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, él puede trabajar un aproximado de  10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Alexander se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una computadora, la cual le servirá de mucho para poder realizar sus trabajado estudiantiles, ya que dará inicio a sus estudios de computación e informática, así él espera cursar satisfactoriamente su carrera para lograr su gran sueño de ser un buen profesional  y superarse en la vida, para ser el orgullo de sus padres.
texts.en:
Alexander is 20 years old.  He lives in the city if Ica within the Santiago district with his parents and siblings.  He is friendly, hard-working, enthusiastic and has a great desire to succeed.  Thanks to his parents' support and his hard work Alexander was able to undertake the study of a career in operating heavy machinery.  

During his free time he likes to watch TV and sometimes he cooks delicious fried pork rinds to share with his family.  With much effort and enthusiasm, Alexander works for the city's agricultural fund waking up in the early hours of the day to work approximately 10 hours. He believes he is doing well due to his strong performance and the good relationships he has with others.

Alexander is very appreciative of this Kiva loan as it will help him purchase a computer that will serve as a tool for his study of computer technology and information.  He hopes to graduate with this degree that will satisfy his wish of becoming a successful professional and making his parents proud.

loans.use: to purchase a computer.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María, de 55 años, es una mujer honesta, alegre y muy trabajadora, vive al lado de su conviviente y su hijo en su casa propia que compró con los ahorros de su trabajo, allí comparten el deseo de conseguir un nivel de vida mejor y lleno de satisfacciones. El trabajo de María consiste en la venta de prendas de vestir de distintas marcas, modelos y tallas para todas las edades, tanto para hombres como para mujeres, así mismo ofrece al público la mejor calidad de sábanas y toallas en diversos colores. Toda su mercadería la renueva de manera mensual, para ello viaja a otra ciudad donde encuentra todo lo necesario a precios mas baratos. Trabaja en este sector desde hace 6 meses, anteriormente compartía esta labor con la venta de comida en su casa, pero por prescripción médica ha tenido que dejar esa función y ahora se dedica plenamente a la venta de ropa además ella asegura que le genera mayor rentabilidad. Recibe el apoyo de su hijo y de su pareja quienes le ayudan a movilizar la mercadería pesada. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es la facilidad que tiene de conseguir nuevos clientes, su carisma y su alegría le han permitido realizar buenas ventas en corto tiempo, por lo tanto el dinero que obtiene como ganancia es generado con mayor rapidez, además le permite organizar su tiempo y realizar las labores domésticas en su hogar, su pareja la incentiva a seguir adelante y ahora su principal meta es acondicionar un local de venta en un espacio de su casa en el que pueda establecer una pequeña boutique para continuar progresando. Este es el crédito número 20 con MFP, por tanto agradece a todos los que hacen posible su crédito para continuar con sus objetivos, ella por su parte se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual, está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos sus integrantes son personas muy amables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado 3000 soles, comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería conformada por prendas de vestir como polos, shorts, pantalones, blusas y sábanas.
texts.en:
María, 55 years of age, is an honest, happy and hard-working woman.  She lives with her partner and son in her own house, which she bought with savings from her work.  There, they share the desire to attain a life that is of a higher standard and full of satisfaction.  María’s work consists of selling clothing of different brands, styles and sizes for all ages.  She carries items for both men and women, and also offers to the general public the best quality bedding and towels in a variety of colors.  She renews all her merchandise on a monthly basis, for which she travels to another city where she can find everything she needs at lower prices.

She has been working in this sector for 6 months, having previously alternated this work with selling food from her home.  However, on doctor’s orders, she had to leave that function and now she dedicates herself solely to clothing sales.  She assures us that it generates more profit.  She has the support of her son and partner, who help her move the heavy merchandise.  What she enjoys about her work is the ease with which she obtains new customers, and her charisma and cheerfulness have permitted her to attain high sales levels in a short period of time.  As a result, she generates profits more quickly.  The work allows her to organize her time and complete her household chores.  Her partner encourages her to continue forward and now her primary goal is to outfit a section of her house as a small boutique so she can continue progressing.

This is her 20th loan with MFP and she thanks everyone who makes her access to credit possible so she can meet her objectives.  On her part, she commits to paying her installments on time.  She is very happy to belong to a cooperative bank given that all the members are very friendly and united.

With the 3,000 Peruvian soles requested, she will buy a greater quantity of merchandise comprised of clothing such as t-shirts, shorts, pants, blouses and bed sheets.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, shorts, pants, blouses, bed sheets.

loans.name: Greta

texts.en: Greta is widowed and she works hard to support her family. She has operated a general store business in the Philippines for 20 years. Greta has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy grocery items such as canned goods, soft drinks, etc. In the future, Greta would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as canned goods, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Johna

texts.en: Johna  is married and she works hard to support her family. She has operated a food vending business in the Philippines for 7 years. Johna has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business. In the future, Johna would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en: Mildred, 29 years old, is single and has 2 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She has run a general store in the Philippines for 4 years. Mildred also earns an income from fish vending and buying and selling charcoal. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items such as shampoo, groceries, etc.  to sell in her general store. Mildred has previously borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF. She hopes to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Mirna

texts.es:
Mirna, de 56 años, es una mujer trabajadora y muy responsable, es viuda y es por eso que tuvo que criar sola a sus dos hijos que ya son adultos e independientes económicamente pero viven junto a ella en su casa propia donde además acoge a sus nietos. Trabaja mucho pues desea tener una mejor calidad de vida y una vejez tranquila. Mirna, tiene como labor la venta de comida, trabaja en su casa generalmente durante las noches pero los fines de semana puede hacerlo todo el día desde muy temprano, su platillo diario es el “caldo de gallina” mientras que los fines de semana la preferencia de su público es por el delicioso y rico “cebiche” y parrilladas. Lleva en este negocio más de 5 años, y realiza esta función con el apoyo de su hijo y su nuera. Desde que inició está actividad su economía a mejorado y por eso sigue con ese trabajo ya que le ha permitido orientar sus ganancias también a otras funciones como alquiler de cuartos y de mototaxi. Actualmente no se encuentra bien de salud es por eso que se dedicará únicamente al rubro de alquiler. Le agrada mucho su trabajo porque desarrolla sus dotes culinarios, pero sabe que esta es una etapa que ya está por culminar por su estado de salud, por ese motivo quiere orientar todas sus prioridades a actividades económicas que no le demanden mucho esfuerzo y continuar generando los ingresos que su familia necesita para estar tranquila. Este es el préstamo número 16 con la institución MFP, es por ello que agradece a todas las personas que le brindan la oportunidad de acceder a un crédito financiero para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por otro lado, comenta estar a gusto con su banco comunal pues conoce a sus integrantes y los considera personas responsables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, comprará algunos ingredientes que necesita para preparar la comida que pone a la venta, sin embargo la mayor parte del dinero invertirá en refaccionar su mototaxi para que funcione perfectamente.
texts.en:
Mirna, 56 years of age, is a hard-working and responsible woman.  She is a widow, and for this reason had to raise her two children alone.  They are now grown and financially independent, but live near her.  She has her own home, where she also takes in her grandchildren.  She works a great deal, as she would like to have a higher standard of living and be able to live out her senior years in peace.  Mirna’s work involves food sales.  She works in her house, generally at night, but on weekends can work all day and starts very early.  Her daily food staple is chicken soup, whereas on weekends the public prefers her delicious ceviche and grilled foods.  She has been in this business for more than 5 years, and carries out this work with the support of her son and daughter-in-law. Since she started this enterprise, her finances have been improving.  She continues with this work because it’s allowed her to use her earnings to carry out other activities such as room and rickshaw rentals.

She is currently not in good health, which is why she will dedicate herself only to the rentals business.  She very much enjoys her work because it uses her culinary skills, but she knows that she is at the stage where this will end because of her health.  For this reason, she wants to devote all her priorities to economic activities that won’t demand too much effort, yet continue to generate the income her family needs to live peacefully.  

This is her 16th loan with MFP.  She thanks all those people who have provided her the opportunity to access credit so she can finalize her plans.  She comments that she likes belonging to her cooperative bank as she knows all the members and considers them to be responsible and unified people.

With the 1,500 Peruvian soles requested, she will buy some ingredients necessary to prepare the food she sells.  However, she will invest the majority of the funds into repairing her rickshaw so that it works perfectly.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for preparing food, and also to send her vehicle to a mechanic.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa, de 42 años, es una mujer amable, solidaria y muy responsable, convive hace 25 años con Víctor con quien tiene cuatro hijos de 25, 20, 15 y 11 años de edad respectivamente, vive en su casa propia junto a ellos, trabaja mucho para poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a cada uno de los miembros de su familia. Rosa es una mujer que siempre ha trabajado para salir adelante, su actividad económica más importante se centra en la compra y venta de prendas de vestir como polos, pantalones, shorts, ropas interiores y lencería femenina, trabaja sola  y lleva en ésta actividad 5 años, inicialmente vendía solamente a sus amigos y familiares en su casa, pero ahora vende sus productos ofreciendo directamente a sus clientes pasando casa por casa y los vende a precios cómodos. Las prendas que vende son traídas de otra ciudad en donde compra al por mayor y luego son ofrecidas por unidad, se caracterizan por la calidad del material del que están hechos y por los diseños de vanguardia que se observan en cada uno de los modelos. Trabaja además eventualmente desde hace 7 años vendiendo dulces por las calles de la ciudad.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite decidir su horario de trabajo, puede manejar su tiempo y dedicarlo a diferentes actividades, considera que lo más difícil es que inicialmente tiene que movilizar buena cantidad de mercadería aunque esa carga disminuye mientras más rápido logra vender sus prendas en las casas que visita, a pesar de ello no se desanima y sigue adelante en su trabajo, espera tener una tienda de venta de ropa en donde pueda exhibir sus prendas y estar más tranquila. Este es el crédito número 1 con MFP, por tanto agradece a todos los que hacen posible su crédito para continuar con sus objetivos, ella por su parte se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual, está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos sus integrantes son personas muy amables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, comprará diferentes prenda de vestir principalmente polos, blusas y artículos de lencería que espera vender rápidamente.
texts.en: Rosa, 42 years old, is a nice woman, companionable, and very responsible.  She has lived with her partner Victor for the past 25 years with whom she has four children ages 25, 20, 15, and 11 respectively.  She lives in her own home along with them.  She works a lot to be able to provide every member of her family with a better quality of life.  Rosa is a woman who has always worked to get ahead.  Her most important economic activity centers around purchasing and selling clothing like polos, pants, shorts, underwear and women's lingerie.  She works alone and has been working in this field for five years.  She first sold only to friends and family in her home, but now she sells her products by offering them directly to her customers by going house to house and selling them at comfortable prices.  The clothing that she sells if brought from another city where she can buy it in bulk and then she sells the pieces individually.  They are characterized by the quality of the material from which they are made and by the vanguard designs that can be found in each model.  She also has worked for the past 7 years selling candies in the streets of her city.  What she likes best about her work is that it allows her to decide her own schedule.  She can manage her own time and dedicate herself to different activities.  She thinks that the most difficult thing is that initially she has to move a huge quantity of merchandise, although this burden diminishes the faster she is able to sell her clothing in the houses that she visits.  In spite of this challenge she does not get discouraged and she continues to move forward in her work.  She hopes to have a formal clothing store where she can exhibit her inventory and be more tranquil.  This is her first credit with MFP, and she thanks all of those who make her credit possible so that she can continue with her objectives.  She promises to comply with the loan payment requirements in a punctual manner.  She is very happy to belong to her communal bank since all of the members are very kind and supportive.  With the requested loan of 1500 soles (Peruvian currency), she will buy different items of clothing, principally polos, blouses, and lingerie that she hopes to sell quickly.

loans.use: to buy different items of clothing, principally polos, blouses, and lingerie that she hopes to sell quickly.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon, 63 years old, is a responsible mother who is engaged in a hog-raising business. She is married to Bartolome and has five adult children. At her age, Corazon still works hard to give her children a better quality of life by doing something that brings in additional income. She has been involved in buying and selling hogs for over five years and has extensive experience in this business. Corazon dreams of lifting her children and extended family out of poverty, and she also wants to provide the necessities for her hogs. Corazon wants to take out a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy feed, vaccine, and vitamins for her hogs. She hopes this will make them fit and nourished, and provide higher prices when it is time for them to be sold.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccine, and vitamins for her hogs

loans.name: Analie

texts.en: Analie, 42 years old, is married and has 5 children, 2 of whom are in school. For the past 9 years, Analie has operated a business raising pigs in the Philippines. She has previously borrowed 17 times from NWTF to sustain her business. Analie has requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. In the future, Analie would like to save enough to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Juvie

texts.en: Juvie lives in Malaubang, Ozamis City. For the past 3 years, she has provided transportation services to support her 3 children's needs. She earns a monthly income of PHP 5,000 from the business. For a 36-year old mother, there’s nothing that can make her more happy than seeing her children successful in their studies. Without hesitation, Juvie is borrowing PHP 8,000 from GDMPC microcredit to repair her transport vehicle. She joined GDMPC in 2008. Juvie's plan for the future is to hopefully improve her business.

loans.use: to repair her transport vehicle

loans.name: Marvin Gabriel

texts.es:
Marvín, necesita refinanciamiento para continuar trabajando, es por ello que está solicitando un préstamo para invertirlo en el cultivo de maíz, en la compra de abono y otros insumos como herbicidas e insecticidas para obtener una mejor cosecha libre de plagas.
Expresa que con el préstamo anterior tuvo muchos beneficios ya que le permitió crecer en la producción y sus ingresos; sus deseos es salir de la pobreza y mejorar su situación  económica continuan ya que el trabajo le permite generar el dinero necesario para cubrir las necesidades del hogar.
texts.en:
Marvín needs refinancing to continue working, which is why he is requesting a loan to invest in his corn cultivation enterprise.  He will invest in purchasing fertilizer and other supplies such as herbicides and insecticides to obtain a better crop that is free of plagues.

He states that the previous loan provided him with many benefits such as increasing his production and his income.  His wishes are to escape poverty and improve his financial situation, as his work allows him to generate income necessary to support his household.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, herbicides and insecticides.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra, de 26 años, es una mujer amable, buena y trabajadora, es soltera pero tiene un hijo de 2 años, todos los días ella trabaja mucho pues desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo y mejorar la economía de su familia, vive en su casa propia junto a su madre y hermanos. Sandra, tiene como actividad diaria la venta de abarrotes en su bodega instalada en la parte frontal de su vivienda, atiende todos los días desde muy temprano a sus clientes, ofrece a la venta artículos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, pan, huevos, leche, aceite, condimentos, accesorios de pasamanería entre otros. Lleva en este negocio por más de 4 años y le va muy bien, atiende con ayuda de su mamá o de su hermana. Por otra parte está desarrollando otra actividad laboral por la que siente gran afición desde hace muchos años que es la costura. Tiene mucha creatividad, sin embargo reconoce que aún está empezando en esta faceta y anhela implementar su taller de costura con todo lo que necesita para hacer un buen trabajo. Está contenta con sus actividades pues le dan los ingresos necesarios para solventar los gastos de su familia, además el contacto con el público es lo que le hace sentir muy bien todos los días, ahora espera que su tienda de abarrotes siga mejorando y del mismo modo su taller de costura continué en progreso por el bien de su familia. Este es el préstamo número 3 con MFP, por lo tanto agradece a todas las personas que siguen confiando en él para acceder nuevamente a este financiamiento que le ayudará a aumentar su capital de trabajo, sabe que nuevamente tendrá que ser muy responsable y sobre todo muy puntual, está contento de pertenecer su banco comunal ya que ve que son muy solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado 2000 soles, comprará los principales abarrotes de consumo diario que pone a la venta en su pequeña tienda , sin embargo dará prioridad a la compra de telas, hilos, agujas y todo lo necesario para implementar su taller de costura.
texts.en:
Sandra is 26 years old and is a kind, good and hard-working woman.  She is single but has a two-year-old son.  Every day she works hard because she wants to provide her son with a better quality of life and to improve the economic situation of her family.  She lives in her own home along with her mother and siblings.  Sandra works daily selling groceries in her store installed in the front part of her house.  She works every day from very early, offering her customers basic needs items like rice, sugar, bread, eggs, milk, oil, condiments, braiding accessories, etc.  She has been working in this field for four years and it is going well.  Her mother and her sister help her.  

In addition, she is developing another labor activity for which she has felt a great passion for many years, which is sewing.  She is very creative, but she recognizes that she is just beginning in this field and she hopes to supply her sewing shop with everything necessary in order to do good work.  She is happy with her activities since they provide necessary income in order to meet family expenses.  Also, the contact with the public is what makes her feel good every day.  Now she hopes that her grocery store will continue improving and similarly that her sewing shop will continue to progress for the good of her family.  

This is her third loan with MFP, and she is thankful to all of the people who continue supporting the organization so that she can access once again this financing which will help her increase her working capital.  She knows that she once again will have to be very responsible and above all punctual.  She is happy to belong to the communal bank since she sees that the members are very supportive.

With the requested loan of 2000 soles (Peruvian currency), she will buy some of the basic groceries of daily consumption that she sells in her small store.  However, she will give priority to the purchase of fabrics, thread, needles, and all the necessary items to supply her sewing shop.

loans.use: To purchase fabric, thread and needles.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en: Narcisa, 41 years old, is married and has 5 children. For the past 12 years, Narcisa has earned a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from a restaurant. Narcisa is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Rodegelin

texts.en: Rodegelin, 29 years old, is married and has one child. She works hard to provide for her family. For the past 12 years, Rodegelin has run a direct sales business in the Philippines. She also earns an income from electronic re-loading. Rodegelin has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell. Rodegelin has previously borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Sybel Mary

texts.en: Sybel Mary, 31 years old, is married, and she works hard to provide for her family. Sybel Mary has run a general store in the Philippines for 3 years. She also earns an income from fishing. Sybel Mary has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell. Sybel Mary has previously borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF. She hopes to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is 53 and has three adult children. She helps her husband in managing their water sales business. They offer water in their community and are one of the top performance water dealers in the area. Through their strong determination and perseverance, they make their business profitable, and their income is sufficient to satisfy their needs and finance their children's education.

Amalia and her husband aim to continue and improve the business because they have more customers who keep on ordering from them. Due to inadequate capital, Amalia is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy water gallons and to maintain their equipment. They believe that the loan will help them make more gallons of water and earn more income. They are hoping that they will make their business grow and have a bright future.

loans.use: to buy water gallons and to maintain their equipment

loans.name: Mila Luna

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Mila Luna works hard to support her family. She has a printing press business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from selling food. Mila Luna is borrowing 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy additional equipment for her printing press business.

Mila Luna has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional equipment for her printing press business

loans.name: Dame

texts.fr:
Etant le plus débrouillard d’une grande famille, Dame est un jeune agriculteur qui a une expérience de plus de 15 ans dans ce métier .Il se lève à 5 h du matin, pour terminer sa journée à 18 h du soir. Il fait du maraichage et vient solliciter l’appui de l’IMCEC  pour un crédit de 200000F CFA  avec quoi il pourra s’acheter 6 pots de semences chou, 6 sacs d’engrais et 50 sacs de fumier.     
Vivant dans une grande famille, la dépense est partagée entre les membres de cette dernière qui ont des revenus.
Il envisage d’appuyer son frère chauffeur qui ne fait rien présentement en lui achetant un véhicule de transport afin qu’il puisse aussi aider à la dépense quotidienne. M ais pour cela, s’il a le soutien d’une institution financière comme l’IMCEC.
texts.en:
The most resourceful member of a large family, Dame is a young farmer with more than 15 years of experience in the business. He wakes up at 5 AM and ends his day at 6 PM. He is in the business of small-scale truck farming, and is requesting support from IMCEC for a loan of 200000 francs CFA, with which he will purchase 6 jars of cabbage seeds, 6 bags of fertilizer, and 50 bags of manure.

As Dame is part of a large family, the family expenses are shared by the family members who have income. Dame plans to support his brother, a driver, who is currently unemployed by buying him a vehicle for transportation so that he too can help out with the daily expenses. In order to do this, however, he needs the support of a financial organization like IMCEC.

loans.use: to purchase 6 jars of cabbage seeds, 6 bags of fertilizer, and 50 bags of manure

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy new fishing materials for her fishing/fish vending business.

Vilma has been in this business for seven years. Vilma earns more income from selling dried fish.

Vilma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy new fishing materials

loans.name: Lagon Group

texts.fr:
Mme Y.CHANTAL est  responsable du groupe LAGON. Mariée, elle est mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 13ans et le moins âgé a 04ans. 02 vont à l’école et elle a 04 personnes en charge.

Mme vend des gâteaux  depuis 09 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans une boutique au secteur 17. Ses clients sont les amis, les voisins et les boutiques (gérant de boutique).

Elle veut s’acheter  un sac de sucre, un sac de farine de blé et un bidon d’huile de 20l.

Avec ses économies, elle veut améliorer son activité. Mme ambitionne épargner et aider son mari pour la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Chantal is the leader of the Lagon group. She is married and the mother of two children. Her oldest child is 13 years old, and the youngest is 4 years old. Both her children attend school and she has 4 other people in her care. Chantal has sold cakes for 9 years. She stocks up in a boutique in Sector 17 of the city.

Chantal's customers are friends, neighbors, and shops (store managers). She wants to purchase a bag of sugar, a bag of wheat flour, and a 20L drum of oil. With her savings, Chantal wants to improve her business. Her goal is to save and to help her husband with the schooling of their children.

loans.use: to purchase a bag of sugar, a bag of flour, and a 20L drum of oil.

loans.name: Yanina

texts.es:
Yanina tiene 27 años, convive con Osvaldo, con quien tiene 2 hijos de 11 y 7 años. Esta familia vive, por ahora, en una casa alquilada. Yanina es una madre dulce y una mujer empeñosa. Gracias a su hermana 
Yanina aprendió de sus hermanas el comercio de ropa. Por esa razón viaja constantemente a la ciudad de Lima, donde adquiere su mercadería por docenas y cientos. 
En esta actividad lleva como 5 años, y le agrada el ritmo de trabajo. Viaja cada quincena hasta las tiendas de los mismos confeccionistas, y obtiene prendas como: pantalones, chompas, casacas, polos, etc., pues sus clientes le hacen cada vez más pedidos. Sus ventas las realiza de manera ambulatoria, en cada feria de la ciudad de Tarma, (jueves y domingos), y obtiene buenas ganancias gracias a los clientes fijos que captó en todos sus años como vendedora. Ella tiene planes para más adelante, uno de ellos es construir su casa en la ciudad de Tarma, para ello seguirá trabajando como lo hace ahora. Éste es su crédito número 4 con MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las mensualidades. Le gusta trabajar dentro de su banco comunal “Mirando un futuro mejor”, porque le agradan las reuniones y charlas educativas.
Yanina destinará todo el dinero en la compra de ropa, que supone terminará de vender en todo el mes.
texts.en:
Yanina is 27 years old and lives with her partner, Osvaldo, and two children, ages 11 and 7.  For now, the family is living in a rented house.  Yanina is a gentle mother and a determined woman, thanks to her sister.  Yanina learned the clothing business from her sisters.  For this reason, she travels regularly to Lima, where she acquires merchandise by dozens and hundreds.

She has been engaged in this business for five years, and she enjoys the work pace.  Every fifteen days, she travels to the same clothing manufacturers’ stores and purchases garments such as pants, sweaters, dress coats, polo-neck shirts, and other items because her customers are placing more orders all the time.  She sells her merchandise as a street vendor at the markets in the city of Tarma (Thursdays and Sundays), and earns good profits thanks to the regular customers that she has attracted throughout her years as a salesperson.  She has plans for the future.  One of them is to build a house in Tarma, and for this, she will continue working as she does now.  This is her fourth loan with MFP and she pledges to be punctual with her monthly payments.  She likes working in her communal bank, “Mirando un futuro Mejor” (Looking to a Better Future), because she enjoys the meetings and the educational talks.  Yanina will use the entire amount of the loan to purchase clothing that she hopes to sell out by the end of the month.

loans.use: to purchase clothing.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia, de 50 años, es una mujer muy dinámica y trabajadora, convive con Jorge con quien tiene 3 hijos que ya son mayores, tiene una casa propia que la comparte con dos de sus hijas, dos nietos y su pareja, juntos ponen el mayor esfuerzo para conseguir un mejor nivel de vida. El trabajo de Sonia consiste en la venta de ropas, zapatos y lencería, realiza esta función vendiendo a crédito entre sus amigas, vecinas y familiares a quienes cobra de manera semanal o mensual. Por lo general todos los productos que vende son por pedidos específicos de sus clientes. Lleva en este trabajo más de 22 años, le va bien hasta ahora y tiene la ayuda de su pareja y sus dos hijas. Cuando se inició en éste negocio estaba llena de dudas e inseguridades, pero siempre fue de carácter fuerte y decidida, sin embargo poco a poco fue aprendiendo y ahora se volvió una excelente comerciante. Le gusta su trabajo porque puede generar su propia fuente de ingresos y porque además comparte esta actividad junto a su cónyuge y porque además tiene el tiempo necesario para cumplir con sus funciones de ama de casa, tiene muchos planes a futuro entre ellos desea establecer un local donde pueda exhibir adecuadamente todos lo que ofrece a la venta y atender de manera mas cómoda a todos sus clientes. Este es el crédito número 18 con MFP, por tanto agradece a todos los que hacen posible su crédito para continuar con sus objetivos, ella por su parte se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual, está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos sus integrantes son personas muy amables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará prendas de vestir, sandalias y lencería femenina de diversos diseños y de gran calidad.
texts.en:
Sonia, who is 50 years old, is a dynamic and hard-working woman. She lives with her partner, Jorge, with whom she has three children who are already adults. She has her own house, which she shares with two of her daughters, two grandchildren, and her partner. Together they exert their best efforts to achieve a better level of living. Sonia's work consists of selling clothing, shoes, and lingerie. She carries out her business selling on credit among her friends, neighbors, and family members, from whom she collects on a weekly or monthly basis. In general, all the products she sells are by specific orders from her customers. She has been in this business for more than 22 years. It has gone well for her so far, and she has the support of her partner and her two daughters. When she began this business, she was full of doubts and insecurities, but she has always been of strong and determined character. Nevertheless, she learned little by little, and now she has become an excellent businesswoman. She likes her work because she can generate her own source of income, in addition because she shares this work with her partner, and because she also has the necessary time to fulfill her responsibilities as a homemaker. She has many plans for the future. Among them, she wants to establish a shop where she can appropriately display everything that she offers for sale and serve her customers in a more comfortable way. This is her 18th loan from MFP, and so she is grateful to all those who make her loan possible so that she can continue with her goals. On her part, she promises to make her loan payments in a punctual manner. She is very happy to belong to her communal bank, since all its members are very friendly and united.

With the 1000 PEN that she has applied for, she will buy articles of clothing, sandals, and women's lingerie of various styles and of good quality.

loans.use: to buy articles of clothing, shoes, and women's lingerie to sell

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra is 50 years old and married with ten children.

Alejandra works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

Alejandra has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Alejandra aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more items like bags, pants, t-shirts and other ready-to-wear clothing for her clothing sales business.

Lolita has been in this business for three years. Lolita earns more income from raising pigs.

Lolita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more items like bags, pants, t-shirts and other ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Salome

texts.es: La socia es la señora Salome, ahora tiene 50 años de edad, casada con 3 hijos, vive en la provincia de Urubamba, la socia continua con su actividad comercial de venta de granos, cereales  y menestras como trigo, frejoles y quinua. Salome se ha mantenido trabajando en esta actividad comercial, la cual le ha permitido sacar adelante y poder educar a sus hijos, La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería como quinua, trigo, lentejas etc. para poder capitalizar su comercio, por ello la socia está muy agradecida con KIVA, por ayudarla a desarrollarse en su trabajo, la socia se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente. Salome pertenece al banco comunal “San Jose de Urubamba” de la provincia de Urubamba del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en: This communal bank member is Señora Salome. She is now 50 years old. She is married and has 3 children. She lives in the province of Urubamba. She continues with her commercial activity of selling grains, corn, and beans, such as wheat, kidney beans, and quinoa. Salome has continued working in this commercial activity, which has allowed her to raise and educate her children. She is applying for the loan to buy merchandise such as quinoa, wheat, lentils, etc., to capitalize her business. For this, she is very thankful to Kiva, for helping her to develop in her work. She promises to make her loan payments on time. Salome belongs to the communal bank "San Jose de Urubamba" in the province of Urubamba del Cusco -- Peru.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as quinoa, wheat, and lentils

loans.name: Giovana Lizette

texts.es: La Sra. Giovana tiene 27 años,  es una persona muy emprendedora que desde sus siete años comenzó a trabajar ayudando a su mamá en la venta de refrescos, con el tiempo se hizo cargo del negocio de su mamá vendiendo api con pastel y/o con buñuelo, anteriormente trabajó en el grupo solidario manos unidas donde comenzó con un monto mínimo, hace tres años trabaja con crédito individual demostrando puntualidad en sus pagos, también Giovana tiene un puesto en la feria de navidad en la ciudad de la paz donde tiene ingresos adicionales, actualmente trabaja por las tardes en su negocio y por las mañanas estudia en la universidad , ella quiere independizarse totalmente y lograr que su mamá ya no trabaje, vive en casa de su mamá y le ayuda en los gastos familiares, el crédito que solicita ahora en emprender es para devolver el anticrético de su domicilio ya que cumplió su contrato y quieren devolver el anticrético para poder dar en alquiler los ambientes.
texts.en: Ms. Giovana is a very enterprising woman who began working at the age of seven helping her mother sell soft drinks. With time she took over responsibility for her mother's business selling "api" (Andean breakfast drink) with cakes and pastry. Previously she worked with the Manos Unidas communal bank where she began with a minimal amount. For two years she has been working with an individual loan, demonstrating her ability to make payments on time. Giovana also has a stall at the Christmas Fair in the the city of La Paz where she can make additional income. Now she works in the afternoon and studies at the university in the morning. She wants to become totally independent and help her mother retire. She lives with her mother and helps out with household expenses. With the loan she is asking for, Giovana will be able to return the "anticrético" money to her tenants, because their contract has been  fulfilled, and she would like to be able to rent out her property instead. (An "anticrético" is a housing arrangement that is fairly common in Bolivia, in which tenants pay a large amount of money up front rather than paying rent monthly. The property owner can use the money during the contract period, but must return all the money to the tenants when the contract has been completed. For more information: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anticr%C3%A9tico)

loans.use: to return the "anticrético" funds on her property to her tenants

loans.name: Juana Del Rosario

texts.es:
Juana es una mujer de 35 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Santiago con sus 2 hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, lastimosamente por diversas razones Juana se separó de su pareja, desde entonces ella dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia, ella no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Enfermería que deseaba, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver noticieros y programas informativos en televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina unos riquísimos Chicharrones para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño, dedicación y gracias al apoyo de su Madre, Juana puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de verduras y tubérculos, ella trabaja diariamente un aproximado de 8 horas y puede atender a un promedio de 30 clientes, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio por sus buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes. 
Juana se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mercadería, tales como: zapallo, limón, papa, tomate, lechuga y demás verduras; de esta manera Juana tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido, con ello, ella espera poder aumentar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda adquirir un local propio para su negocio y así desea lograr su gran sueño de ver a sus hijos convertidos en buenos profesionales y en hombres de bien.
texts.en:
Juana is a 35 year-old woman who lives with her 2 children in the city of Ica in the Santiago district.  She loves her children, and they are her main reason for living.  Sadly, for a number of reasons, Juana separated from her partner.  Ever since, she has dedicated all of her efforts to get ahead with her family.  Juana was not able to study for the nursing degree that she desired, but she would have liked to have been able to do that.  In her free time, she enjoys watching the news and other informative programs on the TV, and at times she cooks the rich "chicharrones" dish (fried pork) to share with her family.

With a lot of effort and dedication, and thanks to the support of her mother, Juana started up her own small business selling vegetables and tubers.  She works daily for about 8 hours, and during this time she serves about 30 customers.  She believes that her business is doing well because of her good prices and because of the kind treatment she provides to her customers.

Juana is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, because thanks to the help they are providing, she will be able to purchase merchandise such as: pumpkins, limes, potatoes, tomatoes, lettuce, and other vegetables.  In this way, Juana will be better able to stock up her business, and with this extra merchandise she hopes to be able to increase her sales and her earnings.  This will help her to acquire her own store in the near future, so that she can realize her greatest dream, which is to see her children become good professionals and good men.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, including vegetables and tubers

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria works hard to support her family. Maria is married and has a clothing sales business in the Philippines.

Maria requested a 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase ready-to-wear clothing to sell to customers.

Maria has been in this business for five years now, and also earns additional income from farming vegetables.

In the future, Maria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ready-to-wear clothing to sell to customers.

loans.name: Nonvignon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe NONVIGNON est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Ablavi Félicia, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Ablavi Félicia est âgée de 46 ans et est mariée à un certain Anatole. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charges. Le couple vit ensemble avec leurs enfants et subvient ensemble aux divers besoins de la famille. Ablavi Félicia a peu fréquenté l’école. Il y a près d’une trentaine d’année que Ablavi Félicia exerce comme activité, la vente des poissons et de la pâte (faite à base de l'amidon du maïs) dans son quartier ; ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Ablavi Félicia désire renforcer et diversifier son activité. Pour ce faire, Ablavi Félicia sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe NONVIGNON, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur reçu a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The Nonvignon group is made up of three people who live in the same neighborhood of Benin. The leader of the group, named Ablavi Félicia, is the one with her hand raised in the photo.

This is the second time that this group is requesting financial support from ALIDé in order to raise the level of their business. Ablavi Félicia is 46 years old and married to Anatole. The couple has three children, all of whom attend school and are their dependents. The couple lives together with their children and they jointly provide for the various needs of the family.

Ablavi Félicia did not receive very much schooling. It has been almost 30 years that she has conducted her business, selling fish and dough (made from a base of corn starch) in her neighborhood. This allows her to meet the needs of her family without much difficulty. 

In order to help meet the requirements of her customers, Ablavi Félicia wants to strengthen and diversify her business. In order to do this, she is requesting, together with the other members of the Nonvignon group, a second loan from ALIDé. The first loan was fully repaid.

loans.use: to purchase fish, condiments, and corn.

loans.name: Yelian Group

texts.fr: YELIAN est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres exercent les mêmes activités au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Hortense (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 60 ans et est une veuve. Hortense est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés, dont deux restent à sa charge. Hortense vit seule avec ses enfants et assure seule ses diverses charges. Hortense a peu fréquenté l’école. Il y a près de dix neuf ans que Hortense mène comme activité la vente des céréales (maïs, farine de cossette) à son domicile. Hortense mène cette activité afin de pouvoir à ses besoins ainsi qu’à ceux de ses enfants. Hortense s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Hortense sollicite un premier crédit avec les membres du groupe YELIAN. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
Yelian is a group of three people, whose members are engaged in the same business in Benin. The leader of the group, Hortense (with her hand raised in the photo) is 60 years old and is a widow.

Hortense is the mother of four children, all of whom attend school, and two of whom are still in her care. She lives alone with her children and is solely responsible for their various needs.

Hortense did not receive much schooling. For almost 19 years, she has been in the business of selling grains (corn, cassava flour) from her home. Hortense conducts this business in order to provide for both her needs and those of her children. She stocks up in a region of Benin. 

In order to meet her customers' needs, Hortense is requesting her first loan with the members of the Yelian group. This loan will help them to better respond to their customers' needs and to earn more profit.

loans.use: to purchase grains (corn, cassava flour)

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos, de 38 años, es un hombre bueno y trabajador, está casado y tiene cuatro hijos de 11, 5, 3 y 2 meses de edad, trabaja mucho pues desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia a quienes protege y cuida en su casa propia que pudo construir en el terreno que su padre le regaló. El trabajo de Carlos consiste en el transporte de pasajeros dentro y fuera de la ciudad, está siempre presto para movilizar a cualquier cliente que desea llegar sano y salvo a su destino pues una de sus virtudes es ser muy cuidadoso y protector. Lleva realizado éste trabajo por 15 años. Le gusta su trabajo pues le permite tener tiempo para estar a lado de su familia, además de poder movilizar a sus hijos a la escuela y a diferentes partes que necesiten, recuerda que empezó con éste trabajo muy joven y poco a poco fue ganando experiencia gracias a los días de trabajo que a veces se tornan muy incómodos cuando el sol está muy fuerte o cuando las lluvias son tantas que inundan algunas partes de la ciudad, espera seguir trabajando y fiel a su estilo seguir aportando a su familia la tranquilidad de poder crecer. Este es el préstamo número 4 con la institución MFP. Es por eso que agradece a quienes hacen posible este financiamiento que le ayudará a cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, comenta sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal, pues conoce a sus integrantes y los considera personas responsables y solidarias. Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, comprará algunas piezas y repuestos para su mototaxi, además de regularizar sus documentos ya que están a punto de vencer.
texts.en: Carlos, who is 38 years old, is a good man and worker. He is married and has four children, ages 11, 5, 3, and 2 months old. He works a lot, since he wants to offer a better quality of life to his family, whom he protects and cares for in his own house, which he was able to build on land that his father gave him. Carlos' work consists of transporting passengers within and outside of the city. He is always ready to transport any customer who wants to arrive safe and sound at his destination, since one of his virtues is being very careful and protective. He has been doing this work for 15 years. He likes his work since it allows him to have time to be at the side of his family, in addition to being able to drive his children to school and to the different places they need to go. He remembers that he began this work when he was very young, and little by little he gained experience, thanks to the days of work that at times became very uncomfortable when the sun was very strong or when there was so much rain that some parts of the city flooded. He hopes to continue working and, true to his style, continue bringing his family the tranquility to be able to grow. This is his 4th loan with the MFP institution. It is for this reason that he is thankful to those who make possible this financing that will help him to meet his goals. On his part, he comments that he feels comfortable in his communal bank, since he knows its members and considers them responsible and united people. With the 1500 PEN he has applied for, he will buy some parts and make some repairs on his mototaxi, in addition to regularizing his documents, since they are about to expire.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and regularize his driver's license.

loans.name: Muhayo

texts.ru: Мухайё  женщина в возрасте  43 лет, замужем, имеет четверых детей. Её муж работает мастером по ремонту телевизоров на дому,доход получаемый от своего дела он тратит на семейные расходы.Сама  Мухайё продает на рынке женскую одежду, за товаром ездит  в другой город  раз в месяц.У Мухайе очень много планов на будущее и чтобы осуществить свои надежды она трудиться день и ночь. На очередной кредит она хочет купить  осенне- зимний ассортимент женской  одежды.
texts.en: Muhayo is 43 years old, married, and has four children.  Her husband is a television repair man who makes house calls.  He spends all his income on family expenses.  Muhayo travels to another city once a month for the women's clothing she sells at the market.  Muhayo has many plans for the future, and she works day and night in order to bring them to life.  With this, her most recent loan, Muhayo wants to buy an assortment of women's clothes for fall and winter.

loans.use: to buy women's clothing

loans.name: Zoewendyelle Group

texts.fr:
Mme TANNOAGA est  responsable du groupe ZOEWENDYELLE. Mariée, elle est mère de 08 enfants. Le plus âgé a 40ans et le moins âgé a 23ans. Personne ne va à l’école et elle a 06 personnes en charge.

Mme fait la restauration depuis 05 ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de la cité AN III. Ses clients sont les hommes et femmes.

Elle veut s’acheter  10 plats d’haricot, 10 plats de petits mil et 10 plats de lentille pour sa cuisine.

Avec ses économies, elle veut améliorer son activité et épargné. Mme ambitionne compte tenu de son âge ouvrir une boutique pour pouvoir rester sur place.
texts.en:
Mrs. TANNOAGA is the leader of the ZOEWENDYELLE group.  She is married and the mother of 8 children.  The oldest is 40 and the youngest is 23.  None of them attend school and she has six people in her care. 

Mrs. Tannoaga has been in the food service business for five years. She gets her supplies at the market in the cité AN III.  Her customers are men and women.  

She wants to buy 10 flats of beans, 10 flats of millet, and 10 flats of lentils for cooking.  With her savings, she wants to increase her business activity and her savings.  In consideration of her age, her goal is to open a restaurant in order to be able to stay in one place.

loans.use: to buy 10 flats of beans, 10 flats of millet, and 10 flats of lentils for cooking.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma, de 42, es una mujer alegre, amable y carismática, convive con su pareja desde hace varios años, es madre de cuatro hijos que ya son mayores, vive en casa de su mamá junto a su pareja y otras seis personas más, trabaja mucho pues desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.


El trabajo de Vilma consiste en la venta de abarrotes. Tiene un pequeño puesto de venta en la vereda de su casa en donde pone a la venta diversos artículos de primera necesidad como arroz, sal, azúcar, aceite, huevos, diferentes verduras, tubérculos y condimentos. Trabaja en este oficio más de 2 años. Le ayuda en la atención su hermana y su mamá. Complementa esta labor con el alquiler de 2 mototaxis propios y con la venta de ropa que ofrece quincenalmente en zonas alejadas de la ciudad.  Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que es muy relajado ya que no precisa ejercer ninguna función que requiera esfuerzo, en el caso de venta de ropa la única dificultad que encuentra son las largas horas de viaje que tiene que emprender hasta llegar a su destino. A pesar de todo ello está muy tranquila porque todas sus funciones laborales le brindan el dinero necesario para sobrellevar sus gastos personales y familiares. Este es el préstamo número 3 con MFP, por lo tanto agradece a todas las personas que siguen confiando en él para acceder nuevamente a este financiamiento que le ayudará a aumentar su capital de trabajo, sabe que nuevamente tendrá que ser muy responsable y sobre todo muy puntual, está contento de pertenecer su banco comunal ya que ve que son muy solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará abarrotes y algunas prendas de vestir que necesita para continuar su negocio, además realizará el tapizado de uno de sus mototaxis que se encuentra en mal estado.
texts.en:
Vilma, 42, is a happy, friendly and charismatic woman. She lives with her partner of many years and is a mother of four grown children. She and her partner live in her mother's home, along with 6 other people. She works a lot because she wants to give her family a better quality of life.

Vilma sells groceries. She has a small stall on the sidewalk of her house where she sells diverse articles of basic necessity like rice, salt, sugar, oil, eggs, different vegetables, tubers and condiments. She has been doing this for more than two years. Her mother and sister help her. To complement this work, she owns 2 mototaxis that she rents out, and she also sells clothing semimonthly in far-away parts of the city. What she likes most about her work is that it's very relaxed since she doesn't have to do anything particularly difficult - in the case of selling clothing, the only difficulty is the long hours of travel that she needs to get to her destination. In spite of everything she is very calm because all of her work gives her the money she needs to cover her personal and familial expenses. 

This is her 3rd loan with MFP and she thanks all the people that continue trusting in her so that she can get this new loan that will help her to increase her wok capital. She knows that once again she will have to be very responsible and, above all, punctual. She is happy to belong to the village bank because they are very united. 

With the requested 1000 soles she will buy groceries and some clothing that she needs to continue her business, as well as to upholster one of her mototaxis that is in bad shape.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store, like clothing and groceries.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a trisikad transportation business in the Philippines.  

She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy an additional trisikad for her business.

NWTF is relisting Susana's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy an additional trisikad for her business.

loans.name: Marjul Carmel

texts.en:
Marjul Carmel lives in Carmen Annex, Ozamis City. She has earned money through proving transportation services for three years, so as to support the needs of her child. She gets an income of PHP 4,000 a month for this business. For a 21-year-old mother, there’s nothing more that can make her happy except to see her family in good living conditions. 

Without hesitation, Marjul Carmel seeks to borrows PHP 11,000 from GDMPC microcredit to repair the transport vehicle used in her business. 

She joined GDMPC last 2011. Her plan in the future is to hopefully improve her business.

loans.use: to repair the rickshaw vehicle used in her business.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Delia works hard to support her family.

She has a sugar cane farm business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from pig fattening. Delia is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers for her farm and feed for her pigs.

Delia has sustained her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to buy more farm lands.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farm and feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Chynar

texts.ru:
Чынар 51 год, воспитывает 3 детей. Чынар работает преподавателем в местной школе  и в качестве дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, на протяжении  16 лет занимается полеводством  и животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 15,000 сом (KGS ). Благодаря упорному труду Чынар в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется 2 дойные коровы с приплодом, 20 голов мелкого рогатого скота, ежемесячная прибыль от хозяйства составляет около 9,000 сом (KGS). Также Чынар обрабатывает 2 га земли, где выращивает люцерну и эспарцет, служащие кормом для скота.
