В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Чынар обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку скота для откорма и перепродажи.  Доходы от кредита Чынар планирует вкладывать в развитие бизнеса посредством закупа дополнительных голов скота.
texts.en: Chynar is 51 years old and is raising three children. She works as a teacher at the local school. To supplement her family's income, for 16 years she has been raising animals and growing crops, having started her business with 15,000 Kyrgyz soms (KGS). Thanks to her hard work, Chynar now has 2 milk cows with calves, 20 head of sheep and goats, and a monthly profit of around 9,000 KGS. Chynar also works 2 hectares of land, where she grows alfalfa and esparcet to feed her animals. WIth the goal of further developing her business, Chynar applied to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 100,000 KGS to buy livestock for fattening and resale. She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into her business by purchasing additional livestock.

loans.use: to purchase cattle for fattening and resale

loans.name: Komil

texts.ru: Комил,пунктуальный,трудолюбивый,ответственный мужчина в возрасте 52 года,женат,на воспитании имеет 5 детей.  Он преподает в  школе уже 27 лет. Для улучшения условия жизни своих детей Комил в 1990 гаду начал выращивать сельскохозяйственные продукты,а также откармливать скот. А на полученные доходы он построил уютный дом и дал образования  своим детям, а также женил сына и выдал дочку замуж.  Теперь Комил планирует увеличить поголовье скота и расширить свой  бизнес. На полученный кредит он хочет приобрести несколько голов скота.
texts.en: Komil is a punctual, hardworking, responsible man. He is 52 years old and married with five children. He has been a schoolteacher for 27 years. To improve his children's living conditions, in 1990 Komil started growing crops and raising livestock. Using his earnings, he built a comfortable house, educated his children, and married off his son and his daughter. Now Komil plans to increase the number of animals he owns and expand his business. He would like to use his loan to purchase a few head of cattle.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Sarsekhan

texts.ru:
Сарсехан 52 года, воспитала 3 детей. Сарсехан в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, занимается полеводством  и животноводством, начав этот бизнес 4 года назад  с суммы в 10,000 сом (KGS ). Благодаря упорному труду Сарсехан в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется 2 дойных коров с приплодом, 1 лошадь, ежемесячная прибыль от хозяйства составляет около 15,000 сом (KGS). Также Сарсехан обрабатывает 3,30 га земли, где выращивает ячмень, картофель, пшеницу и клевер, который служит кормом для скота. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Сарсехан обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку овец для откорма и перепродажи.  Доходы от кредита Сарсехан планирует вкладывать в развитие бизнеса, а в этом году хотела бы провести капитальный ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Sarsekhan is 52 years old and has raised three children.  Sarsekhan farms and raises livestock as her family's main source of income.  She started this business four years ago with 10,000 som (KGS) and thanks to her hard work, Sarsekhan now has two milk cows and their offspring, and one horse.  Her monthly income from her business is about 15,000 som (KGS). 

Sarsekhan also has 3.3 HA of land where she raises barley, potatoes, wheat, and clover, which serve as feed for her cattle.  

With the goal of further developing her business, Sarsekhan applied to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of sheep, which she will fatten and sell.  Sarsekhan is planning to invest the income from her loan in the development of her business.  This year, she would like to perform a major remodel of her home.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Steffanie

texts.es:
Steffanie, de 22 años, es una mujer emprendedora y muy joven, es soltera y aún no es madre,  vive en casa de sus padres junto a ellos, su sobrino y su hermana, ella trabaja mucho pues desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus padres y asegurar su economía. El trabajo de Steffanie consiste en la venta de ropa, vende sus productos entres sus amigos de su barrio, familiares y compañeros de trabajo, ofrece artículos de buena marca, con diseños innovadores pero sobre todo de muy buena calidad, siempre brinda productos a precios cómodos y además da las mejores facilidades de pago. Lleva en este trabajo cerca de 3 años y lo realiza con el apoyo de su madre y de su hermana. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es su independencia ya que le permite tener tiempo y espacio suficiente para desarrollar otra actividad laboral en un conocido local de venta de combustibles de la ciudad y lo hace sin descuidar sus ingresos con los que apoya a su familia, asegura que su negocio es rentable por que obtiene buenas ganancias, tiene muchos planes y sueños por cumplir, pero por ahora desea con muchas ganas tener su propia tienda o un local en donde  pueda exhibir y vender sus prendas con mayor comodidad. Este es el préstamo número 3 con la institución MFP. Se siente contenta de saber que le brindan el acceso a una línea de crédito para avanzar con su negocio. Por eso se compromete a ser responsable con el pago de sus cuotas para continuar en el futuro. Asegura que le gusta el trabajo de su banco comunal pues lo considera un grupo responsable  y unido.
Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará mayor cantidad de prendas de vestir ya que desea ofrecer mejores diseños y modelos innovadores que es lo que siempre la caracterizó.
texts.en:
Steffanie is a young, hard-working 22 year old woman. She is single, does not have any children, and lives with her parents, sister, and nephew. She works long hours because she wants to be able to give her parents a better quality of life and to achieve financial security. Steffanie's business is clothing sales. She sells her products to her friends in the neighborhood, relatives, and co-workers. The clothes she sells are from good brands and are of innovative designs, but most importantly are very high quality. She always offers good prices and the best payment terms. Steffanie has worked in this business for around 3 years, along with the help of her mother and sister. Steffanie likes that her job gives her independence, and allows her the time and space to also have a job selling fuel at a popular spot in the city without negatively affecting the earnings that she uses to support her family.

Steffanie's clothing business is profitable because she has good earnings, and she has a lot of plans and dreams to achieve. Right now, she would most like to have her own store or shop in which she can more comfortably show and sell her garments. This is Steffanie's 3rd loan with the MFP Institution. She feels happy to know that she has access to a line of credit that can help her move her business forward, and therefore promises to be responsible with her payments so that she can continue in the future. She says that she likes working with the community bank because they are a responsible and united group. With the 1000 soles she is asking for, Steffanie will buy a large quantity of garments because she wants to offer better designs and innovative styles, which has always characterized her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell.

loans.name: Deodilyn

texts.en:
Deodilyn is 35 years old and married, with one child, who is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Deodilyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Deodilyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Deodilyn has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Deodilyn would like to save enough to expand her business and continue to send her child to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en:
Annaliza is 42 years old and married. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Annaliza has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Annaliza has requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Annaliza has been in this business for 16 years. In the future, Annaliza would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a responsible housewife who owns and manages a variety store to help and increase her husband's income. She is now 38 years old and has three school-age children. 

Because of the high cost of commodities and school costs, she wants to improve her business and increase her income to satisfy their necessities and support the education of their children. 

Nancy wants to ask for additional capital of 12,000 PHP to buy canned goods, soft drinks, and spices to sell in her variety store. In the future, she is hoping that she will make her business grow up, and her children will have a bright future.

loans.use: To buy canned good, soft drinks, and spices.

loans.name: Zulaika

texts.ru:
Зулайке 37 лет, воспитывает 4 детей. Зулайка в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, на протяжении  16 лет занимается полеводством  и животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 5,000 сом (KGS ). Благодаря упорному труду Зулайки в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется 2 дойные коровы с приплодом, 17 голов мелкого рогатого скота, ежемесячная прибыль от хозяйства составляет около 6,000 сом (KGS). Также Зулайка обрабатывает 7 га земли, где выращивает люцерну и эспарцет, служащие кормом для скота. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Зулайка обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку скота для откорма и перепродажи.  Доходы от кредита Зулайка планирует вкладывать в развитие бизнеса, чтобы иметь возможность в будущем оплатить обучение детей.
texts.en: Zulaika is 37 years old and is raising four children. As the main source of income for her family, for 16 years Zulaika has been growing crops and raising livestock. She started her business with 5,000 Kyrgyz soms (KGS). Thanks to her hard work, today Zulaika has two milk cows with calves, 17 head of sheep and goats, and a monthly profit of around 6,000 KGS. She also works 7 hectares of land, where she grows alfalfa and esparcet to feed the animals. WIth the goal of further developing her business, Zulaika applied to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 70,000 KGS to buy cattle for fattening and resale. She plans to invest the earnings from the loan back into the business, so that in the future she can pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy three sacks of compost and improved seed.

loans.name: Lodina

texts.en:
Lodina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a souvenir shop business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell in her business.

NWTF is relisting Lodina's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her souvenir shop.

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.ru: Шахноза жительница города Исфары. Ей 21 год. Она разведена. Живет с матерью. Ее мать работает в школе.  Шахноза сама занимается шитьем. Она более четырех лет занимается шитьем платьев. Шахноза берет заказы дома. Она просит кредит для приобретения швейной машинки.
texts.en: Shahnoza is a resident of Isfary.  She is 21 years old and divorced.  She lives with her mother who works in a school.  Shahnoza works in sewing.  She has been sewing dresses for more than four years.  She takes orders for sewing at home.  She is requesting a loan to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es:
José, se dedica a la agricultura, vive con sus padres y hermanos, es soltero, no tiene hijos recibe ayuda de unos hermanos. Su trabajo lo aprendió de su padre, quien siempre se ha dedicado a lo mismo no tiene horario establecido posee mucha experiencia en su negocio.
Necesita capital para continuar trabajando es por ello que nos  ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de insumos para la producción tales como: abonos, insecticidas, herbicidas.
El préstamo le ayudara de una manera directa ya que le permitirá contar con todo lo necesario para trabajar y así obtener buena cosecha, las expectativas que el espera es con los préstamo  tener su propio hogar, su casa, su familia y tener éxito en su trabajo
texts.en:
Jose is a farmer. He is single and lives with his parents and siblings - he does not have children. Some of his siblings help him. He learned his work from his father who has always done the same thing. He doesn't have a set schedule, but has a lot of experience in his trade.

He needs capital to continue his work which is why he has asked for a loan to buy inputs for production like compost, insecticides, herbicides.

The loan will directly help him because it will give him everything he needs to work and get a good harvest. His expectations from the loans are to have his own home, family and be successful in his work.

loans.use: to buy compost, insecticides, herbicides.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Flora requested a 20,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy additional grocery items such as snack foods, charcoal and other miscellaneous items.

She has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future, Flora would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items such as snack foods, charcoal and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Zeyad

texts.en:
Zeyad is photographed in his car repair and wash business.

Zeyad is a single young man. For the past two months he has been operating a car wash located in a good traffic area. This has been a profitable project and the only source of income for him.

Zeyad is requesting a US $2,000 loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing a new vehicle repair kit and a collection of car accessories. This will attract more customers to repair their cars and increase the business's capacity to wash more cars. This will increase his income.

loans.use: To purchase a new vehicle repair kit and a collection of car accessories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To cover his university fees

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en: Thelma is a strong-minded individual who aims to become successful someday. She is 37 years old and has three children. Through her patience and hard work, she is able to support the needs of her family but unable to save funds for the educational purposes of her children. Therefore, she wants to increase her sales at her retail store. To further make this possible, she is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy soaps, biscuits, noodles, eggs, candies and toothpaste for resale. She believes this loan would be of great help in making her business productive.

loans.use: to buy soaps, biscuits, noodles, eggs, candies and toothpaste for resale.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard, 32, is a married entrepreneur from Gata Daku, Clarin. He has three children. Richard is earning income from his transport service business. It has been in operation for almost three years, and he earn 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month. To improve business, he is borrowing the amount of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC microcredit, which he just joined recently, to obtain accessories and tires. Before long, he’s hopeful of the possibility of expanding his business.

loans.use: to obtain accessories and tires.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en: Noemi is 47 years old and married with two children. Noemi works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery products to sell in her store. Noemi has borrowed and paid back 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 18 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane. Noemi aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items such as shampoo, canned goods, coffee, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Noralyn

texts.en: To make a living, Noralyn has been engaged in a piggery business for over five years. Her business serves as a source of income for the family that helps provide their daily needs. Noralyn is 40 years old, married and has four children. She wants to expand her family business. That’s why she is asking for a loan of 9,000 Philippines pesos to purchase feed and vaccines for her hogs. Despite the hardships of life, she is striving hard to earn and save for future purposes.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vaccines for her hogs.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Being a responsible mother, Ofelia runs a business to generate income for her family. She is 49 years old and has four children. With the large number of  family members, their expenses keep on growing. Therefore, she wants to earn more income to meet her family’s needs and save funds for future use. 

Ofelia is requesting a 9,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines. She believes that through the loan, her patience and sacrifice will help her to make her business grow.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines.

loans.name: Hermogena

texts.en: Hermogena is 51 years old and is married to Bernardo, a father who manages their farmland. Hermogena lives in the village where she generates income. She has been in her street food vendor business for five years and usually earns about 2,000 PHP per week. Hermogena wants to have additional food to sell. To make it possible, Hermogena is asking a loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP to buy hot dogs, chicken meat, pork and eggs to resell. She hopes that she can get the amount she requested to further develop her business.

loans.use: to buy hot dogs, chicken meat, pork and eggs to resell.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda, 59, is unsatisfied with the income from her business because it is not enough to cover the family's necessities. She sells fish in the village after long hours of fish catching in the river. Her sons help her with catching fish, but unfortunately, Erlinda’s income is still insufficient for her seven children. She is now requesting a loan of 7,000 Philippines pesos to buy fish and pay for maintenance to the fishing boat. She hopes that someday, they will experience a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fish and pay for maintenance to the fishing boat.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa works hard to support her family. Teresa is single and has a rice retailing business in the Philippines.

Teresa requested a 15,000 Philippines pesos loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Teresa has been in this business for five years, and she also earns additional income from pig fattening.

In the future, Teresa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Ramela

texts.en:
Ramela is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 12,000 Philippines pesos through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell to her customers.

Ramela has been in this business for three years. Ramela earns more income from selling frozen foods and from being an Avon dealer.

Ramela has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Khupting Lom Group

texts.en:
Helam (the one raising her hand in the photo) has three children. She assists her husband in their carpentry workshop. She does the work of smoothing and applying colours to their finished products. 

They make dressing tables, beds, wardrobes, and much other furniture as per the choices and demands of the customers. Most of the time, they are unable to meet the demands of the customers due to the unavailability of wood. 

Helam wants to utilise the loan to purchase and stock more wood.

loans.use: to purchase wood for her carpentry works.

loans.name: Lily

texts.es: Lily, de 33 años, es una mujer alegre, dinámica y muy trabajadora, es conviviente con su pareja con quien tiene dos hijos de 18 y 16 años por quienes se esfuerza en sus labores económicas, vive junto a ellos y a su cónyuge en su casa propia que construyó en el terreno que su padre le regaló. El trabajo de Lily consiste principalmente en la venta de sandalias de diversas tallas y diseños, básicamente su público es femenino porque considera que son mas responsables en el pago crediticio, sus clientes son sus amigas y vecinas. Lleva en este negocio cerca de 2 años y trabaja sola. Su otra fuente laboral desde hace 5 meses es la venta eventual de cosméticos bajo el sistema de pedidos por catálogo y además tiene 4 mototaxis que alquila a diario y por tal actividad recibe un ingreso correspondiente a cada vehículo. Todas estas funciones le brindan buenos resultados por lo que sus ingresos están siempre asegurados.  Le gusta mucho su actividad ya que siempre trabajó con mucha tranquilidad en este negocio, no le demanda mucho esfuerzo y además que le permite tener el tiempo necesario para realizar las labores de su hogar. Espera poner una tienda relacionada a la venta de calzados y prendas de vestir. Este es el préstamo número 5 con la institución MFP agradece a todas aquellas personas que hacen posible su crédito ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado se siente a gusto con su banco comunal, pues  considera que es un grupo unido y solidario. Con el  monto solicitado 2500 soles, comprará mayor cantidad de sandalias y cosméticos que espera venderlos en su totalidad en poco tiempo.
texts.en:
Lily is 33 years old. She is a cheerful woman; energetic and very hard-working. She lives with her partner with whom she has two children, 18 and 16, for whom she works as hard as she can. She lives with them and her partner in her own house that she built on the piece of land that her father gave her. 

Lily's work consists mainly of selling sandals of various sizes and styles. Basically her clientele is female, because she considers them more responsible in making their credit payments. Her customers are her friends and neighbors. She has been in this business for around two years and works on her own. 

For five months, her other source of income has been the casual sale of cosmetics under the catalog order system. In addition, she has four mototaxis that she rents daily, and for this activity she receives income corresponding to each vehicle. 

All these activities are offering her good results, so her income is always assured.  She likes her business, as she has always worked very happily in it. It doesn't demand much effort from her and in addition it allows her to have the time necessary to do her housework. 

She hopes to set up a store related to the sale of footwear and articles of clothing. This is her fifth loan with the MFP institution and she is grateful to all those people who make her loan possible, as this way she will feel confident of moving forward with her business. Moreover, she feels at ease with her communal bank, as she considers it a close-knit and supportive group. 

With the amount of 2,500 soles applied for, she will buy a greater quantity of sandals and cosmetics which she hopes to sell in their entirety within a short time.

loans.use: To buy sandals and cosmetics.

loans.name: Gavino

texts.en: Gavino is 44 years old and married. He is from Sta. Cruz, Tangub City. He has three children who have helped him in taking care of their gardening business. They have been gardening for five years and earns PHP 3,000 a month. In 2011, Gavino joined GDMPC. He has requested a loan of PHP 6,000 to purchase fertilizer and pay weeding costs. He hopes for a bountiful harvest and to expand his cultivated area.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay weeding costs.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en: Nida is a business-minded woman. She is 54 years of age, married, and has six children. She has been in a variety store business and she has done this for three years. She would like to increase her sales so that she can provide for her family's needs. To make her business continually develop, Nida is asking for additional capital in the amount of PHP 7,000 to buy shampoo, sugar, cooking oil, cabbage, eggplant, and squash. With her hard work and determination, she believes that she will gain a higher income this time. This will be fruitful in improving their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, sugar, cooking oil, cabbage, eggplant, and squash

loans.name: Basilisa

texts.en: Basilisa is 65 years old and widowed with nine children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional products to sell. Basilisa has borrowed and paid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from pig fattening. She aspires to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: To buy additional products to sell.

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en: Lucita is 57 years old and married with four children. With two children in school, Lucita works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy more products to sell in her general store business. Lucita has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, soap, sugar, milk, canned goods, etc. In the future, Lucita would like to save enough to secure financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy more products for her general store business.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en: Lourdes is 64 years old and has three children. She is married and has two children who are in school. Lourdes is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Lourdes would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ma. Merly

texts.en: Ma. Merly is 43 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell. Ma. Merly has borrowed and paid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years. Ma. Merly aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Maa Kali Self Help Group

texts.en:
Maa Kali Self Help Group consists of 16 women from a village in Odisha. They formed a group to help themselves to share their problem and to solve their problem among them.
 
One of them is Surapriya, who was selected as the President of Maa Kali Self Help Group. The lady holding a notebook in the photo is Surapriya. Surapriya is 45 years old and is staying with her husband and her 16-year-old son. Her son is pursuing his intermediate in Science. She hopes to see him as an officer in a company. She has three acres of land in her village and she is using her land to grow sugarcane. Her husband is supporting her in this activity.
 
She has requested a loan of 320,000 INR, which will help her to purchase the required resources for sugarcane cultivation. She says a portion of the loan will help her to purchase sugarcane plants, fertilizers, and insecticides, and to cover operational expenses like labor charges.

loans.use: to purchase sugarcane plants, fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Maa Devi Shakti Self Help Group

texts.en:
Maa Devi Shakti Self Help Group is a group consisting of 11 members, all of whom are women. These entrepreneurs are very humble, hardworking and responsible people with good manners and lots of enthusiasm to improve their lives. A few years back, they were all facing the same kind of poverty, so they planned to start a grocery shop where they can provide basic household consumables to their customers. 

One of them is Mrs.Kamalini, who was selected as their president. Kamalini is a 35-year-old lady living with her husband and her three children, who are students. The lady standing in the extreme right wearing a white and yellow printed saree, is Kamalini. Her husband works as a labourer in a factory situated near to her village. She runs a grocery shop to help her husband financially. She sells rice, grains, lentils, edible oil, spices, biscuits, soap, detergent, hair oil, etc., in her shop. She has developed a very good relationship with her customers in the village. She likes the fact that she can cater to the needs of the people in her village. She has a plan to make her shop bigger and keep multiple things in her shop to satisfy her customers. She also wants to purchase items for her shop in bulk directly from the wholesalers. She has requested a loan to purchase items like toothbrushes, toothpaste, soft drinks, wheat flour, grains and other household consumables.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing toothbrushes, toothpaste, soft drinks, wheat flour, grains and other household consumables for her grocery shop.

loans.name: Jay Jagannath Group

texts.en:
Jay Jagannath group (named after the adorn Lord of Odisha) is located in Chhatapipal, a rural village of Bolangir district of Odisha, India. This group consists of four women who belong to the BPL (Below Poverty Line) category. People from the BPL category live on less than one dollar a day. Alladini, standing at the extreme left with raised hand, is the featured member of the group. She is 35 years of age and lives with her husband, two sons aged 10 & four, and three daughters of 15, 13, and seven, who are studying in the village school. 

Alladini is running a video shooting and photo studio at her village in a temporary house with the help of her husband and brother. She has a computer system, a digital still photo camera, and a normal video camera for her business. Apart from this she also sells milk from one cow. Alladini mainly works in her field and looks after the cow. 

Her husband and brother go to villages as per the order for video shooting from which in the regular season (from June to September) they earn 2000 Indian Rupees (INR) per month, and in the festival season (from October to May) they earn 5,000 – 8,000 INR per month. From the milk business she gets a monthly income of 2,000 INR. 

As Alladini has a big family consisting seven members, she faces a lot of problems managing her family expenses. Therefore she is planning to add some extra income to her family. By utilizing this loan she will purchase an advanced video camera and a cow to add to her income. Alladini  has also a strong determination to finish her half-constructed house as soon as possible for her residence and photo studio. 

The other three members of her group Hingula, Bidyutdamini and Damayanti are doing tailoring, cycle repair, and a grocery shop respectively.

loans.use: to buy a video camera

loans.name: Maa Santoshi Group

texts.en:
The name of this group is  “Maa Santoshi” (named after a Hindu goddess .This group was formed in the year 2009 and includes six women members who are in the Below Poverty Line category from the village of Chhatapipal in the district of Bolangir in Odisha; India. Bolangir district is one of the poorest districts in India. The main issue in Bolangir is migration for daily labor. Lata is one of the members of this group. She is standing second from the left in the photo in a blue colored sari. She is 31 years old and lives with her husband, two sons (8 & 6 years old) and one daughter (13 years old). All her children are attending school in the same village. She has a little patch of land where her husband cultivates vegetable. Lata is running a milk business since last 5 years. She has two cows. She purchased one of the cows with her previous loan. Lata is getting 10 liters of milk per day. Her husband supplies this milk to a milk processing unit in a nearby village. To maintain her family of five, the present income is insufficient and Lata is facing lots of financial trouble to manage her daily expenses. So, as there is growing demand for milk in her area, she will use this loan to purchase another cow of an improved variety to add some extra income to her family. Lata says this will help her to save some money for the marriage of her daughter and to provide a better education for her two sons. Lata has a dream of developing a dairy farm in the future and constructing a house.

The other five members of this group are Mira, Sabitri, Subarna, Santa, and Phaguni. They are running a grocery shop, a milk business and growing vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en: Jesusa is 58 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them. Jesusa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries in her general store. Jesusa has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as bread, snack foods, sugar, soap, etc. In the future, Jesusa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 43 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Agnes is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and insecticides for her farm. She has been farming rice for four years and also earns additional income from pig fattening. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to buy more farm lands.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides for her farm.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita is engaged in buying and selling vegetables in the local community. She is 41 years old, married and has five children. She has been in her business for three years and earns about PHP 250 a day. Right now, Lolita is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 6,000 to buy vegetables such as string beans, onion, squash, and so on. She hopes to obtain her request and increase her income to provide for her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy vegetables such as string beans, onion, squash. etc.

loans.name: Savoeurt's Group

texts.en: A resident from a rural area of Sangke district located in Battambang province, Cambodia, Savoeurt is a 51-year-old married mother of three kids. In order to secure her family’s finances, she has been growing rice as a primary source of income while her husband catches fish to sell. Savoeurt has been in the business for 30 years, earning approximately KHR 37,000 per day and leaving around KHR 13,000 for her savings, after deducting daily expenses. Savoeurt now needs money to buy fertilizers and rice seeds to use in her farmland. Thus, she is leading a group of three to request a loan with VisionFund. Savoeurt is a fourth-cycle client with VisionFund while her two fellow group members are the first-time clients. The previous loans, which have been paid back successfully, has enabled her to buy tractor for use in her rice-farming business. With her new portion of loan, she hopes to gain more yield so that her family’s living condition will improve remarkably.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and rice seed for farmland.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en: Milagros is 54 years old, married and has three children. To make a living, Milagros owns and operates a food stall. She has been engaged in her business for two years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities. Now, she is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase meat and vegetables to cook and sell. Milagros plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase meat and vegetables to cook and sell

loans.name: Nethale

texts.en: Nethale is married with three children. She is 40 years old and lives in Prenza, Tangub City. Nethale owns and operates a plot of farmland where she plants bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for 10 years and earns 3,000 PHP each month. She requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase farm chemicals. Nethale has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, since 2011. In the future, Nethale's plan is to save her returns in order to buy another plot of farmland.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals

loans.name: Loeng's Group

texts.en: Loeng ,age 47, is residing in the Battambang province’s Sangke district, Cambodia. She is married and a mother of six children, four daughters and two sons. One daughter and one son are currently in school while the rest are employed as garment factory workers. To make a living, she farms rice and sells dessert while her husband sells fish. Loeng is leading a group consisting of two members, both of whom are seven-time borrowers with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Loeng has completely paid back the past loans with success and they have enabled her to sustain her business, especially in leasing additional rice farmland. Now, both are seeking the same loan amount of 1,400,000 KHR each. For Loeng, her loan will be used to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes to maximize her yield so as she can maintain her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds

loans.name: Lorelee

texts.en: Lorelee lives in Clarin. She has been earning a living through providing transportation services for three years to support the needs of her child. She gets an income of 8,000 PHP a month for this business. For a 31-year old mother, there’s nothing more that can make her happy than to see her child successful in their studies. Without hesitation, Lorelee borrows 30,000 PHP from GDMPC microcredit to repair her transport vehicle used in her business. She joined GDMPC just this year. Her plan in the future is to hopefully improve her business.

loans.use: to repair her transport vehicle used in her business

loans.name: Heak's Group

texts.en: Heak is a 34-year-old married woman with four children, all of whom are still in school. Heak resides in a rural area of Prey Chhor district located in Kompong Cham province, Cambodia. She makes her living through a rice-farming business, which she has been involved in for 17 years. Each day, she earns approximately 16,000 KHR, but she is able to save only around 6,000 KHR, which is considered to be a very little amount of money in a six-member family. Due to unexpected climate change, which sometimes causes natural disasters that provides negative effect to her rice-farming business, she is now leading a group member, Pov, to request a loan of 600,000 KHR each. This will be the first loan for both of them with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizers and rice seeds to use in her rice field, to cover plowing fees, and to planting vegetables for extra income. Through this loan portion also, she hopes that her children can go as far as possible in terms of education and her current business grows at a fast pace.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds and pay the plowing fee

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Book Djoubo Keur Gallo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de crédit Book Djoubo  Keur Gallo regroupe 5 femmes très actives habitants le même village. Elles s’activent les unes dans l’agriculture et les autres dans l’élevage. Leur présidente, la dame Coumba avec son beau sourire, s’active dans le maraichage depuis plus de 30 ans maintenant. Avec le crédit, elle envisage d’acheter des semences oignons, carottes, de l’engrais et du fumier. Elle démarre sa journée à 6h du matin pour la terminer à 16 h du soir.
Elle est mariée et son activité lui permet d’appuyer son mari dans les dépenses de la maison.
Avec une augmentation de revenus, il envisage de faire une extension de son activité de maraichage.
texts.en:
The Book Djoubo Keur Gallo loan group has five female members, who are very active and all live in the same village. Some work in agriculture, while others work raising livestock. Their president is called Coumba (pictured with a beautiful smile), and she has worked for more than 30 years in raising cattle. With this loan, she plans to buy onion and carrot seeds, fertilizers, and manure. She starts her working day at 6 in the morning, and finishes at 4 pm.

Coumba is married, and her business allows her to support her husband with the household expenses. With an increase in her income, she plans to extend her market gardening business.

loans.use: To buy onion and carrot seeds, fertilizers, and manure for her business.

loans.name: Bendiara Group

texts.fr:
Mme KALIDJATA est  responsable du groupe BENDIARA. Mariée, elle est mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 23ans et le moins âgé a 14ans. Tous vont à l’école et elle a 07personnes en charge.

Mme gère un secrétariat public (saisie, photocopie) et vend des cartes de recharge depuis 12 ans. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché et ses clients sont les hommes et femmes.

Elle veut s’acheter 04cartons de rame de papier, 05lots de chemise et 05boites de bic (stylo) toute couleur.

Avec ses économies, elle veut améliorer son activité. Mme ambitionne agrandir son secrétariat, employé plus de personnel et assurer la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
Kalidjata is in charge of the Bendiara group. She is married, and a mother to four children. The oldest of her children is 23, while the youngest is 14 years of age. They all go to school, and she has seven people under her care.

Kalidjata has managed a business offering secretarial services (typing, photocopying) and selling telephone recharge cards for the past 12 years. She gets her supplies in the large market, and her customers are both male and female.

Kalidjata wants to buy four boxes of paper, five batches of shirts and five boxes of pens of assorted colors. With her savings, she wants to improve her business. She plans to expand her secretarial business, employ more people and ensure that her children are educated.

loans.use: To buy four boxes of paper, five batches of shirts and five boxes of pens of assorted colors.

loans.name: Modou

texts.fr:
Modou, âgé de 35 ans fait de la menuiserie aluminium depuis plus de 10 ans. Il est marié et père d’un enfant âgé de 2 ans. Il a longtemps voulu faire ce métier depuis le jeune âge. Il vient solliciter pour la 1ère fois un crédit de 500000 F CFA pour acheter une machine de coupure aluminium et diminuer ses charges car il payer pour ce service à d’autres menuisiers qui détiennent cette machine.
Modou commence sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 18h du soir. Il reçoit beaucoup de commande du voisinage.
Comme projet futur, il aimerait ouvrir un grand atelier de menuiserie aluminium.
texts.en:
Modou is 35 years of age, and has worked with aluminum for the past 10 years. He is married and a father to a 2-year-old child, and has always wanted to have this job from a very young age. 

Modou has just requested for the first time a loan of 500,000 francs CFA. He plans to buy an aluminum-cutting machine and reduce his charges, as he currently pays other individuals with these machines to carry out this service for him. He starts work at 9 in the morning, finishes at 6 pm, and receives a lot of orders from his neighbors.

In the future, Modou would like to open a large aluminum workshop.

loans.use: To buy an aluminum-cutting machine for his aluminum workshop.

loans.name: Dieu Peut Tout 2 Group

texts.fr: DIEU PEUT TOUT 2 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Prisca (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 34 ans et est mariée à un certain Magloire. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés dont un reste à leur charge. Prisca et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges des enfants. Prisca a arrêté l’école au cours primaire. Il y a une dizaine d’année que Prisca vend de la bouillie et du pâté dans son quartier. Prisca exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Prisca s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d’augmenter son fonds de roulement, Prisca sollicite un crédit avec les autres membres du groupe DIEU PEUT TOUT. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
"Dieu peut tout 2" is a group of 3 people whose members live in the same district. The group's representative, Prisca (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 34 years old and married to Magloire. The couple have 3 children, all of whom are, or have been, attending school and one of whom is still dependent on them. Prisca and her husband live together with their children and the couple both take care of the various responsibilities associated with the children.

Prisca left school at primary level. She has been selling porridge and paté in her area for around 12 years. She is passionate about her work, which enables her to meet her needs and those of her children. She gets her supplies at a market in Benin. In pursuit of her customers' satisfaction and in order to increase her working capital, Prisca is requesting a loan, together with the other members of the "Dieu peut tout 2" group. This loan will be used to better respond to their customer demand and to earn more profits.

loans.use: to buy corn, sugar and wheat flour.

loans.name: Séraphin

texts.fr: Séraphin est âgé de 33 ans et vit au Bénin. Séraphin a très peu fréquenté l’école. Séraphin est marié à un certain Madeleine. Le couple a quatre enfants à leur charge, dont certains scolarisés. Parmi les enfants, il y a un qui n’est pas leur propre enfant. Séraphin vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec sa femme, les charges de la maison. Afin d’assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Séraphin mène comme activité depuis une dizaine d’année, la couture. Parallèlement à cette activité, Séraphin vend des noix de palme dans sa région. Séraphin s’approvisionne dans sa région. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Séraphin sollicite pour la troisième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt lui permettra certainement de rehausser le niveau de son activité et de se faire plus de profits. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Séraphin is 33 years of age, and lives in Benin. He did not attend school for very long, and is now married to a woman called Madeleine. The couple has four dependent children, some of whom are at school. One of these children is not the couple’s own. 

Séraphin lives with his wife and children, and together with his wife ensures that the household expenses are covered. To provide for his family, Séraphin has worked in sewing for about 10 years. He also works selling palm nuts in his region, and buys his supplies in the same region. 

In order to satisfy his customers and expand his sales and income, Séraphin has requested his third loan from Alidé. This loan will allow him to increase his business levels and make more profits. His first two loans were successfully repaid.

loans.use: To buy palm nuts.

loans.name: Ayimevo Group

texts.fr: AYIMEVO est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Armandine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 25 ans et est mariée à un certain Eric. Le couple a deux enfants, dont un scolarisé et à leur charge. Armandine et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges des enfants. Armandine a peu fréquenté l’école. Il y a près de dix ans que Armandine mène comme activité la vente de tissus, des savons et des plastiques par le système de distribution. Armandine exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Armandine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Armandine sollicite un premier crédit avec les autres membres du groupe AYIMEVO. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
Ayimevo is a group made up of 3 people, whose members lives in the same area of Benin. The group's representative,  Armandine (whose hand is raised in the picture), is 25 years old and married to Eric. The couple have 2 children, one of whom attends school and is dependent on them. Armandine and her husband live together with their children and together they take care of the different responsibilities associated with the children.

Armandine had little schooling. She has been selling fabrics, soaps and plastic items via the distribution system for nearly 10 years. She works with passion, which enables her to meet her needs and those of her children. Armandine gets her supplies at a market in Benin. In the pursuit of customer satisfaction, Armandine is requesting a first loan, together with the other members of Ayimevo. This loan will be used to better respond to the demands of their clientèle, and to earn more profits.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, soaps and plastic items.

loans.name: Dieu Est Capable Group

texts.fr: DIEU EST CAPABLE est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Afiwa Germaine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 30 ans. Afiwa Germaine ne vit plus avec son mari et est est mère de deux enfants tous scolarisés dont aucun n’est à sa charge. Afiwa Germaine vit seule et assure seule ses différents besoins. Afiwa Germaine a peu fréquenté l’école. Il y a près de quinze ans que Afiwa Germaine mène comme activité la vente des friperies de façon ambulante. Afiwa Germaine exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins. Afiwa Germaine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Afiwa Germaine sollicite un premier crédit avec les autres membres du groupe DIEU EST CAPABLE. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
"Dieu est capable" is a group composed of 3 people, whose members live in the same area of Benin. The group's representative, Afiwa Germaine (whose hand is raised in the picture), is 30 years old. Afiwa Germaine no longer lives with her husband, and is the mother of 2 children, both of whom have had schooling and neither of whom is dependent on her. She lives alone and is self-sufficient.

Afiwa Germaine did not get much schooling. She has been selling second hand clothing on the street for nearly 15 years. She works very hard, which enables her to meet her needs. Afiwa Germaine gets her supplies at a market in Benin. In the pursuit of customer satisfaction, Afiwa Germaine is requesting a first loan, together with the other members of "Dieu est capable". This loan will be used to better respond to the demands of their clientèle, and to earn more profits.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothing.
